loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel is 36 years old and manages a school canteen business where she sells cooked noodles, biscuits, juice, candies, native cakes and other kinds of snacks. Razel has had this business for six years and she can able to earn about PHP 5,000 monthly. She has three children and they are generally in school-aged. Razel is married to Jerry who is a carpenter.

Razel is grateful because her business is growing but still she wants to improve it because of the high cost of commodities. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from KIVA lenders and ASKI. She will use the loan to buy additional biscuits, soft drinks, junk foods, breads, candies and noodles.

The couple is aiming to make their school canteen more productive by borrowing additional capital from the lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional biscuits, soft drinks, junk foods, breads, candies and noodles

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya owns a retail business that sells various agricultural products, including seeds, fertilizers, and bug killers. Yuliya has a large assortment of products, affordable prices, and a good reputation at the market. She has many repeat clients who buy items from her to use on their gardens.

Yuliya has been in this business for 13 years. The business is seasonal; she sells most of her items in spring and summer. In this particular area, many people grow a lot of vegetables, so Yuliya's business is very useful to them. 

Yuliya would like to borrow 20,000 UAH to purchase seeds and fertilizers for retail sale. She hopes to develop her business even more and to have more clients who will use her services. Yuliya lives with her husband, Alexander, and their son and daughter. Their son is a college student.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for retail sale.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is 34 years old, married with four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of the children are getting their education by going to a nearby school and the youngest one is too young.  
Nasreen is a housewife as well as a business lady. She sells decorative pieces (like vases, paintings, etc) to different gift shops. Her decorative pieces sell for a very reasonable profit. She is also a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well. Her husband works in a factory for a reasonable income every month. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her own business. With the loan, she will buy decorative pieces in a larger quantity, which will help her earn a better income. She has 18 years of experience in her work and has a good clientele base. She is hopeful that an investment will bring good financial changes to her business. 
She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy decorative pieces to sell

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is married and has two adult children. 

He owns a small business growing vegetables in green houses. This business is the only source of income that supports Alexei’s family. He has been in this business for 30 years. Alexei enjoys his business very much and is an example of a good and hard-working person. 

Alexei is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to purchase seeds, fertilizers and materials to fix his green houses. Alexei hopes to harvest good crops and take better care of his household.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and materials to fix his green houses.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en: Mr.Bayarsaikhan is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children (aged one and two) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Bayarsaikhan’s wife Dolzodmaa works as a human resource manager in private company. Bayarsaikhan’s mother is helping his family to look after the kids during when they are at work. Bayarsaikhan is a taxi driver with 9 years experience. He works around 12 hours a day and has managed to buy a family car which he uses as a taxi and a plot of land with his savings. Next year he is planning to build a family house on his plot. He has paid two million tugruks as advance payment for the land, but he still needs to pay one million tugruks more to close the deal. Bayarsaikhan is asking for a loan to pay for the remaining payment and the right to register it in his name.

loans.use: To pay the remaining payment for the plot of land he bought, and to get the right to register it in his name.

loans.name: Yokubchon

texts.ru: Шарипов Ёкубчон проживает в районе Вахдат. Ему 27 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он уже два года. В основном он развозит людей по маршруту Вахдат – Душанбе - Вахдат. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Yokubchon S. lives in the Vahdat district.  He is 27 years old, married and has two children. His wife is a homemaker.  Yokubchon provides a taxi service and has been in this business for two years.  He primarily drives people on the Vahdat-Dushanbe route.  He is requesting this loan in order to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Shurentsetseg

texts.en: Mrs.Shurentsetseg is a 58-year-old widow. She lives with her youngest daughter and grandaughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in Shurentsetseg’s family house. Her daughter is a teacher at the Pedagogical Institute and is currently working on her PhD degree. Mrs.Shurentsetseg has been running a tailoring business since her retirement in 1999. She specializes in making traditional Mongolian national dresses. Usually she has a plenty of clients, especially before national celebrations, weddings and school graduations. She earns more money than her pension per month and she is very happy that she brings some income to the family. She is applying for a loan to buy more materials to make national dresses for the approaching school graduation ceremonies. National dresses become more popular during school graduations.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make national dresses for school graduation ceremonies.

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.ru: Улчаев Абдували проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Абдували зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он закупает несколько голов бычков, откармливает и продает по более выгодной цене. Этим видом деятельности Абдували занимается 5 лет. Кредит берет для закупа бычка и мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Abduvali U. lives in the Yavan district.  He is 45 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Abduvali earns a living by raising cattle. He buys several heads of cattle, fattens them up and sells them at more profitable prices.  Abduvali has been involved in this type of business for five years.  He is requesting this loan to buy a bull and small livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a bull and small livestock

loans.name: Irshaad's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad is a resident of Faisalabad, which is a big city in Pakistan famous for its textile industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Dawood Nagar. She is 55 years old, married to S. J. and has three children. Her elder son operates a gent's beauty salon and the second son is a daily wage labor. Her daughter Shakila is studying. Irshaad is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of her children. She is still very active at the age of 55 and completes her daily tasks efficiently.  Her husband is a daily wage laborer. He worked very hard all through his life to raise his children. 
 
Irshaad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her eldest son's beauty salon business. With the loan, he will buy beauty products like creams, masks etc to offer better services to his customers and increase his profits. Irshaad is hopeful that an investment will make a better impact on her son’s business and make him more income than before.  Irshaad is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She is confident that it will give good financial results to her son in his business.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Irshaad.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase an electric machine and other necessary tools  for his metal shop

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 36-year-old lady. To support her family financially, she operates a business sewing clothes. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month due to her good quality work. In addition to her clothes sewing business, she also manages her household work very well.  
She is married with four children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her husband operates a grocery store in the community market. At his store, he offers daily use items like sugar, cooking oil, spices etc to his clients at cheap rates. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will put more groceries in his store, which will allow him to fulfill the demands of his clients and earn extra profits. Shamshad is hopeful that an investment will grow her husband’s business and allow her family to enjoy better living facilities. 

She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shamshad.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Ульжаева Раъно проживает в районе Яван. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем, имеет 6 детей. Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации на заработках, а дети живут отдельно. Сама Раъно занимается животноводством. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже три года. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Rano U. lives in the Yavan district.  She is 46 years old, married and has six children.  Her husband works in the Russian Federation, and their children live on their own.  Rano is involved in animal husbandry.  She raises livestock for subsequent sale.  Rano has been in this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Veenus' Group

texts.en:
Veenus runs a beauty salon. She is a professional beautician and offers bridal makeup, facials and beauty services to her clients. She is very much an expert in her work and has a good number of clients who get her services regularly. She is also a very good housewife and manages her household responsibilities very well.  
She is 47 years old married with five children. Her eldest daughter is also a beautician. She got her training from Veenus and now helps her handle her clients. The other four are studying in a local school. Her husband is a factory worker.   

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her beauty salon business. With the loan, she will purchase beauty products & cosmetics such as face creams, masks, hair creams, lipsticks, nail polishes, eye shadows, mascara, etc to offer better quality services to her clients.   
She is hopeful that after the loan, her business will grow further and she will be able to earn a better income.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Veenus.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more milk for resale.

loans.name: Cristomie

texts.en: Cristomie is 43 years old and married with two school-aged children. His wife is a housekeeper. Cristomie is a farmer working in the Philippines. He has been growing corn for 20 years and earns approximately PHP 12,000 monthly. Cristomie is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds to be planted in his 2.0-hectare farm. He wants to maintain his business for the future of his family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en: Mr.Erdenebayar is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His children attend a local secondary school. Erdenebayar has been running a tailoring family business since 2004 with the help of his wife. Untill 2008 they used to make fur hats from different animal furs and in 2008 they started making Mongolian national dresses only. They use their home as a workshop. Mongolian national deresses are fashionable nowadays, especially before the national celebrations, weddings and school graduations ceremonies. Not many tailors can make them because it requires special, inherited skills. Mr.Erdenebayar is asking for a loan to buy one more sewing machine and more silk materials to make national dresses for his customers.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for leather materials and more silk materials to make national dresses for his customers.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a married woman with four children. She is 49 years old and has had a fish selling business for six years already. She is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fish and new products like frozen goods and native chickens to sell and earn additional profits.

Her husband, on the other hand, drives a transport motorcycle to add to their daily income. Each month, Fely as she is commonly called, earns PHP 8,000 net income. This helps her support their daily needs, especially her children's education.

She dreams that her business will become more productive so she can continue to send her children to school and to give her family a progressive standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fish and new products to sell like frozen goods and native chickens

loans.name: Japhet Odondi

texts.en: Japhet is 37 years old, married, and has five children. He is a mechanic who does vehicle repairs. He has been in this business for 10 years. Japhet is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase a tool box. He will use the anticipated profits to build his own workshop and he hopes to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Simon Gathogo

texts.en: Simon has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past 15 years.  He is 52 years old, married, and has five children.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his previous loan of 30,000 KES in a timely manner.  He plans to use the loan  to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Simon hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 46 years old and married with two school-aged children. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products in the community. Gloria has had this business for 12 years and she earns approximately PHP 8,000 monthly.

Gloria is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional products to sell like rice, frozen foods and drinks. She hopes that through the loan, she will acquire more customers and gain more income.

In the future, Gloria hopes that her business will improve to support the needs of her family, especially the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like rice, frozen foods and drinks

loans.name: Abed Al Ilah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has two children.

Abed has had a restaurant since 2007. Here he prepares all kinds of chicken and Iraqi food dishes. He gained three years of experience from his father who was working in the same field and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting $3,000 to buy a grill chicken machine and refrigerator. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a grilled chicken machine and refrigerator.

loans.name: Peter Mwiingi

texts.en:
Peter, 47 years old, married to Veronicah Wanjikuhas, and the father of one child, has practised farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last 10 years. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of his friends, and this will be his second loan, his previous one repaid in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labour.

In the future, Peter hopes to become a leading poultry farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labour.

loans.name: James Mwangi

texts.en: James has operated his motorbike bicycle repair shop in Naivasha town for the past seven years.  He is 64 years old, married, and has children. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy spares for motorbikes and bicycles. In the future, James hopes to expand his his business and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase spares for motorbikes and bicycles

loans.name: Kennedy Odhiambo

texts.en: Kennedy has been selling movie and music DVDS in Naivasha town for the past 10 years.  He is 32 years old, married, and has two children. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He repaid all his previous loans in a timely manner.  He plans to use the loan to add a new collection of music and movie CDs and DVDs. In the future, Kennedy hopes to expand his shop and stock more movies and music DVDS.

loans.use: To add a new collection of music and movie CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Enkhbazar

texts.en:
Mr.Enkhbazar, a 27-year-old single man, lives with his mother and younger brother in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. His mother lives on a disability allowance and his brother attends a secondary school. Enkhbazar rents a stall inside the shopping center and sells mobile phone equipment including phones, phone covers, batteries, accessories and some spare parts. His business is the only source of income for the family.

He is planning to expand his enterprise and so is requesting this loan to buy mp3, mp4, and Flash players, earphones, and a variety of mobile car accessories to sell.

loans.use: to buy mp3, mp4 and Flash players, earphones, and various mobile car accessories to sell.

loans.name: Joseph Maina

texts.en: Joseph is 35 years old and has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town for the past five years.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and this will be his third loan.  He repaid all his previous loans in a timely manner.  He plans to use the loan to buy more goods to sell in his retail shop. In the future, Joseph hopes to expand his retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase more retail goods to sell

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has two children.

Haydar opened an auto repair shop in 2009. He has good experience in this field. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1,500 loan to buy a nozzle cleaning machine. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a nozzle cleaning machine.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a very hardworking & supportive lady. She operates a business sewing clothes at her home for her community clients for the purpose of sharing the financial burden with her husband. She learned about this art from her mother and it is paying her off well. The income she earns helps her pay her utility bills and manage other household expenses. 
She is married with three children: two sons and a daughter. Shazia knows the importance of education. That’s why she has enrolled all of her children in school to get an education. Her husband is 31 years old and deals in scrap. He sells scrap to different factories and other scrap dealers. He is very good at his services. 
  
Shazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy scrap such as used papers, plastic bottles, etc to sell. She hopes that this will help her husband to fulfill his client's orders on time and earn more profits. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. With her previous loan, she proved herself as a responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting.

loans.use: To buy scrap

loans.name: Dominic Kariithi

texts.en: Dominic has been a farmer in Naivasha town for the past 16 years.  He is 51 years old, married, and has three children.  He was introduced to KADET by one of the field officers and this will be his third loan.  He repaid all his previous loans in a timely manner.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mohanad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has five children.

In 2000, Mohanad opened a shop for mobiles and electronic materials. He has good experience and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting $3,000 to pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy more kinds of materials. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy more materials.

loans.name: James Wanyoike

texts.en: James has operated his metal works shop in Naivasha town for the past three years.  He is 55 years old, married, and has four children. He was introduced to KADET by one of the field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He repaid all his previous loans in a timely manner. He plans to use the loan to build a new workshop in Naivasha town. In the future, James hopes his business will grow to enable him employ more people as he increases his income.

loans.use: To build a workshop

loans.name: Jecinta Wanjira

texts.en: Jecinta has been a dairy farmer in Naivasha town for the past four years.  She is 25 years old, married, and has one child. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and this will be her fourth loan.  She repaid all his previous loans in a timely manner.  She plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow. In the future, Jecinta hopes to become a leading supplier of farm produce in Naivasha.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married and has one child.

In 2009, Ashraf opened a bakery where he makes different kinds of bread. He inherited this work from his father and he has five years experience. He is well known in his area. 

He is requesting $2,400 to buy an automatic oven. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy an automatic oven.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married with four children at the age of 42 years. To earn more income, Norma ventures in different businesses such as direct selling of beauty products, retailing of cell phone load and charcoal vending in their village. Through these businesses, she generates an income of approximately PHP 9,000 a month. She has been in these activities for five years.

With her desire to make her businesses more progressive, especially her direct selling, Norma opted to take a PHP 50,000 loan from ASKI and KIVA lenders. She will use the amount to purchase beauty products such as lotion, lipstick, make-up and powder.

Norma hopes that her business endeavors will become successful.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products such as lotion, lipstick, make-up and powder

loans.name: Joshua Maina

texts.en:
Joshua is a 39-year-old, married man. He and his wife have two children. For the past nine years, he has farmed in Naivasha town to earn a living.

His friend introduced him to KADET LTD, and this is the third loan he has sought from the organization. Notably, he successfully repaid both of his previous loans, and he did so in a timely manner on both occasions. He plans to use the loan proceeds to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Joshua hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: open a new shop and purchase more inventory

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married and lives with his wife.

Fadel has a food market selling cheese, juices, bread, dairy products and frozen meats. He has 18 years experience in this field and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting $3,000 to buy a generator and to buy more products for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator and more products for his market.

loans.name: John Kiiru

texts.en:
John has been practicing farming in Naivasha town for the last four years.  He is 46 years-old, married to Jane Wambui and they have four children.  

John was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by one of our field officers.  This will be his first loan.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bircakhan

texts.en: Bircakhan Mammadov is a hard-working, entrepreneur from Agsu city. Six years ago he decided to open his own small grocery sales business. Today, his business is successful and he is looking to expand it further. Bircakhan has requested a loan of 1000 AZN so that he can purchase additional foods for his grocery. He plans to increase the variety of items he has available for customers to use in making an ever-popular delicacy. Bircakhan is married and has two children. One of his goals for his business is to be able to help his children as he can. We are happy for this opportunity to assist this responsible, dedicated business owner as he works to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase additional foods for grocery.

loans.name: Ghaith

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has two children.

Ghaith has a mobile shop where he buys and repairs phone. He has two years experience and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.


He is requesting $2,400 to buy a laptop and to make an aluminum awning for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a laptop and to make an aluminum awning for his shop.

loans.name: Koilel Ole

texts.en:
Koilel has practised farming in Naivasha town for the last seven years.  He is 45 years-old, married to Wanja I. and they have two children.  

He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by one of his friends and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Koilel hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: John Karanja

texts.en:
John has practised farming in Naivasha town for the last four years.  He is 40 years-old, married to Leah Nduta and they have two children.  

He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie is married and 37 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells various products for daily use. Charlie has had this business for six years already. In the future, Charlie hopes to have a bigger store where she can offer stocks of commodities to her customers.

Currently, Charlie is earning PHP 5,000 from her store, which she spends to finance her family's expenditures. Aimed at generating a bigger income, she is borrowing a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase commodities like oil, vinegar, soy sauce, canned goods, spices, crackers, candies, breads and many more in bulk to make her retail business more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase oil, vinegar, soy sauce, canned goods, spices, crackers, candies, and breads in bulk

loans.name: Derick

texts.en:
Derrick is a married man with two children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  His greatest monthly expenses are food and transport.  

For the past eight years, he has operated a business of buying and selling goats and cows for meat. He sells at the market to his neighbours and passersby. Derrick faces a major challenge of high pricing and disease outbreak in his business. He dreams of establishing a butcher shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to purchase seven goats for his butcher shop. He decided to join Kiva partner Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase seven goats and cows for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Kamoki, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan famous for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Chajoki. She moved here 20 years ago. 

She is a housewife who stays at her home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very caring person and does her responsibilities very well. 
Her husband has a dairy business. He sells milk to his community clients and earns a good profit every month. Razia is the mother of four sons. Her eldest son has a shop selling milk and the second son sells goats and sheep to butchers. Her third son is 18 years old and stays at home. The youngest son is studying in class 4th. 

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo, which will help him increase the milk production and make more profits. He has been doing this business for the past 20 years and Razia hopes that another buffalo will prove beneficial for his dairy business.


Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Hotensiah

texts.en:
Hotensia has been operating her clothes shop in Naivasha town for the last two years.  She is 43 years old and is a single mother of three children.

Hotensia was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers.  This will be her second loan.  She repaid her previous loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use this loan amount to buy more clothes to sell.

In the future, Hotensiah hopes to grow her shop into a big boutique.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Qandifa

texts.en:
Qandifa is 55 years old.  She is married and has three children. The diligent search for a source of additional income has been a permanent and difficult task for Qandifa. After trying her luck at a variety of occupations, she decided to work in the area of poultry breeding. She started this business 9 years ago with the support of her husband. 

Now that Qandifa has experimented and acquired the necessary knowledge regarding this activity, she would like to expand her business by purchasing more poultry so that she can increase her earnings and continue to improve her family’s quality of life. Qandifa is requesting a loan of 900 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Alamiyya

texts.en:
Alamiyya is a 56-year-old mother of three daughters and three sons. Alamiyya's husband runs a small grocery store next to a wedding hall that attracts a good number of customers.

Alamiyya took out a loan from FATEN to help her husband add a few improvements to the store.  He wants to install a shade, fix the door and have a sign in front of the store.

Alamiyya's husband appears in the picture, as she is a religious woman. Her husband covers the household expenses from the store's income and pays for his youngest daughter education fees.

loans.use: to install a door, a sign and a shade for his store

loans.name: Philip Gitundu

texts.en:
Philip has been practising farming in Naivasha town for the last five years.  He is 62 years old, married to Irene Ngendo, and they have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of his friends.  This will be his third loan.  He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Philip hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gideon Wanyoike

texts.en: Gideon, 23, has operated a business in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the last three years. He also has a farm, and sells its produce in the local market. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend; this will be his second loan. He paid off his previous loan of KES 63,00 in good time. He plans to use this new loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Gideon hopes to buy a taxi and grow his farming into a large-scale operation.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sevindj

texts.en: Sevindj H. is a 32-year-old married mother who has been selling kids’ toys in a central, local shop for 7 years.  During these years, the business has become successful, allowing Sevindj to support herself and her family. Now she is planning to increase her stock and her range of goods, and to purchase the toys wholesale.  She is requesting a loan of 1500 AZN for this purpose. An active and strongly motivated client of AqroInvest since 2006, her credit history makes her eligible to receive new, larger loans. Sevindj thanks everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: to increase her stock and range of goods.

loans.name: Simon Gathogo

texts.en:
Simon has operated his barber shop in Naivasha town for the last seven years.  He also has a motorbike, which he has hired someone to operate. He is 38 years old, and married to Phylis Gathogo, with whom he has three children. 

Simon was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend; this will be his third loan. He paid off all his previous loans in good time. He plans to use the money to buy a new motorcycle.  In the future, Simon hopes to open another barber shop in town, as well as growing in the transport industry.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Muqqadas' Group

texts.en:
Muqqadas lives in Kamoki, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan famous for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Chajoki for the past eight years. She is a housewife as well as a working woman, Along with her household work, she does embroidery for her neighborhood clients. She is known as an expert in her work and provides good quality services to her clients. Her husband belongs to an agriculture profession. He works in his field and grows different seasonal crops to sell to his clients for profit. He works very hard all day in the field to fulfill the basic needs of the family. Muqqadas is the mother of two daughters and a five-month-old son. Both of her daughters are getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her husband who will use it on his field to get maximum output. Muqqadas is hopeful that the loan will enable her husband to get more profits from his business and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa is a young woman from Palestine, married and a mother of one daughter and one son. Both her children are school students. Safa's husband has a laundry shop that serves a good number of clients in the city where Safa and her family live. Safa's husband needs a steam iron to improve the services offered by his shop. Since he can't afford to buy it from the shop's income and keep running the house and shop, Safa took out a loan from FATEN to buy the Iron.

Safa's husband appears in the picture here in the laundry shop where he works instead of her, as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to purchase a clothes iron for the laundry shop

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a married man with six children, three of whom attend school and three of whom have graduated. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 16 years, Henry has been buying and selling fruits (e.g. mangoes and apples) from door to door, to his neighbors and to passers-by. His major challenges are the low season and the high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of expanding his business and educating his children so they can have a better future.  With his KES 5,000 loan Henry wants to purchase 16 sacks of fruit. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase 16 sacks of fruit.

loans.name: Phocas

texts.en: Phocas is 36 years old.  He is single and is working very hard in order to get himself out of poverty. He has been selling sorghum in the market for 7 years. He is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and make more profits, which he plans to reinvest so he can expand his business.  He dreams of being a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman is 34, a very courageous man who can manage tough jobs like fishing.  He is the father of four children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation, after much time Elman was able to get ahead through his business of purchasing and breeding fish. His greatest goal is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. Elman is a fisherman and usually buys fish from fish vendors early in the morning. He works seven days per week without weekends and holidays because fish is in very high demand  among local people. For this reason, Elman applied for 1,000 AZN loan to purchase more fish for his breeding business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a widowed woman with seven children, all of whom graduated from school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a business of buying and selling vegetables and fruits. She sells from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Esther also does farming which earns her another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of expanding her business and living a better life. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits to resell and to pay for transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits and to pay for transport.

loans.name: Thaciana

texts.en:
Thaciana is 37 years old. She has three children who are between the ages of 8 and 16. She owns a general store in which she sells several items such as sorghum, rice, maize flour and other items. She runs the general store together with her husband. 

She is requesting a loan to buy sorghum and beans to add to her store in order to make more profits. She plans to add the profits she hopes to make to her savings.

loans.use: to buy sorghum and beans.

loans.name: Metee

texts.en:
Metee is 29 years old and lives in Congo Town. She’s single and has three children. They all live with her parents and all are in school.

In 2005 Metee started selling slippers, hand bags, blouses and many other items from a waiter on her head. What she actually loves about this business is that she’s self employed.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase more slippers, hand bags, lappa (traditional dress) and used clothes to sell in the local market. She hopes to be an international business woman and build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers, hand bags, lappa and used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima lives in Chichawatni, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry.  
She is divorced and lives with her brother. She has two sons and two daughters who also live with her. Both of her daughters are studying. 
Ghulam Fatima is not a burden on her brother. She helps him run his grocery store in his absence. She also manages the household work efficiently. 
In the grocery store, her brother sells daily used items like cooking oil, salt, sugar & spices etc to his clients and earns income. 
Ghulam Fatima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother. Through the loan, her brother will put more groceries to his grocery store which will increase his sales and profits.
 
He has been operating this business for past 15 years and Ghulam Fatima is confident that an investment will put positive changes in his business and increase his income. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her brother.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Narcis

texts.en: Narcis is 42 years old. His wife is a farmer. He has five children who are between the ages of 7 and 19. He sells different food stuffs such as beans and wheat flour. He has done this business for ten years and it has enabled him pay school fees for his children. Narcis is requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs for sale and hence make more profits. He hopes to expand his business with the profits he hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy more food stuffs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. Jane also sells farm products which contributes another source of income. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. Jane dreams of establishing a retail shop business. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase a bundle of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hamidou Ousmane

texts.fr:
Né le 19 Octobre 1988 à Zégoua (frontière Mali-Côte d’Ivoire), Monsieur Hamidou Ousmane est un célibataire qui vit dans une famille élargie à Sanoubougou II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Hamidou Ousmane, n’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études s’est très vite initié depuis plus de dix années  aux activités d’achat et de vente de téléphones portables et de leurs accessoires (façade, batterie, chargeur, écouteur, etc.). Son activité est menée dans sa propre boutique à la gare routière de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée essentiellement de voyageurs et surtout de transporteurs. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant une année et avec laquelle il a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts, qui furent tous correctement remboursés. Ainsi, Il sollicite ce troisième crédit pour acheter à Bamako 30 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 2 cartons de façade, une quinzaine de chargeurs, 17 paquets de carte mémoire, 10 cartons de batterie, 8 douzaines d’écouteurs de différentes sortes, une dizaine de montres et des ceintures. 
Il espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on October 19, 1988 in Zégoua (on the border of Mali and Côte d’Ivoire) Mr. Hamidou Ousmane is a bachelor who lives with his extended family in Sanoubougou II, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).

Having never had the chance to complete his studies, Mr. Hamidou Ousmane, over ten years ago, very quickly launched into the business of buying and selling mobile phones and their accessories (face plates, batteries, chargers, headsets, etc).  He manages his business from his own stall at the main bus depot in Sikasso with a clientele made up of travelers and most of all transporters.  He is sought out by these clients for the quality of his products.

With the goal of better satisfying his growing clientele, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  It had been one year and he has already profited from two loans both of which he repaid fully and on time.  Now he is asking for a third loan to purchase boxes of batteries, 8 dozen headsets of different types, one dozen mounts and belts from Bamako.

With this loan, he hopes to earn a monthly profit of 300,000 FCFA which will be used to contribute to family expenses, to pay the interest on his loan, and to invest the remainder into his business.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Famory

texts.fr:
Agé de 28 ans, Monsieur Famory est marié, père d’un enfant et réside dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Wayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Famory, après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès notamment la vente de carburants, s’est finalement  initié au commerce d’articles divers pour  Alimentation (Eau minérale, boissons, Déodorants, cartes de recharge de téléphone Malitel/Orange,  etc.) Son magasin située à Wayerma I Sikasso et il exerce cette activité iI  y a environ cinq ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de trois années et est à son cinquième prêt individuel. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce  cinquième  prêt lui permettra d’acheter, 45 cartons de l’Eau minérale, 25 paquets de boisson NBB, 5 cartons de biscuits, 7 cartons de Déodorant, 600 cartes de recharge Malitel/Orange, etc. Ses marchandises sont achetées auprès de commerçants grossistes sur place et des représentants des deux réseaux de télécommunication avant de les revendre en gros et en détail à une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales de la ville.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
At 28 years old, Mr. Famory is married, the father of one child, and lives in a large extended family in Wayerma I, one of the working-class neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

Mr Famory, after having managed many businesses without success, notably the sale of fuel, finally began a business of selling various household items (mineral water, drinks, deodorant, rechargeable telephone cards from Malitel, Orange, etc.).  His shop is located in Wayerma I in Sikasso and he has conducted his business there for about five years.  He is very sought after because of the quality of his products. 

In order to better satisfy his growing clientele, over three years ago he decided to rejoin the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is on his fifth individual loan.  All former loans were properly paid back.  This fifth loan will allow him to purchase 45 boxes of mineral water, 25 packages of NBB drinks, five boxes of cookies, 7 boxes of deodorant, 600 rechargeable Malitel/Orange cards, etc.  This merchandise is bought from local wholesalers and representatives from the telecommunication companies before being resold wholesale and retail to a clientele made up of all social strata of the city.

With this loan, he hopes to earn a monthly profit of at least 300,000 FCFA which will be used primarily for growing his working capital, contributing to household expenses, and paying the interest on his loan.

loans.use: to purchase various household items for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a divorced woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a business of buying and selling fruit at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Previously she was a farmer and she sells farm produce, earning her another source of income. Mary faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding and purchasing a big farm in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase 30 bags of passion fruit and 10 bags of oranges. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 30 bags of passion fruit and 10 bags of oranges.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal was born 44 years ago, and she has three children who are between the ages of 18 and 28. They all live apart from the eldest who has completed high school. Marie sells green bananas on a wholesale scale, working together with her husband. 

They have done this business for twelve years and it has enabled them to meet their needs. Marie Chantal also makes banana juice from these green bananas and she sells it. She is requesting a loan to buy more green bananas to sell. She plans to save all her profits.

loans.use: to buy green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Nadela Development Group

texts.en: 26-year-old Susan has been operating her beauty salon business in Rubacon-Jinja for a period stretching to four years now. Susan, who is a mother of two and happily married, says she began her business with her modest savings from an earlier food sales business. Weekly she says this business generates her approximately $574 as profit. Susan says with this loan she is going to purchase more hair products and cosmetics for use at her beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase more hair products and cosmetics for use at her beauty salon.

loans.name: Henry Nyabuto

texts.en:
Henry has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  He is 47 years old, married to Ruth Njambi and they have eight children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of 20,000 KES well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Henry hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock more tea to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 40 years old, and she is currently in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. She is married to a farmer and they have five children, all of whom are in school. Her future goal is to buy more goods to support her business.

loans.use: to stock more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Leonille

texts.en:
Leonille is 56 years old. She has three children, the youngest of whom is 13 years old. The eldest finished high school and the youngest is currently in school. The other was not able to continue school. 

Leonille sells banana juice and sorghum, working with her husband. She has operated this business since 1975. She is requesting a loan to buy more banana juice and sorghum in order to make more profits. She plans to reinvest the profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy banana juice.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 25-year-old man from Palestine. Haytham is engaged and will get married this summer, Haytham is an employee with a decent salary, Haytham needed  $1000 to pay the wedding hall rent.

Haytham took out the loan from FATEN as it will be easier for him to repay FATEN than borrowing from relatives or friends.

loans.use: to rent the Wedding hall

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a divorced woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two months, she has operated a restaurant business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Hadija faces a major challenge of the high cost of buying goods in her business.  She dreams of buying her own plot of land and building a hotel in the future.  

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and kitchen utensils. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en: Nasira is 35 years old, married and has four children who range in age from two to 16 years old. Her husband makes a living as a driver while Nasira helps support the family by selling food items such as cassava flour, tomatoes and berries. She enjoys her work because it has allowed her to develop her abilities. She plans to use the additional profits earned from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia lives in Chichawatni, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a four-room house with her family in the area of Bilal Gunj. She moved here 10 years ago. She is married by status and her husband is involved in a wheat and rice selling business. He purchases wheat and rice from different farmers and sells to his clients for a profit.  Razia herself is an embroidery and sewing expert and works for her neighborhood clients. Due to her good quality work, she receives regular orders every month. She is also a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well. She has two sons and both of them are enrolled in a local school getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase wheat and rice in bulk quantity to sell. He has been operating this business for the past five years and Razia is confident that he will be able to profit well from his business after the loan.

loans.use: To buy wheat & rice to sell

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: Kidne G. is 40 years old, married to a farmer and makes a living by selling fish. She and her husband have four children, only one of whom is not yet in school. Her long-term goal is to build a house for her family to live in.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Geoffrey Kuria

texts.en: Geoffrey is 42 years old, married, has four children and has made a living as a farmer for the last three years. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of his friends and is applying for his first loan, which he plans to use to buy a cow for milking. In the future, he hopes to supply milk to people who live in a nearby town.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Peter Wanyoike

texts.en: Peter is 32 years old, married to Ann Muringe and the father of one child. For the last seven years, he has made a living as a farmer in the town of Naivasha. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and is applying for his first loan, which he plans to use to buy seeds and fertilizer. His goal is to become one of the leading farmers in his part of Kenya.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is 46 years old and has two children who are 20 and 19 years old. One of her children is still in a student, and her husband makes a living by selling food items. Valentine also sells food, including rice, beans and maize flour, but in a different location from her husband. She has been in this business for 14 years, and her work has allowed her to pay her children's school fees. She is applying for a loan to buy more food to sell. She hopes to make enough money to continue paying fees for the one child she still has in school.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease solar powered Solio gadgets

loans.name: Sinqobile Group

texts.en:
Nothando is 26 years old and sisngle, with 2 children who are 5 and 7 years old. She runs a spazashop (spazashops are small corner stores where you can buy food, drink and other basics) in Empangrni in Kwa Zulu Natal, South Africa. 
She's been in this business for a year and sells chips, sweets, fat cookies, biscuits, and pies. She also receives income from the government's child support grant. She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses to buy sweets, chips, fat cookies, biscuits and pies. 

She says that the extra income from this loan will help her live a better life, build her a house for her family and put her children through school. In the future, she hopes to see her business grow to be a supermarket and have employees. In the photo, she is pictured raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy sweets, chips, fat cookies, biscuits and pies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock more beans to sell.

loans.name: Sabougnima 02 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe sabougnima 02 est créé le18 Avril 2011. Il  compte neuf femmes qui habitent le même village.

Madame Kinégo (debout à l’extrême droit) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans, mariée et mère de six enfants.

Elle vend des fruits et légumes dans le marché hebdomadaire de sa localité. Elle a une bonne maîtrise de son activité pour l’avoir  pratiqué pendant plus dix ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de s’approvisionner en fruits et légumes.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’aider son marie dans la prise en charge scolaire et alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
The Sabougnima 02 group was established on 18th April 2011. It comprises nine women who live in the same village.

Mrs. Kinégo Bassène (standing on the extreme right) is in charge of the group. She is 53 years old, married and mother to six children.

She sells fruit and vegetables in the market at Diaobé. She masters her business well, having carried it out for over ten years. Her new loan will allow her to get fresh supplies of fruit and vegetables. The profits she makes will enable her to help her husband provide for the family's schooling and food expenses.

loans.use: to get supplies of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Uzma's Group

texts.en:
Uzma is a housewife who spends her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities.  She is very active and performs her daily routine tasks with a great sense of responsibility. She has given birth to two daughters. The elder one is in class one and younger one is only a year old. Uzma is a very good mother and takes care of her children very well. Her husband sells sweetmeat on his four-wheeled cart by visiting different areas of the city. Uzma helps her husband in his business by preparing the sweetmeat and arranging it on the cart.  

Uzma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. She wants to buy the required ingredients such as milk, sugar, cooking oil, dried fruits, etc., which enable her to prepare a larger quantity of sweetmeat to sell. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and has a good reputation among his clients due to his fresh quality and tasty sweetmeats. 
 
Uzma is hopeful that an investment will put her husband’s business in a more profitable position and increase his profits. 
She lives in Chichawatni, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Uzma.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make sweetmeat

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Baasansuren, 48, is married and lives with her husband and son in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her husband is a driver with a monthly salary of 220,000 MNT, and her son is a student. She runs a food cafe near Ih Buyan local market, in her town. She started her business in 2005. She prepares and sells Mongolian traditional meals including buuz, huushuur and tsuivan etc. Her business is quite profitable because of the good location.  She has managed to build a small cafe. 

She is a polite woman who is planning to continue her business in the future. She also is planning to remodel her cafe in order to improve the surrounding site and to broaden the selection of her menu. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials and some ingredients for her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Bayanjargal

texts.en:
Bayanjargal, 63, is married and lives with his wife in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Dornod province of Mongolia. All his children are grown up and live separately. He manages a vegetable trading business at a local market. He plants a variety of vegetables, such as tomato, cucumber, carrots, cabbage, and potatoes, etc. He is a polite man who is planning to continue his business in the future. 

He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new truck in order to transport his vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase a new truck

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto, 39 years old, is married to a housewife and blessed with four children. They harmoniously reside at Disimuray Cauayan City, Isabela, Philippines. He has been growing corn for almost 20 years. He earns PHP 23,000 at the last cropping. He is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase farm inputs. He is determined to work hard to supplement his family's daily needs. He hopes that Kiva will continue to give him financial assistance to improve their status in life.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda is 30 years old.  She's currently in the business of selling fruits.  She is married to a businessman and they have five children in school.   Her future goal is to stock more goods.

loans.use: to stock more fruit.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 31-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have four children, all of whom attend school.

To earn a living, Mary sells fish. She is seeking a loan to stock more fish that she could then sell to her customers. She hopes to construct a building for her business in the future with any additional profits.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Emerance

texts.en:
Emerance is a 37-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have five children, who are between the ages of 6 and 16 years old. Her husband is a carpenter.

Emerance owns a small shop, where she sells various everyday items such as soap and matches, as well as green bananas. Her business has enabled her to pay for her children’s school fees. She is requesting a loan to buy more green bananas. With the additional profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan, she plans to continue to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items, including green bananas.

loans.name: Nyork

texts.en:
Nyork is a 25-year-old, married woman. She and her husband do not have any children.

To earn a living, she is currently in the business of selling fish. Her husband, meanwhile, is a farmer. She is seeking a loan to expand her business by purchasing additional fish. She explains that her future goal is to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine is a 36-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have two children, who are 6 and 9 years old. Both of their children are in school.

To earn a living, Delphine owns a general store, where she sells food items such as beans, rice, and coffee. She runs this business with her husband, and she explains that they have operated the business for 12 years. She is now requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs, including beans and coffee. With the additional profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan, she would like to renovate her family's house.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items, including beans and coffee.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en: Majed is a young man who studied fine arts and specializes in making molds and clay work such as statutes, plates, paintings, etc. Majed works from home and sells to shops and individuals. Majed took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a machine that can help him make the molds he needs, which will make the work go faster. Majed's father is a farmer and his mom works in a sewing shop. Majed is photographed in the picture here.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to make clay molds

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a single woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has owned a school where children from the neighboring village are her students. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by parents who have enrolled their children and have not paid school fees. She dreams of expanding her school in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase school chairs and tables. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase school chairs and tables.

loans.name: Muso

texts.en:
Muso is married and has 4 children. He lives in Kumsangir, Tajikistan, and sells groceries from his food store. His vending location is well known for good prices that are lower than market prices. Muso knows his customers’ preferences and always offers them only good quality groceries. He has been in the grocery trade for about 4 years. His business has been marked with consistent stability.

Muso is hoping to invest a loan of $1000 USD in additional merchandise, which will help him increase his turnover capital eventually. Muso has a vision for the expansion of his trade, and we believe it will be helpful in his entrepreneurial endeavors. The loan will help Muso to persist, take small steps at a time, and achieve success.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuff for his grocery store

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is a mother of 2 children who are ages 1 ½   and 4 years old. They are both not yet in school. She sells foodstuffs, such as sorghum, beans and coffee, and she works with her husband. She has run this business for 5 years and it has enabled her to meet her family needs. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs and hence expand her business. With the profits and with her savings, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 46 years old.   She has 2 children who are 16 and 22 years old.  One is in school.  Her husband sells cows, and he also has a butcher store. 

Beatrice sells banana juice.  She buys it unpacked and packs it. She is requesting a loan to buy more bottles and bottle tops to pack her juice.

loans.use: to buy bottles and bottle tops.

loans.name: Jafar

texts.en:
Jafar is 36 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and mother. For more than 3 years, he has been selling cell phones and accessories. Jafar also has a good skills on the computer and provides a service  teaching computer programmers. Jafar believes that this business is profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family. 

Currently, his business is doing well, but Jafar needs to increase his stock of goods and also wants to buy a new computer in order to serve the demands of his clientele.   He requests 11,500 Somoni.  Jafar is grateful to all supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cell phones and a computer.

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en: Suzanne is 54 years old and is a widow.   She has 6 children, the youngest of whom is 3 years old.  All her children are in school.  Suzanne is hardworking. She sells a variety of food stuffs, including beans, cooking oil, rice, salt, etc. This business has enabled Suzanne to improve her standards of living.  She is requesting a loan to reinvest in her business by buying more food stuffs to sell.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs to resell

loans.name: Mahmanazar

texts.en:
Selling office supplies became the only source of income for Mahmanazar, a humble 49-year-old man who has been doing this for 19 years. Mahmanazar is married and is a father of 3 children. His children is the reason that he works hard in order to provide them with the best and a bright future. 

This young man has many projects for his future.  Mahmanazar's main project is to expand his store where he will be able to sell not only office supplies but also a great numbers of books. His current wish is to add more office supplies and therefore have more to offer to his clients. 

Mahmanazar would pay back this loan, and with the extra income earned he would be able to pay for his children’s education. This young man waits for your help. Let's make his dream come true.

loans.use: to buy stock for his office supplies business

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 7 years, Sylvia has been operating a tailoring business, selling to local customers and passersby.  Her major challenges are seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her tailoring business in order to meet her customers' demand. 

With the loan for Kshs 30,000, Sylvia wants to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Davlatbek

texts.en:
Davlatbek is a small business entrepreneur. He owns a grocery store and has much experience working in this sphere of trade. His business is known for its reasonable pricing policy and free delivery service. 

Davlatbek is always on the go. He is very determined and knows how to achieve his goals.   Davlatbek is seeking a loan of 6800 Somoni to purchase foodstuffs to expand his inventory. He is hoping to use the generated profit to finish remodeling his apartment, which he has not been able to complete due to financial constraints. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.
