To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff for his grocery store

loans.name: Kyerima Dembe Development Group

texts.en: 36-year-old God has been in the grocery store business for 4 years now. He operates from Kayunga. This happily married father of 5  sells mostly vegetables and fruits. He says he began this business with the persuasion of one of his closest friends. He is also in the motorcycle transportation business. Weekly, he says this business can generate for him 189,000 shillings in profit. He says he will use this loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Asinathe

texts.en: Asinathe is 52 years old.  She has 3 adopted children, one is in school while the other two are still too young for school. Her husband is a motorcyclist for hire.  Asinathe sells cassava.  She is also a farmer and owns a shop in which she sells items such as sugar, biscuits, matches, and bicycle tires. She has been running this business for 3 years.  Asinathe is requesting a loan to renovate her house.   She plans to continue renovating her house as she makes more income from her business.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Ширинова Дилором проживает в городе Худжанд. Возраст, 31 год. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Ее муж занимается бизнесом. Сама она уже год как занимается торговлей. В основном она покупает по низкой цене макулатуру и продает ее по более выгодной цене. Кредит берет для покупки макулатуры.
texts.en: Dilorom S. lives in the city of Khujand. She is 31 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works in business. She has been working in trade for a year. Basically she buys paper for recycling for a low price and resells it for a higher price. She is taking out a loan to buy paper for recycling.

loans.use: to buy paper for recycling

loans.name: Jesus-Marie Group

texts.fr: JESUS-MARIE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres  pratiquent tous la même religion et fréquentent la même Eglise. La représentante du groupe Lydie Amour (qui a la main levée sur la photo) est née le 27 juin 1985 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique. Lydie Amour est mariée à un militaire nommé Arouna. Le couple a deux enfants à charge, tous scolarisés dont un est leur propre enfant. Lydie Amour vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Cocotomey  dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Il y a près de quatorze ans que la famille s'est installée dans cette commune. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Lydie Amour vend depuis cinq ans divers produits (lait, sucre, savons...), des condiments de sauce (tomates  fraîches,  piments, oignons...)  et des produits cosmétiques à son domicile. Lydie Amour s'approvisionne à Dantokpa  marché international du Bénin, et parfois au marché de Cococodji. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Lydie Amour désire obtenir un autre financement, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en:
JESUS-MARIE is a group composed of three people whose members practice the same religion and attend the same church. The group’s representative, Lydie Amour (with her hand raised in the photo), was born on June 27, 1985 in Allada, in Atlantique county. Lydie Amour is married to a soldier named Arouna. The couple have two children to support. Both children are in school; one of them is their own child. Lydie Amour lives together with her children and husband in Cocotomey, in the commune of  Abomey Calavi. Nearly fourteen years ago, the family settled in this commune. Together, the parents ensure that the various family expenses are covered.

For five years, Lydie Amour has been selling various goods (milk, sugar, soaps...), sauce condiments (fresh tomatoes, chili peppers, onions...), and some cosmetics out of her house. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and sometimes at the Cococodji market. 

She is a previous ALIDé client who has repaid her past loans properly. With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying the demands of her customer, she would like to obtain more financing along with the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, baskets of fresh tomatoes, chili peppers, boxes of soap, and boxes of milk

loans.name: Siyathuthuka Group

texts.en:
Khanyile is a 54-year-old, married woman with 4 children, who are between the ages of 25 and 36 years old. Khanyile runs a tuckshop in Empangeni, Kwa Zulu Natal, South Africa. (Tuckshops are small corner stores where you can buy food, drink and other basics.) She has been in this business for 2 years and sells breads and cold drinks at her home. She also receives income from the government's old-age support grant. 

Khanyile requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses. She will use the loan to buy breads and cold drinks. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her build a house for her family.

In the future, Khanyile hopes to see her business grow in such a way that she employes someone to work for her.

In the photo, Khanyile is pictured raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy breads and cold drinks

loans.name: D. Benjamin

texts.fr: Né en Mars 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, Benjamin est marié à une photographe du nom de Louise et a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Benjamin s’est installé à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où il y vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Benjamin a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. C’est aussi un photographe. Parallèlement à cette activité, Benjamin  est gérant d’une buvette à Cotonou. Benjamin se ravitaille en boissons à Cotonou également. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Benjamin sollicite auprès de ALIDé un premier prêt.
texts.en: Born in March 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Benjamin is married to Louise, a photographer, and has three dependent children, all in school. Since about a dozen years ago, Benjamin has in Lokokoukoumè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, where he lives together with his wife and children. The spouses jointly provide for the family needs. Benjamin dropped out of high school. He also works as a photographer. Parallel to this activity, Benjamin manages a snack  bar in Cotonou. Benjamin stocks up on drinks in Cotonou. With the goal of expanding his business and better meeting his customers' needs, Benjamin is seeking his first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy Sobebra brand drinks

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with three school-going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a tailoring business from her home, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Alice faces a major challenge of competition from other tailoring business operators in the area. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase cloth materials and Lesos for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and Lesos for resale

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda is married with 4 children. She sells kid's clothing at the central market and has been in this business for 8 years. Her extensive experience helps Mavluda to choose the right kind of inventory and make good sales. Mavluda enjoys selling clothing; moreover, this business brings her stable income. 

Mavluda would like to borrow 3,000 USD to purchase a summer collection of kid's clothing. She has used IMON International’s loans before and considers them to be very helpful for her business.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: Edjeha Group

texts.fr: EDJEHA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres habitent le même quartier. La présidente du groupe, Amélie Véronique (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 05 Janvier 1971 à Cotonou Capitale économique du Bénin. Amélie Véronique est mère d’un enfant, et a un autre enfant à charge en dehors de son enfant. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Amélie Véronique  vit depuis sa naissance à Cocotomey dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. C’est une divorcée, qui vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule les différents besoins. Amélie Véronique  n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Pour se prendre en charge et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Amélie Véronique mène comme activité depuis cinq ans, la vente de divers produits (yaourt, savon, sucre, lait, maïs, haricot, riz  etc.). Amélie Véronique  achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et les vend à son domicile. C’est la première fois que Amélie Véronique sollicite un crédit auprès de  ALIDé, crédit qui permettra certainement à Amélie Véronique et à son groupe d’accroître leur stock de produits et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
EDJEHA is a group of three persons whose members live in the same district. The group's president, Amélie Véronique (with her hand raised in the photo) was born on January 5, 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is the mother of one child, and she has another child in her care besides her own. Both children are in school. She has lived since birth in Cocotomey, in the commune of Abomey Calavi. She is divorced and living alone with her children, and she ensures their various needs are met by herself. 

Amélie Véronique did not attend primary school. To support herself and her children, she has had a business for five years selling a variety of goods (yoghurt, soap, sugar, milk, corn, beans, rice, etc.) She buys her goods at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and sells them at her house. 

This is the first time she has requested a loan from ALIDé. The loan will enable her and her group to increase their stock of merchandise and to respond better the requirements of their customers.

loans.use: to buy a sack of corn, a sack of rice, and three boxes of soap

loans.name: Khudoykul

texts.ru: Аланазаров Худойкул проживает в районе Пяндж. Возраст, 57 лет. Женат. Имеет 8 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Худойкул имеет среднее образование. Он занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет большой участок земли, где выращивает овощи, арбуз и сажает фруктовые деревья. В этой области он 20 лет. Целью кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений для посева арбуза.
texts.en: Khudoykul A. lives in Pyandj. He is 57 years old, married, and has eight children. His wife is a housewife. Khudoykul has a secondary education. He is a farmer. At his house he has a large plot of land where he grows vegetables, watermelons, and fruit trees. He has been doing this work for twenty years.   He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer for the watermelon crop.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer for his watermelon crop

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en:
Guljahon is married with 5 children. She sells clothing at the central market in the region of Kumsangir. She has been in this business for 11 years. Guljahon is very persistent, disciplined and creative. All these character traits help her to succeed in her business. Guljahon's kiosk is located in a good spot at the market and she always has many customers. 

Guljahon would like to borrow 3,000 USD to increase her assortment of clothing for sale. She works hard to develop her business. Guljahon's goal is to be a successful and independent person, able to provide for her family and help others as well.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr: Catherine est née en 1979 au Gabon, pays voisin du Bénin. Catherine a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, avec lesquels elle vit. En effet, il y a près de sept ans que Catherine s’est installée à PK11 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Catherine ne vit plus avec son mari. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et de répondre aux besoins de ses enfants, Catherine prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, riz, accompagné de sauce) au Parcs de Mivvo dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. De façon secondaire, Catherine vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Catherine achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Catherine sollicite auprès d’ALIDé, un crédit en vue de renforcer son capital et d’élever le niveau de son activité.
texts.en: Catherine was born in 1979 in Gabon, a neighboring country to Benin. She has three children who live with her and all of them are at school. Almost seven years ago Catherine settled down in PK11 in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. Catherine no longer lives with her husband. In order to provide for her needs and those of her children, she makes food (corn paste and rice accompanied by sauces) at Parcs de Miwo in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. As a secondary activity, Catherine sells telephone recharge cards. She buys her products at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. It is the fourth time that Catherine has requested a loan from Alidé, and this loan will be used to strengthen her capital and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and rice, as well as condiments for sauces

loans.name: Abdurafi

texts.en:
Abdurafi is 41 years old. He is married with 4 children. Abdurafi sells dried fruits in the central local market. He has been in this business for 10 years. The dried fruits are very popular in Tajikistan. Any hostess has dried fruits in store for serving in case there are guests in the house. Moreover, dried fruits are, as a rule, served during all family occasions like wedding parties, birthday parties and others. Considering the constant demand for this kind of item, Abdurafi's business is quite successful and brings a stable income for the family. 

Today Abdurafi requests a loan of 2,500 USD for purchasing dried fruits with the purpose of increasing the variety of goods he sells. Abdurafi has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history. Now he would like to thank all for their support and to promise to pay the loan in time.
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits to increase the variety of items he sells

loans.name: Sunnatullo

texts.en:
Sunnatullo is married with two children. He is a private entrepreneur who sells car spare parts. Sunnatullo is very disciplined. One of his strong characteristics is his ability to listen and persuade, which helps him in his work with customers. Sunnatullo has been in the market for 12 years. His main goal is to provide his family with a decent life and stable future. He has always tried to achieve financial and economic independence and make a career. Sunnatullo is hoping to see his business flourish and succeed. Sunnatullo believes this loan of 8,000 TJS will allow him to purchase spare car parts for his business and will be one of the steps towards his goal. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase car spare parts for his business

loans.name: Tedungal Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est né le 12 Octobre 2010. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui ont comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

La femme debout à l’extrême droit est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants.

Elle vend des fruits au marché hebdomadaire de sa localité. Et comme activité secondaire elle vend le petit déjeuner Elle maîtrise bien cette activité pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plus de cinq ans.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en mangues en partie. Pour le reste acheter divers accessoires pour le petit déjeuner.

Elle envisage de mieux soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The group Tedungal was established on October 12, 2010 at the inauguration of the Banc Villageois Dialicounda Kawral. It is composed of ten women who work in small-scale commerce. Note: Since Banna G. and COUMB. S. are not clearly visible in the photo, they are considered absent.

Ms. CoumB.  S. (standing at the far right in the photo) is the group’s official. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of eight children. She sells fruit at the weekly market of Diaobé. And she sells breakfasts on the side. She has a good command of this business because of her experience in it for over five years. 

With her new loan, she plans on stocking up on mangoes, in part. For the remainder, she will buy various accessories for making breakfasts. She envisions supporting her husband better in covering family expenses.

loans.use: to buy accessories for breakfast-making

loans.name: Faïssatou

texts.fr: Faïssatou est née le 30 Juin 1965 à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, Faïssatou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants à PK12, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Il y a près de cinq ans que Faïssatou et son mari vivent dans ce quartier. Faïssatou vient en aide à son mari en supportant avec lui les diverses charges familiales. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Faïssatou mène comme activité la vente de pur water, de boissons, des bijoux et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques de façon secondaire. Faïssatou s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Faïssatou sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, crédit qui lui servira à élever le niveau de son activité et à mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: Faïssatou was born on 30th June 1965 in Ekpè in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. She is married and mother to four children, all of whom are at school. Faïssatou lives with her husband and children in PK12, also in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. They have lived in this district for almost five years. Faïssatou helps her husband with the various family expenses. For the past ten years, she has had a business selling pure water, other drinks, jewelry and, as a secondary activity, telephone recharge cards. Faïssatou gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. It is the first time she has requested a loan from Alidé and this loan will be used to expand her business and better satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: to buy drinks and jewelry

loans.name: Hammad

texts.en:
Hammad is a 45-year-old father of four daughters and four sons, Hammad is a schoolteacher. He took out a loan from FATEN to paint the house walls. The walls need urgent painting and leaking maintenance.

Hammad, who appears in the picture here, is a teacher with a salary that won't allow him to pay for the painting expenses. Repaying a loan is going to make this possible.

loans.use: to paint the walls of the family house

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 26-year-old man from Palestine who is engaged and getting married soon. Muhammad is an employee with a decent salary but he needed a loan to cover some of the wedding expenses.

Muhammad came to FATEN and took a loan to pay for the wedding hall rent and photography expenses. Muhammad is photographed in the picture here.

loans.use: Pay for wedding expenses

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace currently sells beans. She is 32 years old, married, with 3 children and all of them go to school. Grace borrowed a loan to stock more beans to sell. With the extra profits from her business, she hopes to pay her children's school fees in the future.

loans.use: to stock more beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Rasha is a mother of two sons. She is married and lives in Palestine. Her husband runs a clothes store with a partner. Her husband appears in the picture here instead of her, as she is a conservative woman

Rasha took out a loan from FATEN as her husband wants to start selling boys clothes in addition to the girls clothes that he sells in the store to increase the number of clients and profit. Rasha hopes that with this loan, the income that is divided by two will increase to give the family financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Editta

texts.en:
Editta is 48 years old, married and has five children. She is a very hardworking farmer. She started farming as a business in 2000. She also relies on her husband for financial support.  

Editta rears dairy cattle, poultry and turkeys. She also grows maize. She has four casual laborers who assist her on the farm. She hopes to drill a borehole (well) on the farm in the future. She has requested 80,000 KES to buy a cow and animal feed.

loans.use: to buy a cow and animal feed

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua, a 37-year-old married father of two children, has run a cafeteria for almost four years to earn a living.  He employs three people to assist him in the business. Joshua also operates a retail shop and a tailoring business to supplement his income, and he previously also sold milk.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Joshua has improved both his business and his living standards and is now requesting a loan of 80,000 Kes to buy beans, sugar, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat to stock in his retail shop.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en: Raed is a 37-year-old father of two daughters and two sons. Raed is a Palestinian National Authority employee. He has a small piece of land that he decided to use to plant seasonal vegetables for a second income for the family. Raed took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a greenhouse and start planting vegetables. He is photographed in FATEN's office.

loans.use: to purchase a greenhouse to plant seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, a 36-year-old married father of two, sells clothes to earn a living.  In business now for two years, he employs three people.  Previously without a business premise, through Faulu Kenya John was able to grow his business and establish one.  He hopes to further expand his enterprise and employ more people. John is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kes to buy more clothes and to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and to renovate his house.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is a 30-year-old mother of a two-month-old and a four-year-old, the latter child already attending school. Clarisse owns a restaurant serving a variety of foods; she also charges phones in exchange for money and also owns a small shop selling items such as biscuits, soap, sugar, etc. Operating these businesses for the past two years has enabled her meet the needs of her family.

Clarisse is now requesting a loan to buy more food for her restaurant and plans to buy a cow as a source of milk. She hopes to soon begin building her family home.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Rwashamaire Twetungye Group

texts.en: Diligence has put Polly on the inside lane for continued success in her plastics-sales enterprise, which she has been running for a decade now in Ntungamo. Forty-eight-year-old Polly had to begin with a clean slate after she dispensed with her former business of agro produce sales. This high-spirited mother of four says her relentless and determined way of conducting her business has seen her make significant headway. Polly also ekes out side profits from a rental business. She says this business generates her 200,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) weekly as profit, and she says with this loan she is going to purchase more plastics to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fat, maize flour, and soap

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Sarah has a pub business. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days a week. Sarah sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more mobile phones and airtime. The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own business premises and also to own a fully stocked mobile shop. Sarah lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, utility bills, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones, chargers, and batteries

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah N., who lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda, is married and has seven children, all of whom are in school. Deborah has operated a pub business for over 10 years; working six days a week, she sells her products in a retail shop. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. Deborah is requesting a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerry cans of local gin.

The main business challenges for Deborah include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to build her own business premises and also to own a fully stocked bar. Deborah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerry cans of local gin.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 33 years old, and married with three children. He runs Jorafam Scales where he sells and repairs weighing scales.  He has six years of experience in the business. He says that he has achieved a lot since he became a member of Faulu Kenya.  He has managed to stabilize his business and build a house through his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  He has requested 50,000 Kes to buy a weighing scale.

loans.use: To buy a weighing scale

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys is 34 years old. He has five children who are ages 6 months to 10 years old. Two of them are in school. 

Aloys’s wife is a farmer. Aloys sells cassava, beans, rice, etc., and he has had this business for six years. This business has enabled him to meet the needs of his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cassava and hence make more profits. With the profits he plans to renovate his house and he also hopes to make some savings.

loans.use: to buy more cassava.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 30 years old. She has five children who are 1 ½ to 10 years old. Three children are in school while the others are not yet school age. 

Her husband rides a motorcycle for a business. 

Angelique sells different kinds of food stuffs such as sorghum, and she has sold them for the past three years. This business has enabled her meet the needs of her family. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs and make more profits. With the profits she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and other food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 29 years old, married and has two children.  

He makes metallic boxes, tanks, cooking pots and energy-saving cookers so as to earn a living. He has been in the business for eight years. He has employed two people to assist him.  

He has become more focused in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya. He also saves his money through Faulu Kenya. He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.  

He has requested 50,000 KES to buy metal sheets.

loans.use: To buy sheet metal.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary P.  is 28 years old. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. Two of them are in school. 

She is currently in the business of selling vegetables. 

Her future goal is to educate her children.

loans.use: to stock more vegetables.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El señor Carlos tiene un sistema de amplificación con el que ofrece servicios de D.J. en recepciones sociales. El crédito lo requiere para comprar un equipo de mayor poder amplificador, así podrá  aumentar su capital de trabajo y ofrecer mejor servicio a sus clientes. Vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz;  es separado  y tiene cinco hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito con IMPRO.
texts.en: Carlos provides DJ services with his amplification equipment at social events and receptions.  He needs a loan to buy a more powerful amplifier.  In this way he can increase his working capital and offer better service to his customers.  He lives in a rented home located in the Miraflores neighborhood of the city of La Paz.  He is separated and has 5 children.  This is the first time he has taken a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy a more powerful amplifier for his DJ business

loans.name: Kyabugimbi Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
Being level headed and foresighted has been of much consequence in the running of 35-year-old Moses's general merchandise retail shop in Kizinga in Ntungamo.  

The happily married father of four says he has stood firm in the face of financial adversity and has invariably taken stock of his business operations with a long-term view of making it last. 

Before he started laying great store on this business, Moses was engaged in agriculture and was also teaching. 

In a year's time, he has made significant progress. He says this business generates him 40,000 UGX weekly as profit. He says with this loan he is going to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan tiene un pequeño horno donde se dedica a elaborar pan y queques y también es rentista jubilado. El crédito lo requiere para comprar una maquina amasadora y la cancelación de tramites para el funcionamiento de la misma. Vive en casa propia, la misma esta ubicada en la zona Nuevos Horizontes en la ciudad de El Alto;  es casado y tiene dos hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que su solicitud de crédito es procesada a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Juan has a small oven where he makes bread and cakes.  He is also a retiree with a pension.  He needs a loan to buy a kneading machine and to pay some fees related to his business.  He lives in his own home, which is located in the Nuevos Horizontes neighborhood of the city of El Alto.  He is married and has 2 children.  This is the second time that he has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a kneading machine for his business making breads and cakes

loans.name: Akohode

texts.fr: Akohodé est née le 28 Avril 1976 et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Akohodé est mariée à Nazaire. Le couple supporte ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a juste un an que Akohodé et sa famille se sont installés à Ekpè Dandji, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Akohodé n'est jamais allée à l'école. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Akohodé vend divers produits (biscuits, etc.) et du charbon de bois à son domicile. Akohodé achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Akohodé mène cette activité depuis huit ans et a déjà obtenu deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés auprès de ALIDé. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Akohodé d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: Akohodé is born April 28, 1976, and is the mother of four children, who all attend school. Akohodé is married to Nazaire. The couple takes care of the various family duties together. Just a year ago, Akohodé and her family settled in Ekpe Dandji, in the township of Seme-Podji. Akohodé never went to school. In order to provide for her needs and those of her children, Akohodé sells various products (cookies, etc.) and charcoal from her home. Akohodé purchases her products in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Akohodé has been active in this business for eight years, and has already been granted two loans, which both were repaid to ALIDé. This third loan will certainly make it possible for Akohodé to raise her level of activity and better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and various food products (cookies, etc.)

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es: El señor Elvis se dedica a la cría de ganado y producción de leche. El crédito lo requiere para comprar 2 vacas lecheras para producir mayor cantidad de leche, venderla y mejorar sus ingresos. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma esta ubicada en la localidad de Tihuanacu en el departamento de La Paz;  es soltero y no tiene  hijos. Elvis es nuestro cliente desde el año 2008.
texts.en: Elvis raises livestock and produces milk.  He needs a loan to purchase 2 dairy cows so that he can produce a greater quantity of milk to sell, which will increase his income.  He lives in his parent's house, located in Tihuanacu in the department of La Paz.  He is single and has no children.  Elvis has been our client since 2008.

loans.use: to buy 2 dairy cows to increase his production of milk

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: El señor Alberto es artesano y fabrica cochecitos. Es su principal fuente de trabajo. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como ser: láminas de metal, goma, pintura y otros. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Los Andes de la ciudad de El Alto; Alberto es casado y  tiene tres hijos. Es cliente antiguo de Impro desde el año 2005.
texts.en: Mr. Alberto is an artisan, and he makes baby carriages. This is his primary source of income. He needs this loan to buy supplies for this activity, such as sheets of metal, rubber, paint, and other things. His lives in a house he owns, located in the Los Andes area of the city of El Alto. Alberto is married and has three children. He has been a client of Impro since 2005.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal, rubber, paint, and other supplies to make baby carriages

loans.name: Nizbel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Urubamba donde se encuentra el Santuario Histórico de Machu Picchu (Machu Picchu es considerado como una de las octavas Maravillas de la Humanidad). Cada treinta días se reúne el Banco Comunal “Saywa - Chichubamba”. Este lugar es conocido por sus centros arqueológicos, paisajes hermosa, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nizbel que nació en Espinar (Cusco, Perú), tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen dos hijos. Ella trabaja en el Poder Judicial de la ciudad de Urubamba en el área de limpieza desde las 5h00 de la mañana hasta las 13h00 de lunes a viernes.   

Ella también tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual trabaja junto a su esposo, allí venden todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, el esposo atienda en las mañanas y su esposa por las tardes, además de estos productos también venden verduras y útiles escolares, los productos los compra en la ciudad del Cusco ya que allá le salen más baratos, ciertos productos los recibe en su local.  

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace varios años y le gusta por la confraternidad que hay en el grupo.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y convertirlo en un minimarket también su sueño es construir su casa de material noble.
texts.en:
The city of Urubamba is home to the historic sanctuary of Machu Picchu, which is considered one of the eight Wonders of the World. It is also where the "Saywa - Chichubamba" communal bank meets every thirty days. It is a place known for its archaeological centers and beautiful landscapes, which are widely visited by many domestic and international tourists. It offers a variety of beautiful places and a rich variety of typical regional dishes.

This is where you would meet Ms. Nizbel. She was born in Espinar (Cusco, Perú), is 29 years old, married, and has two children from her marriage. She works from 5:00 AM to 1:00 PM from Monday to Friday, as a janitor for the Judicial Power of the city of Urubamba

She also has a grocery store in her house, which she runs together with her husband. They sell all types of products, like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, and other items. Her husband tends the store in the mornings and Nizbel does so in the afternoons. Aside from the aforementioned products they also sell vegetables and school supplies. They buy products in the city of Cusco, where they sell for cheaper. They also obtain some products locally.

Nizbel is going to use this loan to better stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausage, and other staple products. She has been in her communal bank for several years and she enjoys it because of the fellowship that exists amongst the group.

Her goals are to continue moving forward with her business and to convert it into a mini-market. She also dreams of constructing her house of more stable materials.

loans.use: stock her store with rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausage, and other staple items

loans.name: Lukiya

texts.en: Lukiya  a single mother of four children, all of whom are in school, lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. For the past six years, Lukiya has operated a business selling green bananas six days a week at the market. She is now requesting a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Lukiya's main business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals are to build her own rental rooms and to educate her children up to university. Lukiya lives in a home that she rents, and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La ciudad D. Urubamba es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad D. lugares hermosos y una rica variedad D. platos típicos D. la región. (El gobierno del Perú declaró oficialmente como Patrimonio Cultural D. la Nación a los "saberes, usos y tecnologías tradicionales asociados al cultivo D. maíz en el Valle Sagrado D. los Incas".)

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Leonarda que nació en la ciudad D. Urubamba (Cusco, Perú), tiene 53 años D. edad, es casada y fruto D. esta relación tienen cuatro hijos. 

Ella tiene una tienda D. comestibles en su casa, allí venden todo tipo D. productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, además D. estos productos también venden verduras y útiles escolares, los productos las compras en la ciudad del Cusco ya que allá le salen más baratos, ciertos productos los recibe en su local. Ella también tiene una pequeña picantería en su domicilio donD. venD. la rica chicha D. jora. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos D. primera necesidad. Otra parte del dinero lo empleara para comprar maíz para elaborar jora. Está en el Banco Comunal hace varios años y le gusta por la confraternidad que hay en el grupo.
texts.en:
The city of Urubamba is known for its beautiful sceneries which are very frequently visited by national and international tourists. There is a diversity of beautiful locales and a rich selection of traditional foods in the region. (The government of Peru officially declared the "knowledge, uses, and traditional technologies associated with the cultivation of corn in Valle Sagrado D. los Incas" a National Heritage.)

Here we meet Leonarda. She was born in the city of Urubamba (Cusco, Peru). She is 53 years old, married, and her four children are the fruit of this relationship.

She has a grocery store in her house and she sells all types of products, including rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, and other items. She also sells vegetables and school supplies. She buys these products in the city of Cusco because there she finds them at a lower price. Certain products are delivered to her store. She also has a small bar in her house where she serves delicious chicha D. jora (traditional corn drink).

This loan will be used to stock her store. She will purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, canned goods and other basic needs products. A part of her loan will also be used to purchase corn to make jora drinks. She has been in her communal bank for several years and she enjoys partaking for the collegiality of the group.

loans.use: to supply her store with rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, canned goods and other basic needs products.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie  lives in the  city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (a nephew and a cousin). 

Sophie has a business of selling new clothes.  She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works six days out of every week. Sophie sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. She also generates additional income through working as a health worker at Kawempe Health Centre.

Sophie has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of clothing materials for Bitenge (African attire). The main business challenges for Sophie include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own business premises and to start importing bitenge from Nigeria.

Sophie lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, paying utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of African attires and clothing materials

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro nació en la ciudad de Urubamba y tiene 48 años. Él asegura que se siente feliz al haber conformado una familia unida. Pues se casó hace varios años y fruto esta relación tiene cuatro hijos. Alejandro trabaja en el hotel Libertadores como supervisor del bio huerto desde las 4h00 hasta las 15h45 de lunes a sábado. Alejandro tiene varias chacras donde siembra hortalizas. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Saywa - Chichubamba”, y este es el onceavo ciclo de crédito con la Asociación Arariwa, donde está seguro que accederá a futuros créditos porque refiere que con sus ahorros, sus pagos puntuales, más el trabajo activo que desempeña en su banco comunal garantizan como una persona responsable. Con el crédito solicitado, invertirá para comprar productos como por ejemplo semillas de papa para sembrar.
texts.en: Alejandro was born in the city of Urubamba and he is 48 years old. He declares to be happy knowing that he has a close family. He married several years ago and his four children are the fruit of this relationship. Alejandro works at the Libertadores Hotel as the supervisor of the ponds from 4am to 3:45pm from Monday to Saturday. Alejandro has several fields where he plants vegetables. He is a member of the communal bank "Saywa - Chichubamba" and it is their eleventh loan cycle with Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner). He is sure to be able to access future loans given that he has savings, his payments are on time, and the fact that he actively works in his communal bank guarantee that he is a responsible person. With the loan which he requests he will invest in the purchase of potato seeds to plant.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 42 years old, married and has five children. She runs a green grocery to earn a living. She has been in the business since 2000.

She hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and expand her business using her previous loans. She has requested 50,000 Kes to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Calixto

texts.es: El señor Calixto trabaja como profesor rural y su esposa es productora lechera  y sus hijos colaboran con actividades agrícolas. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una vaca lechera para mejorar su producción de leche e incrementar sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chahuira Pampa del departamento de La Paz; es casado y  tiene dos hijos. Este es su primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Señor Calixto works as a rural teacher, and his wife produces dairy products. Their children help with the agricultural activities. He needs the loan to purchase a dairy cow to improve their production of milk and increase their income. He lives in his own house located in the town of Chahuira Pampa in the department of La Paz. He is married and has two children. This is his first loan with Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow  to improve their milk production.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen nació en la ciudad de Urubamba y es madre de un niño, ella tiene 30 años de edad y vive junto a su pareja en una casa ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco, Perú.  Este lugar se caracteriza por ser un sector turístico, ganadero, agrícola y por estar habitado de gente emprendedora que se identifica con el refrán de la localidad que dice: “Provincia Arqueológica del Perú"”.

Con más de 14 años de experiencia como profesora y actualmente trabaja en el colegio de la comunidad de Palcaraqui de la ciudad de Urubamba y la podemos encontrar cumpliendo su deberes en el colegio desde las 7h00 hasta las 15h00 de lunes a viernes, Carmen también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Carmen solicita un préstamo a Asociación Arariwa de 500 nuevos soles que utilizará para comprar más animales como por ejemplo gallinas para poder tener un mayor capital. Esto le permitirá expandir su negocio obteniendo mayores ganancias para el bienestar de su único hijo.

Carmen cuenta con buena reputación en Asociación Arariwa, pues con anterioridad éste ha tenido varios créditos cancelados con puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Carmen was born in the city of Urubamba. She is the mother of a child. She is 30 years old and lives with her partner in a house located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco, Perú. This place is characterized by being a sector of tourism, cattle-ranching, and agriculture, and for being inhabited by entrepreneurial people who identify with the slogan of the region, which is "Archaeological Province of Peru."

With more than 14 years of experience as a teacher, she now works in the school in the community of Palcaraqui in the city of Urubamba. We can find her fulfilling her duties in the school from 7 am until 3 pm from Monday to Friday. Carmen also raises small animals. She has already been in this business for 3 years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

Carmen is applying to Arariwa Association for a loan of 500 PEN, which she will use to buy more animals, such as hens, so that she will have greater capital. This will permit her to expand her business, obtaining better earnings for the well-being of her only son.

Carmen has a good reputation with Arariwa Association, since in the past she has had various loans that she has paid off with punctuality and responsibility.

loans.use: to buy more animals such as hens in order to have greater capital.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor es socia del Banco Comunal Diamante, tiene 47 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos.
Leonor se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. papa seca. Con la ayuda D. sus hijos prepara y comercializa papa seca, cuando tienen listo el producto Leonora viaja al departamento D. Ica los días viernes y regresa los días lunes en la noche.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. papa D. tercera para la preparación D. papa seca.
Está en FINCA Perú, desD. hace tres ciclo, ingresó por la invitación D. su hija, le gusta por la facilidad con que recibe los préstamos y pueD. ahorrar, está ahorrando para la construcción D. su casa.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca más y abrir una tienda D. abarrotes en general en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Leonor is a member of the Diamante village bank. She is 47 years old, married and has 4 children.

Leonor makes and sells dried potatoes. Her children help her to prepare and market the dehydrated potatoes. When the product is ready, Leonor travels to the department of Ica on Fridays and returns on Monday night. 

The requested loan will be invested in purchasing third-rate potatoes to make the dried potatoes. She has been part of FINCA Peru for 4 cycles. She began at the invitation of her daughter, and likes the ease with which she gets loans and can save. She is saving to build a house. 

Her dream is that her business will grow and she will open a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to make and sell dried potatoes.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es: El señor Luciano es agricultor y también vende quesos en la feria de Achacachi. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una vaca lechera, así podrá aumentar la producción y elaboración de quesos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Suñasivi del departamento de La Paz; es casado, no tiene  hijos. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Luciano is an agriculturist and he also sells cheeses at the fair in Achacachi. He needs the loan to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase cheese production. He lives in a house which he owns and it is located in the community of Sunasivi in the department of La Paz. He is married and he has no children. This is his first loan with IMPRO (Kiva Field Partner) and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to increase cheese production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 72 years old, married and a father of seven. He runs Twims Tailoring shop to earn a living for his family. 

Apart from tailoring, he does farming.  He employs one person in his business.  He has sustained his business because of financial support from Faulu Kenya.  

He hopes to grow his business so as to meet his customer’s demands.  He has requested 50,000 Kes to buy fabric, needles and thread.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles and thread

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro es un padre de familia de 45 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrtito de Reque, a unos 15 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía .

Teodoro se dedica hace 10 años a las labores agricolas en sus tierras cultiva donde siembra maíz y camote, es un alimento sano y rico para el consumo diario de los pobladores que lo comercializa en el mercado Moshoqueque de Chiclayo, vendiendolo al por mayor y menor,con la finalidad de aumentar sus ingresos. Pero quiere intentar sembrar frijol en sus tierras y así amplia sus productos para vender. 

A solicitado un préstamo  de 1800 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para empezar a sembrar frijol en sus terrenos y también es para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras y su producto, el cual posteriormente será vendido para el consumo de los pobladores.  La venta de su maíz y camote mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.

Teodoro es conocido por las personas que también se dedican a esa actividad, por ser trabajador y respobsable, con el único objetivo de brindarles a sus hijos otras oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Teodoro, 45, lives with his wife and children in his own house in the district of Reque, about 15 minutes from the province of Chiclayo.  The type of work in this area is mainly in agriculture, livestock farming and handicrafts.

For ten years Teodoro has been raising corn and sweet potato crops, healthy, vitamin-rich foods consumed daily by the local population.  He sells his crops wholesale and retail at the Moshoqueque Market in Chiclayo.  In order to increase his income he wants to start growing beans to broaden his product range.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 1,800 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to begin growing beans and buy fertilizer to improve his land and crops.  Selling corn and sweet potatoes has improved his family's lifestyle.

Teodoro is known in the agricultural community as a hard-working, responsible person who only wants to give his children the best opportunities

loans.use: To grow beans and buy fertilizer to improve his land.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 43 years old, married and with six children.  For 11 years, he has been doing carpentry.  He runs the business with three employees.  

Through his previous loans from Faulu Kenya, he has been able to buy raw materials, such as timber, for making furniture.  Samwel hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested 50,000 Kes to buy a carving machine and a molding machine.

loans.use: to buy a carving machine and a molding machine

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha nació en Quillabamba (Cusco, Perú), tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Isaac y su único hijo, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los verdes campos de la comunidad de Chichubamba, ubicado en la Valle Sagrado de los Incas donde actualmente vive,  han sido en la vida de Martha un lugar muy agradable para trabajar. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja, que con mucho esmero siembran flores como por ejemplo rosas, crisantemos, claveles y otras flores. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que su arduo trabajo ha sido de mucho provecho. Lleva varios años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta los centros de acopio situados en las ciudades de Urubamba y Cusco. Martha solicita el préstamo para realizar unos de sus planes, que es extender la siembra de flores, por ser una de sus plantas que mayor precio tiene en el mercado. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero suficiente para abrir una maderera. Ella tiene la obligación de pagar sus aportes puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo si desea acceder a otro crédito. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con los 1,200 nuevos soles, comprará semillas y así aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Martha was born in Quillabamba (Cusco, Peru). She is 40 years old and she is a very happy and hardworking woman. She lives in a house which she owns together with her partner Isaac and their only son. He is the motivation for all of their efforts. The green fields of the community of Chichubamba, located in Valle Sagrado de los Incas, is where Martha currently lives and in life it has been a most pleasant place for her to work. 

When she was very young her parents taught her this business and today she has her own fields where she works together with her partner. With a great deal of care they cultivate flowers, such as roses, chrysanthemums, carnations, and other flowers. what she most enjoys about her work is to harvest the fields because this is when she feels that her arduous work has been a great investment. She has been in the business for several years and she considers the most difficult part to be the transportation of the harvest to the collection centers in the cities of Urubamba and Cusco. Martha requests a loan to carry out one of her plans, which is to extend her flower plantation because her plants obtain the best price in the market. With time she hopes to save enough money to start a lumber yard. She has the obligation to make her payments on time and she is ready to do so if she wants to have another loan. She is thankful to the organization for granting her this loan. With the 1200 nuevos soles she will purchase seeds to increase production.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to increase production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed and renovate the stable.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
En el valle sagrado del los Incas que comprende el circuito Turístico de Pisaq, Yucay, Urubamba, Ollantaytambo y Chinchero. La ciudad de Urubamba es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yovana que nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Cusco, Perú), tiene 31 años de edad, tiene su pareja y fruto de esta relación tiene un hijo. Ella trabaja en el Poder Judicial de la ciudad de Urubamba en el área de limpieza desde las 5h00 de la mañana hasta las 10h00 de lunes a viernes.   

Ella también tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa y atiende por las tardes, allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, además de estos productos también venden verduras y útiles escolares, los productos las compras en la ciudad del Cusco ya que allá le salen más baratos y ciertos productos los recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que tiene 7 años el negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.   

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace varios años y le gusta por la confraternidad que hay en el grupo.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y  abrir una cabina de internet.
texts.en:
The Valle Sagrado de los Incas consists of a series of tourist attractions, including Pisaq, Yucay, Urubamba, Ollantaytambo, and Chinchero. The city of Urubamba is known for its beautiful scenic locations which are frequently visited by national and international tourists. There is a diversity of beautiful locales and a rich variety of traditional foods in the region. 

Here we meet Yovana. She was born in Cusco (Cusco, Peru) and she is 31 years old. She has a partner and a son who is the fruit of this relationship. She works for the city Police Service in the city of Urubamba, working as a janitor from 5am to 10am from Monday to Friday.

She also has a grocery store that opens in the afternoons. She sells all types of products, such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, and other items. In addition to these products she also sells vegetables and school supplies. She acquires her products in the city of Cusco where they are more affordable. Certain products are delivered directly to her store. She tells us that she has been in business for 7 years and it has gone very well, thank to the attention she invests in it.

This loan will be used to supply her store with the purchase of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, canned goods, and other basic needs products. She has been with her communal bank for several years and she enjoys the collegiality of the group.

Her goal is to keep her business moving forward and to open an internet cafe.

loans.use: to supply her store with the purchase of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, canned goods and other basic needs products.

loans.name: Hugo Antonio

texts.es:
Hugo Antonio es un hombre separado de 36 años de edad que vive en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Chichubamba, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz; se encuentra a unos 45 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco. Esta comunidad se caracteriza porque sus pobladores desarrollan la actividad de agricultura y ganadería.

Desde hace 13 años Hugo Antonio se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes, su galpón lo tiene en la parte interior de su casa para mayor seguridad. La carne de los cuyes es rica en proteínas y se vende rápido en los mercados que los ofrece por estar bien alimentadas y criadas con alimentos balanceados, lo cual le permite a Hugo Antonio aumentar sus ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades diarias. Su actividad económica secundaria es la venta de flores.  

Por lo mismo Hugo Antonio solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Asociación Arariwa para poder seguir comprando animales como cuyes para criarlos y venderlos al por mayor y menor, también lo va utilizar para comprar alimentos balanceados para poder darles de comer bien a sus animales y seguir incrementando sus ventas y de paso hacerse mas conocido en los distintos lugares que vende por tener un producto sano y de calidad.

Hugo Antonio es conocido por los comerciantes de la zona y de los distintos mercados por ser un hombre honesto, trabajador y con muchas ganas de mejorar en la vida.
texts.en:
Hugo Antonio is separated, 36 years old, and he lives in a house which he owns. It is located in the rural region of the district of Chichubamba. It is equipped with water and electricity and it is about 45 minutes from the city of Cusco. This community is known for its agricultural and farming population.

Hugo Antonio has been in the business of buying, raising, and selling small livestock, such as guinea pigs, for the past 13 years. His cage is inside his house for greater security. The guinea pig meat is high in protein and it sells quickly at the markets where he sells because they are well fed and raised on balanced feed. This helps Hugo Antonio to increase his earnings and to meet his everyday needs. His secondary business activity is flower sales.

Hugo Antonio requests a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner) to be able to keep purchasing livestock, such as guinea pigs, to raise them and sell them in wholesale and retail. He will also use it to purchase balanced feed to be able to feed them well and to keep increasing his sales. In addition he wants to make himself known in the different locations where he sells, for having a healthy and quality product.

Hugo Antonio is known by the merchants in the region and at the different market for being an honest and hardworking man who is eager to improve his life.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, such as guinea pigs.

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como Chichubamba este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

Maricruz de 23 años de edad, tiene su pareja y fruto de esta relación tiene un hijo, vive con su esposo en su casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de agua, y luz, ubicada en la provincia de Urubamba, que pertenece al departamento del Cusco. Esta zona tiene como actividad principal la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Maricruz se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral como por ejemplo pollos, el corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con dieta balanceada. Posteriormente vende sus animales una vez que hayan llegado a su tamaño y peso óptimo en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Urubamba, incrementando sus ingresos y obteniendo cosas que le hacen falta en su casa. Nos cuenta con mucha  pena que tenía 500 pollos pero una bacteria enfermo a 100 pollos de las cuales le hizo fracasar pero a pesar de las adversidades Maricruz va seguir adelante con el negocio.  
 
El crédito que ha solicitado Maricruz es de 500 nuevos soles a Asociación Arariwa, será destinado para la compra de más aves de corral y su alimento respectivo, con la finalidad de que sus animales engorden y pueda venderlos a un buen precio para poder pagar su préstamo y al mismo tiempo le ayudara a mejorar su calidad de vida.

Maricruz es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
In the city of Urubamba of the department of Cusco, there is a place known as Chichubamba and it is known for its beautiful sceneries, the gastronomy, and for the warmth of the people.

Maricruz is 23 years old. She has a partner and their son is the fruit of their relationship. She lives with her husband in a house which they own and it is equipped with water and electricity. It is located in the province of Urubamba and in the department of Cusco. This region's primary business activities are agriculture, farming, and tourism. 

Maricruz raises and sells foul, including poultry. The corral where the animals live is located in the rear section of her property. She feeds them a balanced diet. She sells her livestock when they have reached an optimal size and weight at the different markets in the city of Urubamba. This increases her income and she is able to acquire what she needs for the home. She tells us that she had 500 chickens but a bacteria sickened 100 of them and it caused them to die. But despite the adversities Maricruz will continue moving forward with the business.

The loan that Maricruz requests is in the amount of 500 nuevos soles from Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner) and it will be used to purchase more foul and their feed. Her goal is to fatten the livestock to be able to sell them at a good price, to pray for her loan and to help her improve their quality of life.

Maricruz is a hardworking and attentive woman who has always known to keep moving forward to improve in life and to achieve what she wants.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and feed.

loans.name: Dancun

texts.en: For the past eight years Dancun, a 41-year-old married father of three children, has run a hardware shop with two employees to earn a living. He also has rental houses which earn him extra income.  He hopes to grow his business in the future. Dancun is requestng a loan for 30,000 Kes in order to open a water kiosk.

loans.use: to open a water kiosk.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es socia del Banco Comunal Diamante, tiene 38 años y es soltera. Se dedica la venta de cosméticos.
Patricia es de profesión Profesora en Educación Inicial trabaja en la mañanas en una Institución Educativa particular. Está en FINCA Perú, desde hace tres años, ingresó por la invitación de una amiga. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos.
Le gusta la reunion de su Banco Comunal por los ahorros, gracias a sus ahorros pudo incrementar su capital de trabajo. Ahora está ahorrando para comprarse un departamento.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the communal bank "Diamante". She is 38 years old and she is single. She sells cosmetics. Patricia is a primary school teacher by profession and she works in the mornings at a private educational institution. She has been with Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 3 years. She joined following an invitation from a friend. The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics.

She appreciates her communal bank group for the savings. It is thanks to her savings that she has been able to increase her working capital. She is saving to buy herself a condo. 

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Maruxa

texts.es:
Maruxa forma parte del banco comunal “Aurora Boreal” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
Ella se dedica a lavar y coser ropa de algunos integrantes del círculo de la Armada y Carabineros de Chile, desde hace dos años. Además transporta niños y en la temporada de verano vende verduras. Pero principalmente se dedica al lavado de ropa, específicamente cuando se realizan eventos en el círculo de la Armada y Carabineros de Chile y ropa del policlínico de estos. 
Su mercadería la compra generalmente en la ciudad de Santiago, todo lo que son artículos de aseo. 
Con el préstamo comprará artículos de aseo que le servirán para su negocio, específicamente detergente, cloro, jabón y lava lozas. También lo utilizará para gastos personales, ya que tiene problemas a la vista y necesita comprarse lentes, además se encuentra a la espera de unos exámenes y diagnóstico debido a una complicación al hígado, por lo que también ha debido desembolsar dinero en exámenes y consultas médicas. 
Sus metas a corto plazo son comprarse una máquina de lavado automático industrial, ya que por ahora solo cuenta con su lavadora automática de su casa. Sus metas a largo plazo son establecer su negocio e instalarse con una lavandería. 
Maruxa es jefa de hogar y vive junto a sus 4 hijas de 24, 18, 10 y 7 años de edad.
Sus sueños a nivel personal son conseguir el subsidio habitacional, para brindarles a sus hijas una vida más confortable.
Ella está muy agradecida del apoyo y crédito brindado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha podido emprender en su negocio.
Respecto a las reuniones, Maruxa se siente muy cómoda y a gusto, ya que existe una muy buena comunicación entre los demás integrantes del Banco comunal, además son muy solidarios como grupo.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Maruxa is a member of the communal bank named "Aurora Boreal", located in the city of Vina del Mar. For the past 2 years she has been washing and sewing clothes for some of the members of the army and police groups of Chile. She also provides transportation for children and during the summer she sells vegetables. Her primary business, however, is washing clothes, especially for events held by the groups, Armada and Carabineros of Chile.

She usually buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago, being all types of cleaning products.

With the loan she will purchase cleaning products that will help her with her business, especially detergents, bleach, soap, and floor cleaner. She will also use it to cover personal expenses. She has failing vision and she needs to purchase prescription glasses. She also needs to undergo some medical exams and diagnostics for a liver complication. She has been forced to spend some money on exams and medical consults.

Her short term goals are to purchase an automatic industrial washing machine. Currently she only has her own automatic washer at home. Her long term goals are to establish her business and to set up a laundry shop.

Maruxa is the head of the family and she lives together with her 4 daughters, aged, 24, 18, 10 and 7.

Her personal dreams are to acquire a subsidized living space to provide her daughters with more comfortable living conditions.

She is very thankful for the support and for the loan granted by Fondo Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner) because she has been able to support her business.

With respect to their meetings, Maruxa feels very comfortable and at ease. There exists a very open level of communication among the members of her communal bank and they are all very supportive as a group.

Vina del Mar is a city and community located in the heart of Chile's population. It is known as the City of Gardens for the gardens and patios of some of the old houses in the city. It is also considered to be the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning products, especially detergents, bleach, soaps, and floor cleaners.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Diamante, tiene 35 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 4 años y 10 meses de edad. Galdys se dedica a la comercialización de papa seca.
Gladys es de profesión docente de educación primaria pero por el momento no está ejerciendo porque sus hijos son pequeñitos, ahora se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de papa seca, aprendió de éste negocio de su madre. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de papa.
Está en FINCA Perú desde hace cuatro ciclos, ingreso por la invitación de su hermana, le gusta por la facilidad de los préstamos que recibe, el apoyo a las mujeres, el compañerismo y solidaridad que se práctica entre sus compañeras del banco comunal. Está ahorrando para tener mas capital de trabajo. Su meta es ejercer su profesión, hacer una segunda especialidad, abrir un negocio propio en su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales y que tengan mejores oportunidades que ella.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the communal bank "Diamante". She is 35 years old, married common-law, and she has 2 children, aged 4 and 10 months. Gladys sells dried potatoes. 

Gladys is a primary school teacher by profession but at the moment she is not practicing because her children are little. So she makes and sells dried potatoes. She learned the business from her mother. The loan which she requests will be invested in the purchase of potatoes.

She has been with Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) for 4 loan cycles. She joined following an invitation by her sister. She appreciates it for the easy loan process, for the support of the other women, the collegiality, and the group support found among the members of the communal bank. She is saving to have a larger working capital. Her goal is to work in her profession and to learn a second specialty. She also wants to open her own business in her house and to see her children grow up to have careers, so that they will have better opportunities than her.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de 69 años de edad, es viudo, tiene casa propia con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Pimente.  Se caracteriza porque sus pobladores tiene como actividad la pesca y el turismo, por ser un balneario.

Juan se dedica desde hace 10 años  a la elaboración y venta de redes de pescar, la cual es muy utilizada por los pescadores, además se a incrementado su venta lo que le permite tener mayores ingresos para poder solventar sus necesidades.  Con los ahorros que tiene  a colocado una tienda en su domicilio, es otra forma de ayudarse económicamente.

Al observar el incremento de sus ventas a solicitado Juan un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar material para seguir elaborando sus redes para pescar y para implementar su tienda.  Ambas actividades dejarán dinero para cubrir su crédito y seguir desarrollándose como persona.
texts.en:
Juan is a 69-year-old widow. He lives in his own house, equipped with running water and electricity, in the Pimente district, a seaside resort area whose inhabitants mainly engage in activities such as fishing and tourist services.

For 10 years Juan has been engaged in preparing and selling fishing nets, items that are continuously used and requested by fishermen; moreover, his sales have increased and he earns more money, thus being able to pay for his necessities. Thanks to his savings he has opened a shop in his house, yet another way to economically support himself.

Owing to the increase he observed in his sales, Juan has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 PEN to buy materials to keep on producing his fishing nets and to improve his shop. Both activities will provide him with the money he needs to pay for his loan and keep on progressing as a person.

loans.use: To buy materials to prepare fishing nets and to improve his shop.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan es chofer y trabaja con su taxi en forma independiente. El crédito lo requiere para compra de material de construcción puesto que realizara la refacción de una habitación en su casa. Vive en casa propia  la misma esta ubicada en la zona Tupac Amaru en la ciudad de La Paz;  es casado  y tiene cuatro hijos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Juan is a driver and he works with his taxi independently. He requires the loan to purchase construction material to repair a bedroom in his house. He lives in a house which he owns and it is located in the region of Tupac Amaru in the city of La Paz. He is married and he has four children. This is the first time he has worked with Impro (Kiva Field Partner) and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair a bedroom in his house.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila tiene 42 años, vive en cu casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Ella se considera una mujer multifacética, a lo largo de su vida siempre se ha dedicado a diversos oficios, con el fin de encontrar un mejor beneficio económico para su familia.
