Ella trabaja con una socia y vende en la poblaciòn a clientes cercanos y en Barranquilla, Sabanalarga y en otros municipios del Atlantico mediante el sistema de crèditos, ofreciendo a sus clientes opciones ajustadas a a sus posibilidades de pago. Su mayor desafio es superar la competencia y aumentar su capital de trabajo, esta es la razon por la cual acude a su  credikiva, primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprarà materiales como telas, pinturas, pues tiene demanda de maualidades y responderà a ella de manera oportuna, para ganar nuevos clientes. Su sueño es generar crecimiento a sus negocio y oportunidades de ingreso a otras personas; mientras esto ocurre Luz Divina continua trabajando, esforzandose cada dia por superar cualquier obstaculo que se le presente,  con tal de  lograr la sostenibilidad de su microempresa que tambien representa  el sostenieminto de su familia a quien mucho ama.
texts.en:
Luz Divina is a woman who works with clothing and crafts in Galapa, a town near Barranquilla, where this work is common and is passed down from generation to generation. Luz Divina lives here with her four children, ages 10 to 16 years old, who encouraged her to go ahead with her micro-enterprise, since she would like to provide for their well-being and educational opportunities. Her business began 10 years ago with the production of women's casual dresses and undergarments, and gradually her creative mind added finishing touches such as fabric painting. She thus began an additional business with country wood crafts, decorative paintings, and other handicrafts.
She works with a partner and sells to customers nearby in town and in Barranquilla, Sabanalarga, and in other towns in Atlantico through a credit system, offering her customers options adjusted to their means. Her greatest challenge is overcoming the competition and increasing her working capital. This is why she is turning to her "credikiva," her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase materials such as cloth and paints, since there is demand for handicrafts and she will respond to it in a timely manner, gaining new customers. Her dream is to create growth for her business and opportunities for salaries for other people. While this happens, Luz Divina will continue working, making an effort each day to overcome any obstacle that arises, in order to achieve sustainability for her micro-enterprise, which also sustains her family, who she loves very much.

loans.use: buy materials such as cloth and paints

loans.name: Jaime Ramiro

texts.es:
Jaime Ramiro tiene 25 años, es soltero vive con la madre y con un  hijo en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES CARBON CHINIPAMBA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad carbón Chinipamba, sector cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 20 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, la mayor parte de los socios se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio por lo que produce arroz, cebada, habas quinua, papas y animales de cómo: vacas lecheras y animales de corral.

Jaime se dedica a la agricultura siembra cebada, papas, maíz, arveja y trigo el terreno es de sus padres tiene seis cabezas de ganado, cerdos y pollos. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y un vehículo.

Le gusta hacer deporte y festejar las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Jaime Ramiro G. C. is 25 years old, single, and lives with his mother and son in the Canton of Guaranda, located in the Province of Bolívar.  He has one son.

The members of the ‘Grupo de Mujeres Carbón Chinipamba’ Communal Bank live in the community of Carbón Chinipampa, four blocks from the Canton of Guaranda and 20 minutes from the Cooperativa San José office.  The majority of the group members work in agriculture, cattle farming and as merchants.  They grow rice, barley, beans, quinoa, and potatoes and raise animals like dairy cows and barnyard animals.

Jaime works in agriculture growing barley, potatoes, corn, peas and wheat.  The land belongs to his parents and he also has six cattle, pigs and chickens.  He makes his purchases in the Guaranda market and sells his products at the wholesale market in the same city.

He is requesting this loan to buy supplies and feed for his animals, which will help him financially to meet his needs.  He faces difficulties such as pests, diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy land and a vehicle.

He likes to play sports and participate in the carnival festivities.

loans.use: to buy supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories like chargers, cases and covers.

loans.name: José Vicente

texts.es:
José Vicente tiene 52 años, es divorciado vive con la madre en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES CARBON CHINIPAMBA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad carbón Chinipamba, sector cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 20 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, la mayor parte de los socios se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio por lo que produce arroz, cebada, habas quinua, papas y animales de cómo: vacas lecheras y animales de corral.

José se dedica a la agricultura tiene dos cuadras de terreno alquilado siembra cebada, papas, maíz, arveja y trigo el terreno es de sus padres tiene seis cabezas de ganado, cerdos y pollos. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos propios y construir una casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
José Vicente C. P. is 52 years old, divorced, and lives with his mother in the Canton of Guaranda, located in the Province of Bolívar.  He has four children.

The members of the ‘Grupo de Mujeres Carbón Chinipamba’ Communal Bank live in the community of Carbón Chinipampa, four blocks from the Canton of Guaranda and 20 minutes from the Cooperativa San José office.  The majority of the group members work in agriculture, cattle farming and as merchants.  They grow rice, barley, beans, quinoa, and potatoes and raise animals like dairy cows and barnyard animals.

José works in agriculture and he has two parcels of rented land where he grows barley, potatoes, corn, peas and wheat.  The land belongs to his parents and he also has six cattle, pigs and chickens.  He makes his purchases in the Guaranda market and sells his products at the wholesale market in the same city.

He is requesting this loan to buy supplies and feed for his animals, which will help him financially to meet his needs.  He faces difficulties such as pests, diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy his own land and to build a house.

He likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Sara María

texts.es:
Sara María tiene 20 años, es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES CARBON CHINIPAMBA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad carbón Chinipamba, sector cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 20 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, la mayor parte de los socios se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio por lo que produce arroz, cebada, habas quinua, papas y animales de cómo: vacas lecheras y animales de corral.

Sara se dedica a la agricultura siembra cebada, papas, maíz, arveja y trigo el terreno es de sus padres tiene seis cabezas de ganado, cerdos y pollos. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia y terrenos

Le gusta festejar las fiestas de la localidad.
texts.en:
Sara María is 20 years old, married, and lives with her husband and child in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'Grupo de Mujeres Carbón Chinipamba' community bank is located in Carbón Chinipamba community, in Cuatro Esquinas sector, in Guaranda canton, 20 minutes from Cooperativa's offices.  Most of the bank's members work in farming, livestock raising and sales.  They produce rice, barley, beans, quinoa and potatoes, as well as animals such as dairy cows and farmyard animals.

Sara grows barley, potatoes, corn, peas and wheat.  The land she grows her crops on belongs to her parents.  She has six head of cattle, pigs and chickens.  She makes her purchases in the market in Guaranda and makes her sales in the city's wholesale market.

Sara is requesting a loan to buy supplies and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to own her own home and land.

Sara enjoya celebrating local fiestas.

loans.use: to buy supplies and feed for her animals

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna tiene 46 años, vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 10 años decidió tener su tienda de abarrotes  para apoyarse económicamente y tener una opción más de ingreso ya que siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales en su establo. Por otro lado posee una tienda, al cual se dedica mientras espera la temporada de siembra o cosecha, es ahí que sus hijos la apoyan y se quedan al cuidado del negocio. Su tienda es una de los pocos negocios que existe en su comunidad es por ello que continuamente esta llena de gente y sola a veces no se da abasto para atender a todos, ante desea implementarla de variados productos. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte del banco comunal que integra porque conocen que es una persona responsable, Reyna esta agradecida por la confianza depositada en su persona  y se compromete a trabajar comprometidamente por la unión del grupo siendo puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, o invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su tienda en productos enlatados de leche, atún y demás productos.
texts.en: Reyna is 46 years old and lives with her two children in her own house. She decided to open a grocery store more than 10 years ago to support herself economically and have an additional means of income, since she has always worked in agriculture and raised animals. The store also provides a means of living while she waits for the harvest season. Her children help her in her shop and look after the business. It is one of the few businesses in the community and is therefore always busy. Sometimes, she finds it difficult to attend to everyone and would like to purchase a greater variety of products to meet customers' needs. This is the first time she has requested a loan from MFP. She was invited to join the communal bank because of her reputation as a responsible person. Reyna is very grateful for the confidence placed in her as a person and will demonstrate her commitment to the group by making her payments on time. With the loan she has requested, she will invest in goods for her shop, such as canned dairy products, tuna and other essential products.

loans.use: To buy canned food and other essential products for her general store

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: En una tienda del barrio donde vive, Maria Isabel vende al detal productos de la canasta familiar a todos sus vecino de un amplio sector muy cercano al liugar de su vivienda;  ella iniciò este negocio hace mas de 7 años cuando lo comprò y aunque esta ubicada en un local arrendado le ha ido muy bien y ha logrado comprar vitrinas adicionales, las cuales le ayudan a hacer una mejor exhibiciòn de sus mercancias; Su poco capital de trabajo muchas veces no le permite hacer inversiones de mercancia en volumenes y ganar descuentos, por eso busca la oportunidad de aumentar su capital de trabajo a travès de credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, el cual dirigirà a la compra de ranchos, viveres y una nueva vitrina. Su sueño es tener su propio local para ahorrarse el arriendo y generar mayores ingresos que le permitan sacar adelante a su familia, conformada por sus 3 hijos en las edades de 18 a 26, años con quienes sueña ver exitosos y son su principal motivacion en la vida.
texts.en:
María Isabel sells at retail products common to the family grocery basket in a store located in the neighborhood where she lives to her neighbors in a wide area around where she lives.

She started the business over 7 years ago when she bought it and, although it’s located in a rented space, she’s done very well and has managed to buy additional display cases which help her display her merchandise better.

Her little working capital sometimes makes it impossible for her to invest in larger volumes of merchandise and earn discounts and that’s why she’s looking for an opportunity to increase her working capital through a Kiva loan which will be her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy snacks, foodstuffs and a new display case.

Her dream is to have her own locale to save on rent and generate higher income to support her family which is composed of three children between the ages of 18 and 26; she dreams with seeing them become successful and they are her main motivators in life.

loans.use: to buy snacks, foodstuffs and a new display case.

loans.name: Juan Edilberto

texts.es:
Juan, vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, él tiene un taller de sistemas de escapes y radiadores, desde hace 11 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de escapes y radiadores, empaques, aditivos y productos relacionados con el sistema de escape, este préstamo le ayudara a ofrecer a los clientes una variedad de productos.
Su aspiración es ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios, al mismo tiempo invertir en el negocio para que este crezca.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and four children.  He has had an exhaust and radiator repair shop for 11 years.

He is asking for a loan to buy tail pipes, radiators, seals, additives and other products related to the exhaust system.  This loan will help him offer variety of products to his customers.

His goal is to help his children with their schooling while still investing in his business so that it will grow.

loans.use: to buy tail pipes, radiators, seals and additives.

loans.name: El Tesoro Group

texts.en:
Yaquelin is the coordinator of El Tesoro (The treasure), a group maD. up of thirty micro-entrepreneurs. This group is located in the city of La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the sugar cane harvest, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. 

Yaquelin lives with her long-term partner and three children, and operates a colmado, a grocery store, run in a neighborhood whose people buy their daily meals. She will use this loan to purchase goods like rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, and canned food to increase her store's inventory. 

She is excited to receive her fifth loan with Esperanza and her group, as with each loan she has been able to improve her business, making it possible for her to proviD. for her family's needs and introduce different products to her children. She says that her moS.difficult challenge is to continue improving her business and help to proviD. for her children's education. She enjoys working in her little store and her dream is to have a big grocery store or a supermarket. 

She thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group. 

Notes: Pictures are separate because of the quantity of members.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Gina Marcela

texts.es: Gina Marcel, es una joven de 27 años que vive en el municipio de Galapa, a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposo y su hijo de 4 años de edad. Allí se dedica al comercio en un punto de venta, en su microempresas que lleva por nombre “Variedades Ilusión”. Su experiencia de  negocio la adquirió trabajando  en almacenes como vendedora de productos mediante catálogos, hasta que apoyada por su esposo, se dedicó a buscar un local, ganar clientes y emprender con mucho empeño su propio negocio. Su sueño es tener un local propio y vender mercancía por volúmenes, para ganar descuentos importantes que ofrecen los proveedores, cuando sus clientes compran en mayor cantidad y de contado. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que realiza a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará productos de mayor rotación, como artículos de piñatería,  productos plásticos de hogar en mayor volumen. Su mayor desafío lo tuvo hace algún tiempo,  cuando perdió dinero de cuentas por cobrar y esto la enseñó a ser más selectiva con el otorgamiento de crédito a sus clientes y  a hacer énfasis en la venta de contado.
texts.en: Gina Marcela is a young woman of 27 years old who lives in the town of Galapa, 10 minutes from the city of Barranquilla, with her husband and their 4 year old son. She dedicates her time to her small business, at her sales outlet that she calls "Variedades Ilusión”. She gained her business experience working as a saleswoman for warehouses selling products through catalogues. She did this until, with her husband's support, she determined to find a location, win customers, and start her own business. Her dream is to have her own premises and to sell merchandise in bulk, to make the most of the big discounts offered by the suppliers when buying in bulk and in cash. Her Kiva loan is the first finance she has had with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With is she will buy in bulk those products which move quickly, such as piñatas and plastic homewares. The biggest setback she has faced was one occasion when she lost money on unpaid invoices. This taught her to be more selective in allowing her customers credit, and has made her place her emphasis on cash sales.

loans.use: to buy products that have a good turnover, such as piñatas and plastic homewares.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials and animal feed

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es: Jonathan, tiene la edad de 28 años, está soltero  y vive solo. El pretende con el crédito compra la semilla de lechuga y culantro para sembrar en su invernadero. También quiere hacerle una mejoras para así tenerlo en buenas condiciones y amplio para mas producción. El cuenta con el terreno prestado donde creó este invernadero y cuenta con varios años de experiencia en la producción de hortalizas. El quiere generar ganancias para su propio bienestar y así  también ir creciendo como un productor de hortalizas de la zona Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en: Jonathan, age 28, is single and lives alone. He will use the loan to buy lettuce and coriander seeds to sow in his greenhouse. He also wants to make some improvements so that he has the best growing conditions and can increase his production. He was loaned the land where he has created this greenhouse and he has several years experience of growing vegetables and herbs. He wants to generate income to support himself and to continue expanding as a grower. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had loans before from any of the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan at good terms and with very low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy seed and make improvements to his greenhouse.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica a la reparación de motocicletas, vive con su esposa y su hija, él tiene un taller en su casa donde vende accesorios y repara motocicletas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar accesorios y repuestos para las motocicletas, esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar el capital de trabajo, manteniendo surtido el taller y ofrecer un mejor servicio.
Su objetivo es mejorar el taller y crecer en el negocio, generar una mayor estabilidad para tener una mejor condición de vida con su familia.
texts.en: Juan dedicates his time to the repair of motorcycles. He lives with his wife and daughter. He has a workshop at home, where he repairs motorbikes and sells motorbike accessories. He is currently seeking a loan to buy accessories and parts for the bikes. This investment will help him increase his working capital, keep his workshop well stocked and offer a better service. His goal is to improve the workshop and grow the business, to have greater stability and thus a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy accessories and parts for motorbikes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.es:
Apolinario, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, él vive con sus siete hijos y su esposa, sus hijos estudian,Él trabaja la tierra, además vende bananos y leña, por la parte de su esposa pues se dedica a la venta de pupusas.
Él está en proceso de iniciar el cultivo de maíz y frijol, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de abonos, semillas y herramientas para la poda del terreno, esta inversión será muy útil pues se dotara de las herramientas para llevar a cabo la siembra con un adecuado cuido.
Sus sueños es que sus hijos crezcan saludables, tener una fuente de ingreso que le permita proveerles lo necesario, ya que son varios y se preocupa por que tengan acceso al estudio, que les dé una oportunidad de superarse.
texts.en: Apolinario cultivates corn and beans. He lives with his seven children and his wife. His children are in school and work the land. Additionally they sell bananas and firewood. On the part of his wife, she has a pupusa business. He is in the process of starting his corn and bean plantation, which is why he requests a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and tools for his land. This investment will be very useful because he will be able to supply himself with the tools he needs to provide the maintenance that his plantations need. His dreams are to see his children grow in a healthy way and to have a source of income to provide them with what they need. He has many kids and he is committed to give them access to an education, which will give them an opportunity to improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and tools for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ladies' handbags, sandals, ladies' shoes in general, pants, hats, jeans, fashion jewelry, and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm and sodabi (palm-based drink) jerrycans

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha S. S. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 35 años, es madre soltera y tiene un niño de 10 años.

Desde muy  joven  le gustaba los negocios,  es así que se inicia en el negocio de venta de carnes asadas a la parrilla.  Debido a las gran competencia  decide cambiar de negocio por la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad para el ama de casa, invirtiendo un pequeño capital de S/. 400.00 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2700.00 surtirá su negocio con mas  productos, comprará cocoa, aceite , leche en cajas , insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela. 


Martha  es una mujer luchadora,  su sueño es contar con un Mini Market.
Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Martha S. S. is a member of the communal bank "Las Margaritas II", located in the district of Tarapoto, of the province and department of San Martin. She is 35 years old and she is a single mother of a 10-year old boy.

She enjoyed commerce ever since she was very young. This is how she started her grilled meats business. Given the great competition she decided to change her business to a grocery and general store carrying basic needs products for housewives. She made a capital investment of S/. 400. 

With this loan of S/.2700 she will supply her business with more products. She will purchase cocoa, cooking oil, boxed milk, personal care products, cleaning supplies, soft drinks, and other products to keep her clientele satisfied.

Martha is a hardworking woman. Her dream is to have a mini market.

She is very thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva Field Partner) for helping women like her to have opportunities to realize their dreams.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa, cooking oil, boxed milk, personal care products, cleaning supplies, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y administran una tienda, dicha actividad la tienen desde hace 4 años, su horario es de 6:00am a 7:00pm, hasta la fecha no han tenido dificultades en el negocio.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como azúcar, aceite, arroz, frijoles, huevos entre otros que son muy necesarios para la tienda, este préstamo le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y a generar una mejor situación económica con su familia.
Su objetivo es que a través del negocio pueda tener mejor estabilidad y una vida digna con su esposa.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife. They administer a store, a business they have had for 4 years. Their hours of operation are from 6:00am to 7:00pm. Up to date they have not had any problems with the business.

He requests a loan to purchase merchandise such as sugar, cooking oil, rice, beans, eggs, and other products that are very necessary for the store. This loan will help him strengthen the business and to generate a better financial situation for the family. 

His business objective is to achieve greater stability and a dignified life with his wife.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as sugar, cooking oil, rice, beans, and eggs.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Miscelánea “La Gloria de Dios es el negocio que emprendió Rogelio y su esposa al salir de su pueblo natal y llegar a la gran ciudad con expectativas de alcanzar el éxito trabajando. Ellos iniciaron con un pequeño capital y vendiendo pocas mercancias, lo que gradualmente ha dado resultados y se ha reflejado en el bienestar de su familia que la integran su esposa y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 26 a 35 años y especialmente en el mejoramiento de las condiciones habitacionales.
Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que Rogelio hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el comprará mercancías variadas como gafas, camisetas, ganchos, esquelas, papelería chancletas y accesorios femeninos. Su meta más adelante es  reactivar la confección pues tiene una infraestructura que desea reactivar y ofrecer en su punto de ventas y a través de vendedoras. Su máximo desafió es su capital de trabajo, pues en comparación con el mercado que maneja, es muy pequeño para responder a su demanda  de manera oportuna. Mientras logra aumentarlo, dirige todos sus esfuerzos a mantener  su sostenibilidad en el negocio que en la actualidad le representa una utilidad no menor de un 50%.
texts.en:
The store named "La Gloria de Dios" is the business that Rogelio and his wife started after they left their birthplace and when they came to the big city. They had great expectations to be successful in their work. They started out with a small capital fund and they had few merchandise but they gradually saw results and this has been mirrored in the wellbeing of the family. His family is made up of his wife and their 4 children, aged from 26 to 35. They have especially seen improvements in the condition of their home.

This Kiva loan is the first loan that Rogelio has had through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With it he will purchase a variety of merchandise, such as eye glasses, t-shirts, hooks, school supplies, sandals, and ladies' accessories. His goal for the future is to restart production, especially because he has the infrastructure ready to use, and to sell in retail and through other merchants. His greatest challenge is his working capital. IN comparison with the competition the business is very small to be able to respond to client demands in an opportune manner. While he works on expanding, he directs all of his efforts to maintain his business profitable. Currently that represents a profit margin of no less than 50%.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise, such as eye glasses, t-shirts, hooks, school supplies, sandals, and ladies' accessories.

loans.name: Obidio

texts.es: Obidio, de 29 años, es un hombre carismático y trabajador, convive con María, de 20 años; ambos tienen un hijo; Ángelo de un año y 7 meses de nacido. Los tres viven en casa de su madre ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. Hace algunos años atrás se dedica al arado de la tierra; con ayuda de dos toros que tiene y le facilitan en este trabajo; por ello procura darles una buena alimentación para que estén saludables y fuerte. Al ver la rentabilidad que le genera la agricultura, ha decidido tener dos toros más, de esa manera puede dinamizar su trabajo. Obidio desde que era muy pequeño le enseñaron trabajar la tierra y desde entonces le apasiona su trabajo; todos los días le dedica un poco de su tiempo al cultivo de papa, arveja y habas; los que después vende en el mercado central de su ciudad y en temporadas de mayor cosecha vienen los mismos comerciantes a su terreno de cultivo para negociar los frutos que le brindan la tierra. Pero lo que le disgusta son las temporadas de sequía; donde tiene pérdidas de sus sembríos. Dentro de un año construirá su propia casa, ya que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Progresistas de Chiras”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde  le gusta mucho compartir experiencias con los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado comprará 3 toros, con los cuales trabajará en el arado de la tierra.
texts.en: Obidio is 29 years old and his is a charismatic and hardworking man who lives with his common-law wife, Maria, who is 20 years old. They each have a son together, Angelo, and he is 1 year and 7 months old. The three of them life in his mother's house located in the community of Chiras. For a few years he has been plowing land with the help of two bulls that he owns. He makes sure he provides them with good food, to keep them healthy and strong. Seeing the profitability in agriculture, he has decided to get two more bulls in order to revitalize his business. Obidio was taught how to work the land since he was very young and since then he is passionate about the work. He dedicates some time every day to work in his potato, pea and fava bean cultivations. He later sells the products in the central market and during the high times of the harvest the merchants themselves come to the fields to negotiate for the products from his land. He doesn't like the dry seasons because he sees losses in his plantations. Within the next year he will build a house to provide a better quality of life for his family. He is a member of the communal bank "Progresistas de Chiras" and it is his fifth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He very much enjoys sharing experiences with the other members of the communal bank. With the loan which he requests he will purchase 3 bulls which he will use in plowing the land.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bulls.

loans.name: Clauida Esmeralda

texts.es:
Claudia, vive con su familia, tiene una hija D. 3 años D. edad, Claudia administra una tienda desD. hace 8 años, inicio con el apoyo D. su esposo, lo atienD. todos los días D. 5:00am a 7:00pm, tiene como ventaja que transita mucha gente por la zona.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite,  papel higiénico, y más productos que son necesarios en el negocio, este préstamo le ayudara a dar estabilidad y buen servicio a los clientes, tener la posibilidad D. aumentar sus ventas y la preferencia que quienes consumen sus productos.
Claudia quiere apoyar a su esposo pues está por finalizar su carrera en enfermería, también a su hija para que crezca y en el futuro pueda superarse.
texts.en:
Claudia lives with her family and she has a 3-year old daughter. Claudia has had a store for the past 8 years. She started out with her husband's help. She operates the business every day from 5:00am to 7:00pm. She has the advantage that there are many passers-by in the region. 

She requests a loan to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, bathroom tissue, and other products that are necessary for her business. This loan will help her add stability to her business and to offer her clients a good level of service. She will have the opportunity to increase her sales and to acquire a preference from her clients who consume her products.

Claudia wants to support her husband while he completes training for his nursing career, as well as to support her children to give them an opportunity to improve themselves.

loans.use: to to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, and bathroom tissue to supply her store.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo” ubicado en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento D. Puno, tiene 57 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 06 hijos (5 independientes).  Estudió educación secundaria. 
Juana se dedica a la compra y venta D. soga, ovejas y chanchos (cerdos), trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace más D. tres años.  Su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará un paquete D. cabuya (sogas). Trabaja sola en su negocio ya que su esposo trabaja fuera D. la ciudad en el magisterio D. la región.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y sobre todo mejorar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta D. Manuela Ramos es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank "Chijuyo Copapujo". It is located in the district of Ilave, in the province of Collao and the department of Puno. She is 57 years old, married, and she has 6 children (5 are independent). She has a high school education.

Juana buys and sells rope, sheep, and pigs. She has been with the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva Field Partner) for more than three years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/. 500 nuevos soles and she invested the funds in her business.

With this new loan, amounting to S/. 500 nuevos soles, she will purchase a package of sisal (rope). She works alone in the business because her husband works outsiD. the city for the regional government. Her dream is to improve her income and above all, her income. 

What she enjoys about Manuela Ramos is the easy loan process.

loans.use: to purchase a package of sisal rope.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, vive con sus nietos a su cargo D. 18 y 22 años D. edad, administra una tienda donD. ofrece productos D. primera necesidad, desD. hace 21 años, este negocio lo fundó junto a su esposo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. productos domésticos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, huevos, pastas. Este préstamo le cubrirá este gasto y dará mayor estabilidad al negocio y a sus ingresos, ya que su familia y ella dependen del negocio.
Su objetivo es ayudar a sus nietos, velar por sus necesidades y sus estudios, hasta que logren ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Sonia lives with her grandchildren who are in her care. They are 18 and 22 years old. She has a store from where she sells basic needs products. She has had the business for 21 years and it was founded by her husband. 

She requests a loan to purchase household products, such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, eggs, and pasta. This loan will cover this expense and it will proviD. her business and her income with greater stability. She and her family depend on this business. 

Her objective is to help her grandchildren, to proviD. for their needs and to send them to school, until they have achieved a career.

loans.use: to purchase household products, such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, eggs, and pasta.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa casado su esposo es comerciante sus hijos estudian y que se profesionalicen es su meta. Juntos como familia trabajan en su negocio una comideria y  refresquería el punto de venta en su vivienda. iniciaron con fondos propios y vendian ambulantemente.  Incrementar sus ventas es el plan para la actualidad ingresando a la venta mayores cantidades y variedad de mercaderías como: reposterías, galletas, arroz, frijoles, carnes de res, pollo y cerdo entre otros productos. Agradece a la financiera por su continuo apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en: Rosa is married to her husband, a merchant, and her children are in school. Their goal is to achieve a career. Together as a family they work on their restaurant business which is located in their house. They started out with their own funds and by selling itinerantly. The plan now is to increase their sales by introducing larger quantities and more variety of products, such as: pastries, cookies, rice, beans, beef, chicken, and pork meat, and other products. She is thankful to the organization for their continued support in the development of the business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her catering business.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo  tiene un restaurante en el barrio La pradera, donde vende sancochos, mute de queso, yuca con suero y otras delicias de la comida propia de la costa caribe, por eso su restaurante lleva este nombre “Restaurante Típico sabanero” pues proveniente de la Sabana de Córdoba , inició su idea emprendedora en la ciudad de Barranquilla, cuando el barrio apenas tenia sus primeros habitantes,  vendiendo en un principio frituras  y jugos naturales de naranja, limón, mango, zapote, níspero, sandía, melón y guanábana; cuando poco a poco fue creciendo, adicionó la comida corriente, con el fin de aprovechar la clientela que había ganado. Hoy vende en un espacio de su casa que para el crecimiento del negocio le ha quedado pequeño y este es justamente su desafío, adecuarlo y más adelante ubicar un nuevo punto de venta. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas, como arroz, carnes, verduras en volumen para ganar descuentos por la compra de contado y enseres de cocina y trabajar más holgado con la clientela. Pablo en su condición de casado y con 4 hijos en las edades de 12 a 23 años sueña con verlos exitosos y todos los días se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia mediante su trabajo.
texts.en: Pablo has a restaurant located in the community of La Pradera where he sells stews, cream of cheese soup, yucca meals, and other of his own delicious recipes traditional to the Caribbean Coast. That is why the restaurant bears the name "Restaurante Tipico Sabanero". It is located in Cordoba's savannah region. He thought of his enterprising idea in the city of Barranquilla when the community had its first inhabitants. At first he sold fried foods and natural fruit drinks, including orange, lemon, mango, zapote (a fleshy tropical fruit), medlar, watermelon, melon, and guanabana (a fragrant tropical fruit). His business gradually expanded and he added common foods with the goal of catering to the clientele he had already won. Today he has a space in his house that has become too small to support the growth of his business and this is just the challenge he faces. He needs to recondition it and in the future to move it to a new location. His Kiva loan is the first he has with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and with it he will purchase ingredients, such as rice, meats, and vegetables in large volumes to earn discounts on cash sales. He will also purchase tools for the kitchen to be able to serve his clients more freely. Pablo is married and he has 4 children between the ages of 12 and 23. He dreams of seeing them achieve success and every day he works to support his family through his business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, such as rice, meats, and vegetables.

loans.name: Eda Maria

texts.es:
Eda de 59 años de edad, casada, con una familia de seis hijos, todos casados hoy en día. Su esposo es jubilado. 
Eda tiene su propio negocio, el alquiler de cuarto, iniciando por iniciativa propia al tener un cuarto vacía el cual nace la idea de alquilar, lo que le funciono logrando alquilar otro más. 
Ya que con los ingresos de alquiler paga los gastos básicos de luz, agua,  así como gastos personales.
La demanda de alquilar por sus clientes se ha mantenido, lo cual quiere comenzar a construir otro cuarto lo que no cuenta con todo el capital, busca financiamiento en Afodenic para comenzar hacer un cuarto en donde comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar y que espera a futuro terminal por este medio que le es más viable la construcción.
texts.en:
Eda is 59 years old, married, and she has a family of six children. They are all married now. Her husband is retired.

Eda has her own business, renting a bedroom. She started out under her own initiative. When she had a vacant room she thought of the idea to rent it. It worked out well so she wants to rent another one. The rental income pays for the basic expenses, including electricity, water, and other personal expenses.

The demand by clients wanting to rent has been steady, which is why she wants to start building another room. She does not have the entire capital funds she needs so she requests a loan from Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner), to start building the room. She will purchase construction materials such as building rocks, sand, cement, and steel. She hopes to finish building it in the future and this is the most viable way to build.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as building rocks, sand, cement, and steel.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 19 y 24 años de edad, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, desde hace 35 años aprendió de su padre todo el proceso necesario para trabajar la tierra, su horario es de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento de plagas, este préstamo le ayudara a tener todos los insumos necesarios antes de iniciar el proceso de siembra, teniendo una mayor seguridad en el cultivo.  
Su objetivo es apoyar a su familia, con los gastos más necesarios, y velar por su bienestar.
texts.en:
Miguel with his wife and their two children, aged 19 and 24. He has been cultivating corn and beans for the past 5 years. He learned from his father the necessary process to work the land. His work schedule is from 6:00am to 3:00pm He requests a loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. This loan will help him have all the products he needs before starting the plantation. This will help secure the cultivation. 

His objective is to support his family, to cover the most necessary expenses, and to ensure their wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to use on his farm land.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en el caserío Ayar Auca (comunidad rural de condición pobre) ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura.

La actividad que desarrolla, Francisca,  es la crianza de ganado ovino y de aves de corral, ella los cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Francisca ayuda económicamente a su esposo, quien es profesor y cuyo sueldo  se utiliza en los gastos del hogar y obligaciones crediticias. Los vecinos de Francisca consideran que estos tienen una buena relación familiar. 

Francisca solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1300 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus ovinos y sus aves de corral (pavos y patos) para así poderlos vender a un mejor precio y seguir creciendo en su actividad. 

Francisca es un cliente conocida para Edpyme Alternativa su primer crédito lo pagó puntualmente
texts.en:
Francisca is a 37 year-old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the small village of Ayar Auca (a poor, rural community) which is located in Tambogrande district - Piura.

Francisca's business activity is raising sheep and poultry.  She raises and fattens the animals and then sells them in the local market.  Francisca financially helps her husband who is a teacher and whose salary they use to cover household expenses and loan obligations.  Francisca's neighbors consider them to have a good family relationship.

Francisca is requesting a loan for 1,300 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy balanced feed for fattening her sheep and poultry (turkeys and ducks) so that she can sell them at a better price and continue growing in her business.

Francisca is an existing client of Edpyme Alternativa and she repaid her first loan on time.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for sheep and poultry

loans.name: Maria Olinda

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, no cuenta  con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, a 40 minutos  del departamento de Piura.  Esta  zona se caracteriza por que sus pobladores se dedican a la comercialización de animales, agricultura y ganadería.

Desde hace varios años María se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de aves de aves de corral (pavos, gallinas y patos) y ganado ovino (ovejas), sus  corrales lo tiene en la parte externa de su casa para mayor seguridad y comodidad.  Sus animales los alimenta con dieta balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su desarrollo ideal los ofrece en los distintos mercados de la ciudad de Piura, lo cual le permite aumentar sus ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Por lo mismo María a solicitado un préstamo  de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Aleternativa para comprar alimentos balanceados e implentar un corral pequeño para sus  aves de corral, ambas cosas van ayudar a que laventade sus animales se incremente, permitiéndole cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  El objetivo de María es que en un futuro su negocio sea la venta al por mayor de animales y así sacar adelante a su familia en especial a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is a 31 year-old mother who lives in her own home together with her husband and children.  Her home does not have basic services and is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, 40 minutes from Piura department.  This area is noted for the fact that its residents sell animals, farm and raise livestock.

For several years, María has been buying, raising and selling poultry (turkeys, hens and ducks) and sheep.  Her pens are located outside her home for greater safety and comfort.  She feeds her animals a balanced diet and natural pasture.  Once they have reached an ideal level of development, she offers them for sale in the different markets in the city of Piura.  This allows her to make profits to cover her daily household needs.

María has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed and to set up a small pen for her poultry.  Both of these things will help her to increase her animal sales and allow her to repay her loan and improve her family's quality of life.  María's goal is to start selling animals wholesale and thereby get her family ahead in life, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and to set up a pen for her animals

loans.name: Piedad

texts.es:
Piedad es una mujer casada  que tiene un hijo de 13 años, ella vende mercancía  variada mediante guías especializadas de productos, que financia a sus clientela conformada por vecinos, familiares, y referidos. Su negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para su hogar, así como también el aporte que su esposo hace, producto de su trabajo persistente en la construcción en Santa Marta, ciudad ubicada a menos de 2 horas de Barranquilla. 
Piedad siempre está pensando en llevarles a sus clientes lo mejor, porque está en la búsqueda de las ofertas permanentes que hacen las revistas, para vendérselas y ellos satisfechos con el precio de sus mercancías, no la cambian aunque tengan muchas oportunidades de compra.  Su sueño más adelante es abrir un local al público, para ofrecer un servicio visual que impacte por el buen surtido y dirigido a todos los gustos y todas las edades. Mientras construye su sueño ella continúa esforzándose con acciones de venta que impacten sus ingresos y generando un margen de utilidad no menor del 35% y rotando  sus inventarios cada 10 días. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él planea comprar accesorios femeninos en descuento, así como cosméticos, artículos de aseo personal, que ya tiene encargados por sus clientes y esto augura una inversión de éxito, porque su experiencia le ha enseñado a ser muy selectivo con ellos, para no tener inconvenientes en la recuperación de su pequeño capital, que quiere incrementar con su esfuerzo de trabajo.
texts.en: Piedad is a married woman and she has a 13-year old son. She sells a variety of merchandise on credit through specialized product guides to her clientele, composed of her neighbors, family, and referred customers. Her business is an important source of income for her household, as is the income her husband earns through his continued work in construction in Santa Marta, located at least 2 hours from the city of Barranquilla. Piedad always tries to provide her clients with the best. She is always in search of permanent offers made by the catalogues to sell and to keep her clients satisfied with the price of their merchandise. She doesn't change them even if there are many opportunities to buy. Her dream for the future is to open a store to the general public, to have a business with a visual impact by displaying a variety of products, directed to all types of tastes and ages. While she builds on her dream she will continue to place an effort in finding sales that will impact her income and to generate a profit margin no less than 35% and to keep her an inventory rotation schedule of 10 days. Her Kiva loan is the first she has with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and with it she plans on purchasing ladies' accessories that are on sale, as well as cosmetics, and personal hygiene products. Her clients have placed orders and this augurs a successful investment. Her experience has taught her to be very selective with them to avoid inconveniences in recovering her small capital and needing to increase her effort in the business.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' accessories, cosmetics and personal hygiene products for resale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, D. 54 años, está casada con Feliciano, con quien tiene 9 hijos. Pero solo vive con 4 D. ellos, en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío D. Bellavista. Como buena madre, se dedica en cuerpo y alma al cuidado y desarrollo D. sus hijos, quienes estudian educación superior en la capital del país; por lo tanto debe proporcionarles un dinero mensualmente. Dicho capital lo obtiene gracias al arduo trabajo que realiza en su tienda, donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad; a los pobladores D. su localidad. Asimismo se dedica a la siembra D. papa, arveja y maíz, en sus terrenos propios, ubicados en la zona alta D. Huandunga, donD. tiene un canal D. riego a disposición. Según menciona, que durante sus 15 años D. experiencia, tiene gran éxito vendiendo sus productos cosechado a los comerciantes mayoristas del mercado central D. Tarma. Asimismo, se dedica a la crianza D. animales como: carneros, vacas y toros, los cuales le ayudan a labrar la tierra, como también a incursionar en la venta D. carne, a los vecinos y carniceros que la visitan constantemente. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donD. agradece el apoyo que le brindan en este momento. El techo D. la casa D. Carmen, está roto, constantemente ingresa agua y polvo. Por ello con el crédito, invertirá en el cambió total del techado, colocando un material más resistente.
texts.en: Carmen is 54 years old and she is married with Feliciano. They have 9 children together but they only live with 4 of them. The lives in a house of their own located in the community of Bellavista. As a good mother she dedicates her body and soul in the care and development of her children. They are enrolled in post-secondary education in the country's capital city. She needs to proviD. them with a monthly allowance. Her income is earned through arduous work at her store where she sells basic needs products to the public in her community. She also cultivates potatoes, peas, and corn on her own farm land, located in the region of Alta D. Huandunga, where there is an irrigation channel at her disposal. As she mentioned, she has 15 years' experience and she feels very excited to sell her harvest to the wholesalers of the central market in Tarma. She also raises livestock, including rams, cows, and bulls. They help her plow the land and she also sells them as meat to the neighbors and butchers who visit her frequently. This is her first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is thankful for the support they have given her. The roof on Carmen's house is broken and water and dust are always coming in. For this reason she will invest her loan in installing a new roof entirely, maD. of more resistant materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to replace the roof on her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural products and livestock feed.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene 01 hijo.  La señora no cuenta con estudios. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace más de tres años.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales caseros y artefactos usados.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 100.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital que tiene y comprará artefactos para luego venderlos.

La socia nos cuenta que también hacen chacra (cosecha) como: papa, cebada, trigo, trabaja junto con su esposo e hijo, la señora cuenta que viaja a diferentes lugares con  su negocio ofreciendo sus productos.
Lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es lo que gana el ahorro y las facilidades de los préstamos.  Su sueño es crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Valentina is a member of the communal bank "Chijuyo Copapujo", located in the district of Ilave of the province of El Collao in the department of Puno. She is 47 years old, married, and she has 1 child. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. 

She has been with the Manuela Ramos Movement for more than three years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/. 500 nuevos soles and she invested the funds in her business buying and selling livestock and used goods. 

This new loan is in the amount of S/. 100 and it will supplement her capital funds to purchase merchandise for resale.

She tells us that she also has farm land where she cultivates: potatoes, barley and wheat. She works with her husband and son. She says that she travels to different locations to sell her products. 

What she enjoys about her communal bank is that her savings earn an interest, and the easy loan process. 

Her dream is to make her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase second hand merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, tiene la edad de 46 años, está casada, vive con sus tres hijos, su esposo y su madre. Ella lo que pretende es hacerle unas mejoras a su tostadora de plátano para poder seguir adelante con su negocio. Ella le hará unas mejoras como es cerrar por completo las instalaciones de su negocio y sacar los permisos necesarios para  trabajar bajo los niveles de salubridad determinados. Ella con estos mejoras lo que pretende es tener más respaldo de sus productos y así aumentar su comercio y generar las ganancias para seguir creciendo y mejorar su bienestar familiar. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Maria is 46 years old , married, and she lives with her three children, her husband, and her mother. She plans on making some improvement to her banana toaster to be able to keep moving forward with her business. She will make some improvements, including to completely enclose her business installations and to acquire the necessary permits to work under the necessary health codes. With these improvements she intends on getting more backing for her products and to increase her business to generate more income. This will enable her to keep growing and to improve the wellbeing of her family. This is the first loan she receives from Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner). She has not had any previous loans with state banks. But Fudecosur has granted her a loan with greater ease and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to recondition her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural products and livestock feed.

loans.name: Carolina Yanira

texts.es:
Carolina, se dedica a la venta de meriendas, tortillas, empanadas, tiene ocho meses de dedicarse al negocio, su madre le ayudo para que tomara la decisión, ella vive con sus hijos quienes dependen de sus ingresos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para preparar las meriendas como: carnes, condimentos, verduras y lácteos, también comprar maíz, leña y utensilios de cocina. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar su producción generando más ganancias.
Su objetivo es mantenerse en el negocio, aumentando siempre su producción y el mejor servicio a los clientes.
texts.en:
Carolina sells snacks, tortillas, and breads. She has been in business for 8 months. Her mothers’ help her to make the decision. She lives with her children, all of whom depend on her income. 

She requests a loan to purchase ingredients to prepare snacks, such as: meats, condiments, vegetables, and dairy products. She will also purchase corn, firewood, and kitchen utensils. This investment will help her improve her production and to generate more income. 

Her objective is to maintain her business and to increase production to improve the level of services to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare snacks, such as: meats, condiments, vegetables, and dairy products.

loans.name: Walter Andres

texts.es:
Walter es un cliente de 31 años de edad que vive con su esposa y pequeño hijo en la zona rural de Yonan un caserío perteneciente a la ciudad de Cajamarca.  La comunidad donde vive Walter se caracteriza por tener áreas verdes por doquier y por la gente alegre y emprendedora que vive en ella.

Walter es una persona alegre que se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en mototaxi (moto que consta de una cabina en la parte trasera donde se pueden transportar pasajeros, medio de transporte muy común en las pequeñas comunidades del Perú). Además Walter y su esposa crían y venden animales de corral desde hace 6 años y cuentan  con buena clientela en su comunidad.

Walter es un hombre trabajador y solicita un préstamo para expandir uno de sus negociosos. El crédito solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2000 nuevos soles que Walter desea invertir en la compra de animales de corral (patos y cerdos) y en el mantenimiento de su moto esto le traerá consigo mayores ingresos para su familia.

Walter ha tenido créditos que ha cancelado puntual y responsablemente.
texts.en:
Walter is a 31 year-old client who lives with his wife and young son in the rural area of Yonan, a small village located in the city of Cajamarca.  The community where Walter lives is noted for having green areas all around and for the cheerful and entrepreneurial people who live in it.

Walter is a cheerful person who provides a passenger transport service in his motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle with a cabin in back for transporting passengers).  This mode of transport is very common in small communities in Peru.  In addition, Walter and his wife have been raising and selling farmyard animals for six years and have a good customer base in their community.

Walter is a hard-working man who is requesting a loan to expand one of his businesses.  He is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa and would like to invest that money in buying farmyard animals (ducks and pigs).  He would also like to have some maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi.  This will enable him to make more income for his family.

Walter has had previous loans which he repaid punctually and responsibly.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi and to buy animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Amandine

texts.fr: Jeune revendeuse de34 ans, Amandine est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Depuis le voyage de son mari en Allemagne, elle s’occupe seule de ses enfants. Elle vend des produits de beauté dans une boutique qu’elle a  louée. Elle à commencée depuis 2003 et s’approvisionne souvent à Lagos(NIGERIA) et sur place.
texts.en: A young 34-year-old reseller, Amandine is married with two children.  Since her husband left for Germany, she is taking care of her children alone.  She sells beauty products in a rented boutique.  She began her business in 2003 and often buys her supplies in Lagos (Nigeria) or locally.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, wigs, and hair extensions.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y tiene 04 hijos (3 independientes).  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, el préstamo inicial fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que utilizó en la compra de soga para luego venderlas en las ferias de Ilave, también se dedica a la crianza de vacas y chanchos.
Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, con lo que comprará un paquete de soga.
Paralelamente se dedica a la chacra de papa, habas, cebadas, trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y sobre todo mejorar sus ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta de Manuela Ramos es la facilidad del préstamo y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the “Chijuyo Copapujo” communal bank located in Ilave district, El Collao Province, Puno Department.  She is 55 years old, married and has four children (3 are independent).  She did not attend school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  Her initial, 500 new sol, loan was used to buy rope to later sell in Ilave’s markets; she also raises cows and pigs.

She will ask for a new 500 new sol loan that she’ll use to buy a package of rope.

In a parallel way she farms potatoes, broad beans and barley with her husband.

Her dream is to improve her business and, above all, improve her income.

What she likes about Manuela Ramos is the ease of getting loans and what she earns on her savings.

loans.use: to buy packages of rope.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Maria Rebeca

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de productos para el hogar, vive con sus hijos y el negocio consiste en la venta de productos domésticos, este es su fuente de ingreso del cual recibe para cubrir las necesidades.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la comprar más productos, como pastas, salsas, condimentos, frijoles, arroz, aceite, huevos y otros que son demandados, este préstamo le ayudara a cubrir las demandas de los clientes.
Su aspiración es mantener el negocio y ampliarlo, desarrollarse como comerciante para ayudar a sus hijos y que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
María sells household items.  She lives with her children.  Her business consists in selling domestic items.  This is her source of income to cover her needs.

She is asking for a loan to buy more products like: pasta, sauces, condiments, beans, rice, oil, eggs and others that are in demand.  This loan will help her meet customer demand.

Her wish is to stay in business and to enlarge it, to develop as a merchant and to help her children so that they can improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy pasta, sauces, condiments, beans, rice, oil and eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen  proveniente de Remolino Magdalena, llegó al departamento del Atlántico en condiciones de desplazamiento, para vivir allí con sus dos pequeñas hijas que en la actualidad tienen   23 y 25 años de edad y que a través de su esfuerzo de trabajo independiente, ha logrado sacarlas adelante en sus estudios y una de ellas es hoy profesional, mientras la otra se perfila para serlo. Con la muerte de su esposo y la responsabilidad de sus hijas, debió asumir el liderazgo de su hogar y con ello desarrolló su capacidad emprendedora, e inició su experiencia de negocio, vendiendo derivados lácteos en tiendas del sector y cárnicos dese el año 1998; posteriormente la Red de Solidaridad social le brindó la oportunidad de estudiar modistería, actividad a la que finalmente se dedicó enfocándola hacia la línea de jeans. Su principal mercado se encuentra en la comunidad donde vive y también tiene referidos en otros barrios, a los que distribuye para su uso personal o para la venta y que combina muy bien con su inicial actividad de vender lácteos y cárnicos. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará rollos de telas e insumos para atender la demanda de su clientela. Su sueño es terminar de educar a sus hijas y tener una vivienda propia, por eso todos los días se esfuerza por mejorar la calidad de sus prendas y aumentar su clientela. Su mayor desafío ocurrió cuando debió desplazarse de su tierra natal, pero gradualmente siente que ha salido  adelante con su familia, mediante el trabajo permanente y la fe en Dios.
texts.en:
Carmen is from Remolino Magdalena.  She was displaced to Atlántico department and settled there with her two young daughters who are now 23 and 25 years old.  Through her effort and work, she has managed to get her daughters ahead in their studies.  One of her daughters is now a professional and the other is about to become one.

With the death of her husband and the responsibility she had for her daughters, Carmen was forced to lead her household.  She developed her entrepreneurial abilities and started gaining business experience, selling dairy products and meat in stores in her sector.  She started this in 1998.  Later, the 'Network for Social Solidarity' gave her the opportunity to study dressmaking, a business activity in which she then began working, focusing in particular on making jeans.  Her main market is her local community.  She also has customers who she has been recommended to in other neighborhoods.  She distributes her products to these people for their own personal use or for them to sell.  This combines very well with her initial business activity of selling dairy products and meat.

This Kiva credit is the first loan that Carmen has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy rolls of fabric and supplies to meet her customers' demands.  Her dream is to finish educating her daughters and to own her own home.  For this reason, she works hard every day to improve the quality of the garments she makes and to increase her number of customers.  She faced her biggest challenge when she had to leave her home town but she feels that she has managed to get ahead in life with her family through her work and her faith in God.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric and supplies to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Simon Segundo

texts.es:
Simon Segundo tiene 28 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad El rayo, parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 25 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa se dedica a diferentes actividades como: agricultura, ganadería, comercio, crianza de animales, albañearía y aserradero.

Simon se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz, trigo y papas y aserrador de madera. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para la agricultura y material para trabajar. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar el estilo de vida.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Simon Segundo is 28, married, and lives with his wife and two children in Guaranda Canton in Bolívar Province. 

The Grupo Nucanchi Kawsay Communal Bank is located in the community of El Rayo, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda Canton, 25 minutes from the offices of Cooperativa San José. Its members work at different activities such as agriculture, cattle, small businesses, raising animals, construction, and working at a sawmill. 

Simon grows corn, wheat and potatoes, and works as a wood sawyer. He makes his purchases in the Guaranda marketplace and sells at the wholesale market in the same city. He requests the loan in order to purchase agricultural supplies and work materials. The support from this loan will help him meet his needs financially, and face challenges such as insect infestations, illnesses, and the vagaries of the weather. His dream is to improve his lifestyle. He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and work materials

loans.name: Ada Maria

texts.es:
Ada,vive con su esposo  y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la comercialización de sandalias, zapatos, tiene un molino de nixtamal y vende tortillas, Inicio con el molino hace 2 años, hoy día ha agregado otro rubro que es la venta de zapatos y sandalias desde hace un año.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de leña y maíz para hacer las tortillas, zapatos y sandalias para el negocio, este préstamo le ayudara a realizar una buena inversión a ambos negocios, mejorando el inventario y con la posibilidad de mejorar las ventas.
Sus aspiraciones es aumentar su inventario y expandir el negocio, que sus ventas aumenten y que le permita tener una mejor condición de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en: Ada llives with her husband and two children. She has a business selling sandals and shoes, and also has a mortar and pestle for nixtamal and sells tortillas. She started with the tortillas 2 years ago, and a year ago she added another enterprise selling shoes and sandals. She requests a loan to purchase firewood and corn for making the tortillas, and shoes and sandals to sell. This loan will help her make a good investment in both businesses, improving her inventory with the possibility of increased sales. Her dream is to increase her inventory and expand the business so her sales increase and allow her and her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and corn to make tortillas, and shoes and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene 03 hijos (2 independientes). La señora estudió hasta 3ro de educación primaria.
Josefa se dedica a la venta de sogas y ganados vacunos, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela  Ramos desde hace dos años.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste crédito de S/ 600.00 nuevo soles, comprará un toro para su engorde y luego venderlo dentro de 3 meses.  Trabaja sola, su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de Tacna.
Su sueño es mejorar el ganado y mejorar sus ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en: Josefa is a member of the “Chijuyo Copapujo” Communal Bank, located in the Ilave district in El Collao province, Puno department. She is 44, married, and has 3 children, 2 of whom are independent. Josefa studied to her third year of primary education. She sells ropes and cattle. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement organization for two years. Her first loan was for 500 soles (PEN), which she invested in her business. With this loan of 600 soles (PEN) she will purchase a bull to fatten it up and then sell it within 3 months. She works alone, as her husband works in the city of Tacna. Her dream is to improve the cattle and her income. What she likes most about the Communal Bank is how easy it is to get loans.

loans.use: to purchase a bull.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 26 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad El rayo, parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 25 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa se dedica a diferentes actividades como: agricultura, ganadería, comercio, crianza de animales, albañearía y aserradero.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz, trigo y papas. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de  material para trabajar. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una casa y comprar carro.

Le gusta escuchar música y ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto, 26, is married living with his wife and children in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.  He has 4 children.

The “NUCANCHI KAWSAY” communal bank is located in the community of El Rayo, Guanujo Parish, Guaranda canton 25 minutes from the Cooperative’s office.  The members are in a variety of occupations like: farming, cattle raising, commerce, small farm animal raising, bricklaying and sawmill.

Luis is a corn, wheat and potato farmer.  Purchases take place in Guaranda’s market and sales happen at the wholesale market in that same city.

He is asking for a loan to buy supplies for work.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and variations in the weather.  His dream is to have a house and to buy a car.

He enjoys listening to music and watching television.

loans.use: to buy supplies for work.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es:
Aurelio tiene 44 años D. edad y vive en L. zona rural del distrito D. Lambayeque, en una pequeña comunidad D. 200 familias aproximadamente.

Aurelio es una persona amable y trabajadora.  Él da todo por su familia y  amigos. DesD. hace más D. 6 años Aurelio, se dio cuenta  que L. crianza y comercialización D. animales le daba los frutos que antes no había podido conseguir. Así que decidió criar ganado ovino en L. parte trasera D. su casa. Aurelio ya conoce a L. perfección este rubro pues vio a sus padres ejercerlo cuando él vivía con ellos. Además, cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto D. actividades relacionadas al jornal en agricultura.

Con L. comercialización D. sus animales y las labores agrícolas,  Aurelio logró ahorrar para las mejoras que poco a poco fue haciendo en su casa. Ahora Aurelio desea una renovación D. su techo y es por eso que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 2000 nuevos soles que invertirá en L. compra D. planchas D. calaminas y tijerales que le permitirán tener una mejor construcción D. este.

Aurelio estaría muy agradecido D. concedérsele el crédito  pues le ayudaría a mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Aurelio is 44 years old and lives in the rural area of Lambayeque district, in a small community of 200 families.

Aurelio is a kind and hard-working person who gives his all for his family and friends.  More than six years ago, Aurelio realized that raising and selling animals provided him with rewards that he previously had not been able to achieve.  He therefore decided to raise sheep in an area behind his house.  Aurelio knows this business to perfection as he saw his parents carry out the same business when he used to live with them.  He also makes additional income from working as a day laborer on people's farms.

As a result of selling his animals and carrying out farm work, Aurelio managed to save up to make some improvements that he has gradually been carrying out on his home.  Now Aurelio would like to replace his roof.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will invest this money in buying corrugated metal sheets and trusses which will allow him to better build his roof.

Aurelio is very grateful for this loan as it will help him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to replace his roof

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stove to improve her business.

loans.name: Alexi

texts.es:
Alexi, es una persona muy trabajadora, vive con su familia y posee su propio negocio, en una mueblería y carpintería, inicio como empleado en otro taller y actualmente tiene la necesidad de comprar dos maquinas vitales para realizar sus trabajos.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas: dos cepilladoras electricas, una manual y otra de mesa, pues no cuenta con el monto suficiente para cubrir el gasto, por lo que este préstamo le ayudara muchísimo para realizar de una mejor manera los procesos de los muebles y ampliar la variedad de estilos.
Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio con la obtención de nuevas maquinas, de esta manera estar realizando un mejor trabajo que le genere más ganancias.
texts.en:
Alexi is a very hard-working person who lives with his family and owns his own business (a furniture store and carpentry workshop).  He started out as an employee in another workshop and currently needs to buy two machines which are essential for his workshop.
