Alexi is requesting a loan to buy two tools: a manual electric planer and a bench-mounted electric planer, as he does not have enough money to cover this expense.  The loan will help him a lot as he will improve his furniture and increase the range of styles he offers.

Alexi's goal is to strengthen his business by obtaining new machines.  In this way, he will produce better work which will make him more profits.

loans.use: to buy a manual electric planer and a bench-mounted electric planer.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel, de 49 años, convive desde hace 26 años con Daria, con quien tiene 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Huandunga, Palca. Hace más de 28 años, se dedica a la siembra de papa, maíz, arveja y habas, sobre sus 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas que posee. Asimismo menciona que gracias al auto que tiene, realiza el servicio de  trasporte público cubriendo las rutas de Palca a Tarma, puede obtener un ingreso extra para la economía de su familia. Desde entonces le va muy bien,  tanto que hace algún tiempo tenía 2 autos, con los que trabajaba, sin embargo tuvo perdidas en la siembra de arveja que tuvo que vede un carro. “No dejaré de sembrar, es mi vida”, afirma, pues le gusta mucho esta actividad, en el que desea intensificarse para aumentar su productividad. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente satisfecho por el apoyo. Pues cambiará su calidad de vida. El techo de la casa de Samuel, se encuentra con orificios donde ingresa agua. Por ello con el crédito invertirá en el techado de su casa, asimismo colocará puertas y ventanas de los cuartos que tiene 20 años de antigüedad.
texts.en:
Samuel, 49, has lived with Daria for the last 26 years.  They have four children but only two of them live with him in his own house located in Huandunga, Palca.  For over 28 years he’s farmed potatoes, peas, corn and broad beans on his 3 hectares of farmland.  He also mentions that thanks to owning a car he provides taxi services along the Talca-Palca route to earn extra income for his family.  He’s done very well since then so much so that not long ago he had two cars that he worked with but, unfortunately, he had some losses with his pea crops and had to sell one of the cars.

“I’ll never stop farming; it’s my life,” he affirms, because he enjoys this activity very much.  He wants to intensify it in order to increase production.

This is his first loan with MFP where he feels very satisfied with the support because it will change his quality of life.  

The roof on Samuel’s house has holes in it that let water in.  Because of this he’ll use the loan to reroof his house as well as install doors and windows on the rooms which are 20 years old.

loans.use: to roof his house and replace doors and windows.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo” ubicado en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento D. Puno, tiene 59 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 06 hijos (3 independientes).  La señora estudió educación primaria (incompleta).
María se dedica a la venta D. animales caseros y venta D. soga, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace un año, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará dos paquetes D. cabuyas (sogas) para luego venderlas.  En el negocio la ayudan sus hijos ya que su esposo trabaja fuera D. la ciudad.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y crecer como empresaria.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
María is a member of the "Chijuyo Copapujo” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 59 years old, married, and has six children (three of whom live independently).  She did not complete her elementary school education.

María sells animals and rope.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her initial loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business.

María will use this loan for 1,000 soles to buy two packets of pita fiber (rope) to re-sell.  Her children help her in her business since her husband works outsiD. the city.  Her dream is to improve her business and grow as a businesswoman.

What María likes about her community bank is the interest she makes on her savings.

loans.use: to buy two packets of pita fiber (rope)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, beams and bolts to replace some roofing and to increase the size of the shelter he uses for his business

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro tiene un negocio donde vende frituras y chicha de maíz, actividad generadora de ingresos que nació desde que él era muy niño, cuando apoyaba a su padre, quien fuera propietario de un negocio con estas mismas características desde hace más de  40 años.  Ramiro siguiendo el legado familiar también inició el suyo propio, con el cual se siente muy contento de sus ingresos provenientes de este negocio, pues ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia conformada por su esposa y su hijo de 27 años y también consiguió tener una vivienda propia en uno de los barrios más tradicionales de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Su credikiva es el cuarto financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará insumos para su negocio y hará adecuaciones a su vivienda, Con sus créditos anteriores pudo dotar su negocio, de herramientas y equipos, hacer mejoramiento a su vivienda e incrementar su capital de trabajo. Su sueño más adelante, es aprovechar el espacio de su vivienda para dividirla de manera independiente y arrendar una parte de ella, con ello lograría nuevos ingresos, pero mientras esto ocurre, Ramiro persiste en su trabajo permanente con tal lograr su sueño al lado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Ramiro has a business where he sells fast food and corn chicha (corn-based beverage), an activity that generates income and started when he was a little boy helping his father who had a similar business for over 40 years.

Following the family tradition, Ramiro started his own business and he is very happy with the income it generates since it’s made it possible for him to move his family, which consists of his wife and 27 year old son, forward.  He also managed to acquire a house of his own in one of Barranquilla’s most traditional neighborhoods.

His Kiva loan is his fourth financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it buy ingredients for his business and to do some home improvements.  He used his prior loans to equip his business with tools and equipment, to do some home improvements and to increase his working capital.

His future dream is to make better use of his living space dividing it in such a way so as to rent out part of it to earn new income.  But, while this occurs, Ramiro keeps at his permanent work in order to reach is dream alongside his wife.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for his fast food and to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Alcides de 38 años es el propietario del negocio “Tienda la económica al sur occidente de Barranquilla”. Nacido en el departamento de Santander, llegó hace 11 años a la ciudad y se dedicó al tradicional negocio de tienda, que tiene como objetivo satisfacer las demandas de las amas de casa, en lo relacionado con productos de la canasta familiar, ofrecidas en un sitio cercano a su vivienda.
Alcides en su negocio vende víveres, ranchos, licores, abarrotes, lácteos, carnes, dulces, refrescos y bebidas, que compra a diario, semanal o  mensualmente,  de acuerdo a como rote cada producto. Sus ventas son principalmente de contado y su negocio ocupa casi toda la vivienda, donde se encuentra en calidad de arrendatario. Su sueño y desafió es tener un carro propio que le facilite el transporte de la mercancía que compra. Así mismo su capital de trabajo es más pequeño que lo que requiere su mercado,  por eso está interesado en hacerlo crecer, se postula al primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará arroz, azúcar, granos, harinas, refrescos y lácteos en mayor volumen para ganar descuentos y mientras construye su sueño continua fortaleciendo su rentabilidad sobre las ventas para sostenerla en no menos de un 21%.
texts.en:
Alcides, 38, owns a business called “Tienda La Económica” in southwest Barranquilla.  He was born in Santander Department and arrived in the city 11 years ago and went into the traditional business of running a general store whose goal is to meet the needs of housewives related to the basic family grocery basket in a site near their homes.

In his store, Alcides sells foodstuffs, snacks, liquor, groceries, dairy products, meats, candy, soft drinks and beverages that he buys daily, weekly or monthly according to each product’s turnover rate.  His sales are primarily cash and his business takes up almost the entire dwelling which he rents.  His dream and challenge is to have a car of his own that will make transporting the goods he buys easier.  In addition, his working capital is a bit smaller than what his market requires so he’s interested in making it grow.

He is applying for his first Kiva/Fundación Mario Santo Domingo loan that he will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, flours, soft drinks and dairy products in larger volumes to receive discounts and while he builds his dream will continue strengthening his profit margin on sales to maintain it at no less than 21%.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia forma parte del banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar. 
Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de anticuchos (comida que consiste en ensartar trocitos de carne asada en unas brochetas de fierro). Delia se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 3 años. Además cuida a una persona de la tercera edad los días lunes, miércoles y viernes por las mañanas, ya que es paramédico jubilada. 
Delia se instala a vender sus productos afuera de un minimarket, utilizando una parrilla por ahora, ya que pretende mandar a fabricar un carro el cual le permita trasladar y vender sus productos con mayor facilidad. 
Su mercadería la compra en una distribuidora, especialmente la carne. 
Con el préstamo comprará materiales específicamente ruedas y latas de acero inoxidable y pagará la mano de obra para fabricar un carro. Además comprará carne. 
Sus metas son instalar su carro en fabricación afuera de un nuevo supermercado. 
Su familia es quien la ayuda en el traslado de sus productos y elementos a utilizar. Especialmente su hija quien  la ayuda a preparar y vender sus productos, sin embargo cuando su hija se encuentra trabajando Delia debe encargarse de todo el negocio sola.
Sus sueños a nivel personal son tener una casa de reposo para personas de la tercera edad, ya que Delia es paramédico jubilada.
Ella está agradecida del apoyo y crédito brindado por Fondo Esperanza. Además participa activamente de las reuniones, las cuales son muy gratas, ya que comparte con las demás socias.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) communal bank belonging to the city of Viña del Mar.

She makes "anticuchos" to sell (food consisting of pieces of meat grilled on metal skewers).  Delia has been in this line of work for 3 years.  In addition, she cares for a senior citizen every Monday, Wednesday and Friday in the morning since she’s a retired Paramedic.

Delia sets herself up outside a minimarket.  For now she uses a grill but she plans to have a cart made that will make it possible for her to transport and sell her products more easily.  She buys her ingredients, especially the meat, from a distributor.

She will use the loan to buy materials, specifically wheels and stainless steel sheets, and will pay labor costs to make the cart.  She will also buy meat.  Her goal is to set up the cart she’s having made in front of a new supermarket.

Her family helps her transport the products and equipment she’ll use, especially her daughter who helps her to prepare and sell her products.  However, when her daughter is at work, Delia has to be in charge of the entire operation by herself.

Her dreams on a personal level are to have a rest home for senior citizens since Delia is a retired Paramedic.

She is grateful for the support and the loan granted by Fondo Esperanza.  She participates actively in the meetings, which are quite enjoyable, because she shares with the other members.

Viña del Mar is a city and commune located on the central coast of Chile.   It’s known as the Garden City because of the gardens and patios some of the old houses in the city have.  It is also considered to be Chile’s tourism capital.

loans.use: to buy wheels and stainless steel sheets to build a cart, to buy meat and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Segundo Jacinto

texts.es:
Segundo Jacinto R. P. tiene 33 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad El rayo, parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 25 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa se dedica a diferentes actividades como: agricultura, ganadería, comercio, crianza de animales, albañearía y aserradero.

Luis se dedica a aserrador de madera en la ciudad de Riobamba. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar insumos para trabajar en la agricultura. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un vehículo para el trabajo.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
33-year old Segundo Jacinto R. P. is married and lives with his wife and two children in Guaranda canton, in the province of Bolívar.

The members of V.R.C. GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY live in the community of El Rayo, in Guanujo parish, in the canton of Guaranda, about 25 minutes from the Cooperative’s office. The members are involved in such activities as agriculture, livestock, business, animal raising, construction, and a sawmill.

Luis is a wood saw operator in the town of Riobamba. He buys supplies in the Guaranda market and sells the products in the wholesale market in the same town.

He is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies. The money will help him economically to obtain much-needed items. The problems he faces include insect infestations, illness, and a difficult climate. His dream is to own a vehicle he can use for work.

Luis enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio tiene 57 años, es viudo vive con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad El rayo, parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 25 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa se dedica a diferentes actividades como: agricultura, ganadería, comercio, crianza de animales, albañearía y aserradero.

José se dedica a la agricultura siembra trigo y maíz en terrenos propios y arrendados, ganadería 5 cabezas de vacas lecheras. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar insumos para trabajar en la agricultura y para alimentación para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es que el negocio siga creciendo y que los hijos sigan con el negocio. 

Le gusta visitar a la familia
texts.en:
José Antonio, 57, is a widower living with his children in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.  He has 5 children.

The “NUCANCHI KAWSAY” communal bank is located in the community of El Rayo, Guanujo Parish, Guaranda Canton 25 minutes from the Cooperativa’s office.  The members are involved in a variety of occupations like: farming, cattle raising, commerce, small farm animal raising, bricklaying and sawmill.

José farms wheat and corn on his own lands and on leased land.  He has five head of dairy cows.  Purchases are done at Guaranda’s market and sales take place in the wholesale market in that same city.

He is asking for the loan to buy farming supplies and animal feed.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and variations in weather.  His dream is that his business will continue growing and that his children will carry on with the business.

He likes visiting his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Ollman Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Ollman trabaja arduamente siendo una persona muy responsable porque en todo momento ha sabido suplir  todas las necesidades que se han presentado en su hogar. Actualmente ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de algunos materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que espera que su crédito le sea otorgado. Comprará cemento, arena, bloque y hierro para iniciar con dicha obra de construcción.

Cabe mencionar que él ha logrado mantener su hogar siendo muy cumplido con las tareas de la casa y así continuar reuniendo esfuerzos para ir poco a poco mejorando su vivienda y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ollman works hard to be a responsible person, and a person able to supply his home with everything it needs. Currently he has made the decision to ask for a loan to invest in the purchase of some construction materials to improve his home, given that it is in pretty bad shape. He will buy cement, sand, concrete blocks and iron to initiate the job. 

It is fitting to mention that he has managed to maintain his home fairly well and wants to continue these efforts so that his home is eventually improved, and his well being along with it.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Pablo José

texts.es: EL SEÑOR MARTINEZ  LABORA COMO GUARDA DE SEGURIDA, ES CASADO, TIENE  TRES  PERSONA A SU CARGO, ESTE ES EL CUARTO  CREDITO  QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE LA OPROTUNIDAD QUE LE BRINDA, ESTE DESEMBOLSO LO NECESITA PARA INVERTIRLO EN MEJORAR SU VIVIENDA PARA PODER COMPRAR  MATERIALES DE CONNSTRUCCION PARA HACER UN ANEXO DE UN CUARTO.
texts.en: Mr. Martinez works as a security guard.  He is married and supports three people.  This is his fourth loan with Ceprodel and he appreciates the opportunity offered him.  He needs this loan to improve his house and will use it to buy construction materials to add to a room.

loans.use: To buy construction materials and improve his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies such as sand and concrete blocks to build a porch.

loans.name: La Fortaleza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Edermiro has a wife and nine children. He belongs to the La Fortaleza one & two (The Strength), located in the town of Hato Mayor, whose economy depends on farming. 

He will use this loan to buy different animals; he has a butcher shop where he sells beef, pork, chicken and goat meat. He is excited to be taking his 10th loan with Kiva partner Esperanza, after having successfully repaid his previous loans and grown his business. Edermiro started his business with his first Esperanza loan, almost six years ago. 

He will both invest the profits in his business and continue to save for his own house. His dreams are to live confortably and save up with his partner. He became interested in and motivated by others to join Esperanza after he was encouraged by others in this group to be part of the program and start his business.

His most important challenges are to save and rebuild his house.

loans.use: to buy pigs, beef, and chicken.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: El señor Walter nacido en la ciudad de Potosí  de 35 años de edad vive en la zona de la Gremial hace 2 años  donde esta construyendo su vivienda para dar mayor comodidad a su familia. Su Actividad es la de servicio de trasporte en la ciudad Santa Cruz hace ya 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad,  el sr. Walter no es casado pero convive hace 15 años con la señora Lucinda de actividad labores de casa, los señores cuentan con cuatro hijos a su poder.Destino del crédito es para terminar de hacer construir su vivienda. Los señores se sienten muy agradecidos por haber depositado la confianza en ellos y haber agilizado el crédito.
texts.en: Walter was born in the city of Potosí.  He is 35 years old and has lived in the Gremial zone for 2 years, where he is building his house in order to provide more a more comfortable life for his family.  He works providing transportation services in the city of Santa Cruz, an activity he has been carrying out for 13 years.  Walter is not married, but has cohabitated with Lucinda, who is a homemaker, for 15 years.  Together, they have four children.  The loan is destined to help them finish building their house.  They are very thankful for the confidence shown in them through the granting of credit.

loans.use: finish building his house.

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es: En Managua capital de Nicaragua, el señor Pablo Emilio posee su familia a la que proporciona las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen. Él siempre ha velado por el bienestar de su hogar y para ello hace uso de los créditos proporcionados por Ceprodel. Esta vez, está solicitando un crédito para la compra de algunos materiales de construcción tales como arena, cemento, zinc y perlines para realizar cambio de techo porque al entrar el invierno dicha vivienda debe estar muy segura y protegida. Está confiando en que su crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente.
texts.en: En Managua, Nicaragua's capital, Mr. Pablo Emilio lives with his family, for whom he must provide necessary living conditions. He has always worried for the well-being of his home and for that reason he has asked for loans from Ceprodel. This time, he is asking for a loan to buy some construction materials such as sand, cement, zinc and beams to get a new roof. Since winter is coming, the roof must be secure and protect the home. He is confident that his loan will go well.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve his roof.

loans.name: Flabia Marina

texts.es:
Flabia es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene 02 hijos.  Estudió educación secundaria (incompleta). 
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, su préstamo inicial fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de prendas de vestir como casacas.  También vende ganados, es un negocio alterno.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 600.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital de su negocio, con lo que comprará una oveja para su engorde y casacas para venderlos en diferentes departamentos.  Su esposo trabaja como auxiliar en educación y le ayuda en el negocio en sus horas libres.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y hacerlo crecer.	
Lo que le gusta de Manuela Ramos es la facilidad del préstamo y el bajo interés.
texts.en:
Flabia is a member of the “Chijuyo Copapujo” cooperative bank, located in the Ilave district of the province of El Collao, in Puno.  She is 43 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She studied until secondary school (incomplete).

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years.  Her first loan was for the sum of 500.00 Peruvian soles, which she invested into her business of buying and selling clothing such as jackets.  She also sells livestock, which is an alternate business.

This new loan of 600.00 soles will increase her working capital, and she will use it to buy a sheep for fattening and jackets to sell throughout different areas.  Her husband works in education and helps her with the business in his free time.

Her dream is to improve and grow her business.  What she likes about Manuela Ramos is the ease of obtaining credit and the low interest rate.

loans.use: buy a sheep to fatten and jackets to sell.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 26 años; vive en concubinato con Erminio. Ambos tienen 2 hijos, Braham y Verenise; a los que cuidan y alimentan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Su actividad económica es la agricultura, tiene 7 años de experiencia en la siembra de arvejas, habas, papa y maíz; los cuales se sitúan en el caserío de San Antonio, donde todas las mañanas sube muy contenta a cuidar de sus cultivos, con la ayuda de su esposo y de peones que le ayudan en tiempos de cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la temporada de siembra ya que se encuentran maduros, púes ve concretado su esfuerzo en la venta de sus cosechas en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Su principal dificultad son los gastos que realiza en la educación de sus hijos; por ello se siente contenta con el trabajo que realiza en el banquito comunal. Ahora ella espera muy gustosa, poder mejorar el revestimiento de su casa, donde está segura tendrá el apoyo de todos ustedes. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que le brindan en la realización de su casita. La casa de Luzmila, no posee cerco, ventanas, ni puertas; por ello con el crédito invertirá en la implantación de un muro, así como también puertas para su cocina y habitaciones.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 26 years old and cohabitates with Erminio.  They have 2 children, Braham and Verenise, who they care for and feed.  They live in their own house located in the town of Bellavista Huaracayo.

Her primary economic activity is farming.  She has 7 years of experience growing peas, beans, potatoes and corn; her crops are located in the hamlet of San Antonio where she goes contently each morning to tend to her plants.  She has her husband’s help, and also other laborers who assist at harvest time.

What she enjoys most about her work is the planting season, and seeing her crops mature so she can witness the fruit of her efforts when she sells her products at the wholesale market in Tarma.  Her biggest challenges are meeting the educational expenses of her children. For this reason, she is very content to work with her small cooperative bank.

Currently, she waits gladly to be able to make improvements to her home, an endeavor she is sure she will have all of your support for.  She belongs to the “Señor de Muruhuay” cooperative bank, and this is her third loan with MFP.  She is very grateful for the support they provide her towards fixing her house.  

Luzmila’s house doesn’t have a fence, windows or doors; for this reason, the loan will be invested into building a wall, as well as for installing doors for her kitchen and bedrooms.

loans.use: build a wall for her house, as well as doors.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: EL SEÑOR MIGUEL LABORA COMO  OPERARIO ,ES ACOMPAÑADO,TIENE UNA PERSONA A SU CARGO,ES LE PRIMER CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, DA GRACIA A ESTA INSTITUCION POR BRINDALE  ESTE DESEMBOLSO QUE SERA UTILIZADO PARA COMPRA DE MATERIALES  DE CONSTRUCCION  COMO ARENA, CEMENTO, BLOQUE, HIERRO,ESTRIBO, CLAVO,MANO DE OBRA PARA REPARAR PARED DE SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en: Miguel works as an operator; he has a partner and one person in his care.  This is the first loan that CEPRODEL has granted to him.  He gives thanks to this institution for providing him this disbursement, which will be used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, cinderblocks, iron, supports, nails and manual labor to repair the wall of his house.

loans.use: buy construction materials to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene 06 hijos (3 independientes). La señora estudio hasta 1ro de educación primaria.
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace año y medio, el primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en la compra de cabuyas (sogas) y vacas para su engorde.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital de su negocio para comprar un paquete de cabuya para luego venderlos en las ferias de Ilave, trabaja junto con su esposo e hijos, también hacen chacra (cosechan) de papa, habas, cebada, etc.
Su sueño es crecer en el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the “Chijuyo Copapujo” communal bank located in Ilave District, El Collao Province and Puno Department.  She’s 47 years old, married and has six children (3 of them independent).  She finished first grade.

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year and a half.  Her first loan was for 500 new soles that she used to buy ropes and cows to raise.

She will use this new, 500 new sol, loan to increase her working capital buying a package of ropes to resell in Ilave’s markets.  She works together with her husband and children.  They also farm potatoes, broad beans, barley, etc.  Her dream is to grown in her business and improve her income.

What she likes about the communal bank is the profit on her savings.

loans.use: to buy a package of ropes.

loans.name: Nancy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nancy, tiene 3 años de vivir en soledad, en una vivienda bifamiliar con su esposo que es trabajador independiente. Ella  se dedica a la venta de mercancías por catálogos, y con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos apoyan el sostenimiento de su hogar, Nancy  se encuentra vinculada a varias revistas, a través de las cuales ofrece muchos artículos, como recipientes de cocina, cosméticos, ropa interior, medicina natural etc.  En su negocio posee  una vitrina de madera, un escritorio pequeño, sillas secretariales y sillas plásticas, donde atiende a los clientes, pues además de generar ingresos a través de la venta de mercancía variada,  también se dedica a vender minutos a celulares, actividad en la que es apoyada por  su hija, quien  vive en el primer piso  con su cónyuge, que se desempeña como vigilante independiente.
Nancy compra de contado y vende a crédito y siempre respondiendo a pedidos que le hacen los clientes, que ha venido fidelizando desde hace un poco menos de tres años; en la actualidad planea comprar con su primer credikiva, colonia, cremas, splash, tintes, talcos, pestañina, delineadores, ropa interior y medicinas naturales que presentan descuentos, para ganar un poco más de dinero mediante su compra en volúmenes y lograr que sus clientes también accedan a estas ofertas a un muy buen precio.
texts.en:
Nancy has been living in Soledad for three years in a two family home with her husband, who is an independent worker.  She sells merchandise via catalogue.  Her husband and her children help her support the home.  Nancy is associated with several catalogues through which she offers a variety of products like kitchen containers, cosmetics, underwear, natural remedies, etc.  Her business has a wooden display case, a small desk, secretarial chairs and plastic chairs where she tends to customers because, besides earning income selling assorted merchandise, she also sells minutes of cell phone air time, an activity her daughter, who lives on the first floor with her husband who is an independent Security Guard, helps her with.

Nancy pays cash for her merchandise and sells it on credit always responding to customer orders.  She has been establishing her base of regular customers for a little less than three years.  

She intends to use her first Kiva loan to buy cologne, creams, body wash, dyes, talc, eyelashes, eye liner, underwear and natural remedies that are on sale to earn a little more money buying them in volume so that her customers can also access these special offers at a very good price.

loans.use: to buy cologne, cream, body wash, dyes, talc, eyelashes, eye brow pencils, underwear and natural medicine that are on sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 9 kilos of pork and 11 kilos of mutton.

loans.name: Mayra Ivette

texts.es:
Mayra trabaja como maestra de secundaria siendo su trabajo desde hace cinco años, casada, y vive con su mama en el terreno, haciendo un cuarto pequeño, aun no con las mejores condiciones,  pero en un futuro irá mejorando. Con los financiamientos que Afodenic, está otorgando atreves del préstamo.
Con el crédito anterior logro, dividir el terreno con muro, y hacer pegado a él un cuarto,  y hoy levantara el muro en la parte de atrás, logrando cerrar todo el terreno. Materiales a comprar piedra, arena, cemento, hierro. El cual está satisfecha por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Mayra has worked as a secondary school teacher for five years.  She is married and lives with her mother on their land.  They have a small room that isn't in the best condition, but they are slowly improving it for the future.  With the financing from Afrodenic, it is giving through the loan.  

With a past loan, she divided the land with a wall and built a room.  Now, she wants to build the wall in the back part to enclose all of the land.  She needs to purchase stones, sand, cement, and iron.  She is satisfied by improving every day.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a wall in the back part of her land.

loans.name: Julia Janneth

texts.es:
La Señora Julia es socia del banco comunal Cumbe, vive por el sector de los Olivos en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió pero su gente tienen un corazón muy cálido, quienes se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, esta parroquia cuenta con hermosos lugares para visitar y admirar la belleza de la naturaleza.

La Señora. Julia tiene 19 años, es casada y tiene un bebé de 3 meses de edad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de su abuelita compartiendo los gastos del hogar.

Doña Julia pasa en casa donde se dedica al cuidado de su hijo y también a la cría de animales como cuyes y pollos los mismos que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito el mismo que lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en el alimento de los mismos.

Su meta es culminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the community bank Cumbe.  She lives in the Olivos area of the Cumbe parish.  This parish has a cold climate, but its people have a warm heart.  The people work in commerce, raise animals, and farm.  This parish has beautiful places to visit and admire nature's beauty.

Julia is 19 years old, married, and has a three month old baby.  Her husband works as a bricklayer.  They don't have their own home, so they live in her grandmother's house and share household expenses.

Julia stays home and cares for her son and also raises animals like guinea pigs and chickens, which she sells when she needs money.

This is her second loan with the community bank, which she plans to invest in the purchase of chickens and chicken feed.

Her goal is to finish her university studies.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: La Fortaleza 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana is one of the members of the "L. Fortaleza three " (The Strength three) group, located in the town of Hato Mayor, whose economy depends on farming. Their principal economic activities are the sale of food, clothes, shoes, and accessories. 

Ana is the mother of four children, they live with her as she is a single mother. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is to work hard to proviD. for their well-being. Her favorite activity is to be at home with her children. 

Ana is very moved by receiving her seventh loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having paid off her previous loan satisfactorily and thereby having taken a step towards the growth of her business. She has had her business for around four years. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of jeans, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, and other items. 

She plans to use her profits to save and reinvest in her business. 

The woman in the bottom is part of the group, but was not available when we took the group picture.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: David De Jesús

texts.es: EL SEÑOR DAVID LABORA COMO AGENTE DE SEGURIDAD ,ES CASADO ,TIENE  TRES  PERSONA A SU CARGO,ES LE CUARTO CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, DA GRACIA A ESTA INSTITUCION POR BRINDALE  ESTE DESEMBOLSO QUE SERA UTILIZADO PARA COMPRA DE MATERIALES  DE CONSTRUCCION  COMO ARENA, CEMENTO, BLOQUE, HIERRO,ESTRIBO, CLAVO,MANO DE OBRA PARA HACER BAÑO Y COCINA DE SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en: David works as a security guard.  He is married and supports three people.  This is his fourth loan with Ceprodel and he thanks this institution for the financing offered him.  He will use this loan  to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, cement blocks, iron, braces, nails and to pay for the labor to add a bathroom and kitchen in his house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to improve his house

loans.name: Bertha Elisa

texts.es:
Bertha  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas de Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Ella tiene estudios en educación primaria.
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde  hace un ciclo, su primer préstamo solicitado  fue  por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de  compra y venta de animales domésticos como ovino y vacuno.
Con éste nuevo préstamo por de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles comprará una vaca  para luego venderla, trabaja junto con su esposo.
Nos cuenta que  también se dedica a la chacra como papa, etc.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y crecer como empresaria.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la reunión y el compartir con las demás socias.

Nota: La foto muestra cierto brillo debido al intenso sol.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the community bank "Hermanas de Choquetanca II", located in the Ilave district in the El Collao province in the department of Puno.  She is 25 years old, married, and has a child.  She went to primary school.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one loan cycle.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, which she invested in the purchase and sale of domestic animals like sheep and cattle.

With this new loan for 1000 nuevos soles, she will purchase a cow that she will later sell.  She works with her husband.  They also grow potatoes.

Her dream is to improve her business and grow as a businesswoman.  The things she likes best about the community bank are the meetings and sharing with other members.

Note: The picture is bright because of the intensity of the sun.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Gloria L. es socia del banco comunal Cumbe, vive por el sector de San Antonio en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió pero su gente tiene un corazón muy cálido y se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, esta parroquia cuenta con hermosos lugares para visitar y admirar la belleza de la naturaleza.

Doña Gloria tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 11 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, están construyendo su casa pero actualmente  viven en casa de un familiar.
 
La Señora. Gloria se dedica al a venta de animales hace 5 años, vende pollos, chanchos, cuyes, etc.  en los días de ferias y también son para su consumo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más animales como pollos, cuyes, chanchos, etc. para su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener un vehículo propio.
texts.en:
Gloria  L. is a member of the Cumbe communal bank.  She lives in the San Antonio area in Cumbe parish.  This parish has a cold climate but its people are very warm and they work in the business of raising animals and farming.  This parish has lovely places to visit and to appreciate its natural beauty.

Gloria is 32, married, and she has 2 children: 12 and 11. Her oldest son is in secondary school and her youngest son is in a city school.  Her husband is a bricklayer. They are building their own house but currently they live with a relative.
Gloria has worked selling animals for the past 5 years.  She sells, chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, etc on market days and also she uses them for food.

She has been with the communal bank for 6 years and she will use her new loan to buy more animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, etc. for her business.

Her goal is to have her own car.

loans.use: To buy chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cases of beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas de Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos  en edad  escolar.  La señora estudió hasta 3ro de educación secundaria.
Bertha se dedica a la compra/venta y engorde de animales vacuno, ovino.  Paralelamente se dedica a la chacra (sembríos de papa, quinua, habas y otros granos).
Su principal negocio es el de la compra y venta de ganado,  trabaja junto con su esposo e hijos.
La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y solicitará  un préstamo  de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio, comprará más ganados. 
Su sueño es tener ganados mejorados que le permitan mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Sisters of Choquetanca II Community Bank. She lives in the district of Llave, El Collao Province, in the department of Puno. She is 31 years old and is married with three school-age children. She completed her third year of secondary education.

Bertha raises and trades cattle and pigs. At the same time she also farms (she grows potatos, quinoa, beans, and other grains). Her main business is trading cattle. She works alongside her husband and sons.

She is a new member of the Manuela Ramos Movement, and she is applying for a loan of 1,000 new soles which she will use to buy more cattle.

Her dream is to have high quality cattle because this will allow her to increase her income.

What she likes most about the Community Bank is the ease of the loan process.

loans.use: purchase cows for her cattle trading business

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. María M. es socia del banco comunal Cumbe, vive por el sector de San Antonio en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió pero su gente tiene  un corazón muy calido y se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y la agricultura, esta parroquia cuenta con hermosos lugares para visitar y admirar la belleza de la naturaleza.

Doña María tiene 44 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 21, 18 y 16 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y ayuda economícamente y sus dos últimos hijos  estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo una camioneta, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. María hace 17 años tiene una tienda de comestibles en la que trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. También se dedica a la cría de  pollos y cuyes los que son para su consumo y para la venta.

Está en el banco comunal hace 13 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, embutidos, etc. para seguir ampliando su tienda.

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria M.  is a member of the Cumbe communal bank.  She lives in the San Antonio area in Cumbe parish.  This parish has a cold climate but its people are very warm and they work in the business of raising animals and farming.  This parish has lovely places to visit and to appreciate its natural beauty.

Maria is 44 married, and she has 3 children: 21, 18 and 16. Her oldest son works and helps with expenses, and her two other children are  in a city school.  Her husband is a driver and drives a van. With the two of them working they have been able to build their own house .


Maria has had a grocery store for the past 17 years and she works every day of the week with no regular schedule.  She also raises chickens and guinea pigs for the family to eat and also to sell.

She has been with the bank for 13 years and she will use the new loan to buy items such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, cold cuts, etc, to continue enlarging her store.

Her goal is for her business to keep growing.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents, cold cuts and other staples.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds and sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 49 años de edad, es osltero, vive junto con su madre en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de las Lomas a una hora aproximadamente del departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Pedro desde hace algún tiempo a instaladoen su casa una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad donde sus clientes encuentran (pan, arroz, huevos, atún, algunas frutas, etc.),distintos productos para su consumo diario,lo que le permite tener ingresos con sus ventas y poder solventar los gastos  y necesidades de su casa.

A solicitado Pedro un préstamo a Epyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de productos para implemtar su tienda y así sus clientes tengan más diversidad de productos que le hagan falta, esto aumentará sus ventas para poder pagar su crédito y tener un mejor nivel de vida.  Pedro tiene como objetivo tener una tienda grande con todo tipo de productos para vender al por mayor y menor, que lo podrá lograr con esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Pedro is 49 years old and single.  He lives together with his mother in their own home which has piped water and electricity.  Their home is located in Las Lomas district, approximately one hour from Piura department.  The people in this area work in farming, livestock raising and commerce.

Some time ago, Pedro set up a small grocery store in his home where his customers can find essential household products (bread, rice, eggs, tuna, some fruit, etc.).  This profits that he makes on his sales allow him to cover his household's needs and expenses.

Pedro has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a larger quantity of products to stock his store, so that his customers will have a wider range of products that they need.  This will increase Pedro's sales so that he can repay his loan and enjoy a better standard of living.  Pedro's goal is to have a larger store with all types of products that he can sell both wholesale and retail.  He will be able to achieve this through his effort and hard work.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock his store

loans.name: Virma Cumanda

texts.es:
La Señora Virma es socia del banco comunal Poloma vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus bellos paisajes y naturaleza, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura. Mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.
 
Doña Virma tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 10 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en escuela. Su esposo labora en un taller de carpintería, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia. 

La Señora. Virma se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y cuida de sus hijos. También se dedica a la cría pollos y cuyes que son para la venta y para su consumo.

En el banco comunal esta hace 10 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento.
 
Su meta es comprarse un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Virma is a member of the Poloma community bank.  She lives in the community of the same name which is located in El Valle parish.  This parish is noted for its landscapes and natural beauty.  The locals work in sales, raising animals and farming.  They maintain their culture and traditions.

Virma is 36 years old, married, and has three children aged 14, 10 and 9.  Her eldest son is in high school and her two younger children are in elementary school.  Her husband works in a carpentry workshop.  Together they have managed to build their own home.

Virma looks after her housework and takes care of her children.  She also raises chickens and guinea pigs.  Some of them are sold and others are eaten by the family.

Virma has been a member of her community bank for 10 years and she will invest her new loan in buying chickens and feed.  Her goal is to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es: Jaqueline, de 29 años, es una mujer luchadora y buena. Ella adora a sus hijas Yusbeth de 9 años, y una bebe de tan solo 3 meses de nacida. Como una gran familia, viven las 3 en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. Mientras que su esposo vive en la ciudad de Jauja, por motivos de trabajo. Hace ya 10 años que viene dedicándose a la agricultura; donde siembra papa y arveja, los que posteriormente vende en el mercado central de su ciudad. Asimismo cuenta que en temporadas de gran cosecha, se dedica a la compra y venta de papa en la ciudad de La Oroya, donde viaja constantemente. Como mujer emprendedora y capaz  hace ya 6 años que decidió, expandirse más, pues su hija esta creciendo y necesita mayores cuidados y dedicaciones, fue entonces que con el poco dinero ahorrado compró un pequeño puesto en el mercado de su localidad, ahí vende papa y hortalizas a los pobladores que todos los días comprará para el almuerzo de casa.  Además menciona que hace poco incursionó en la venta de ropa, mercadería que ofrece a los pobladores. En  delante ella está pensando comprar más terrenos de cultivo en los cuales podrá sembrar mayor cantidad de papa, y de esa manera podrá comercializar en la capital de su país, así como en la costa peruana.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Progresistas de Chiras”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente muy contenta de pertenecer a un grupo comunal, donde está segura podrá salir adelante. Jaqueline, invertirá el crédito en la compra de varias cosechas de papa para comercializarlo en la sierra (ciudad de La Oroya), asimismo piensa abrir una tienda en la ciudad de Tarma, para poder vender ropa en un lugar estable.
texts.en:
29 year-old Jacqueline is a good woman and a hard worker.  She adores her daughters: 9 year-old Yusbeth and her baby who is only 3 months old.  The three of them live in their own home which is located in the town of Chiras.  Jacqueline's husband lives in the city of Jauja for work reasons.

Jacqueline has been farming for 10 years.  She grows potatoes and peas which she then sells in the central market in her town.  She tells us that during good harvest seasons she also buys and sells potatoes in the city of La Oroya, where she travels frequently.

As an entrepreneurial and capable woman, Jacqueline decided six years ago to expand her business some more as her daughter was growing and needed more care and commitment.  She used the little money that she had saved up to buy a small sales stall in her town market where she sells potatoes and vegetables to the locals who buy these products every day to make lunch for their households.  She also mentions that a little while ago she started selling clothes to locals.  In the future, she is planning to buy more farmland on which she will be able to sow a larger quantity of potatoes and, in this way, she will be able to sell in the country's capital city as well as on the Peruvian coast.

Jacqueline is a member of the "Progresistas de Chiras" community bank and this is her second loan from MFP.  She feels very happy to be a member of her community bank where she is sure that she will be able to get ahead.  Jacqueline will invest her loan in buying several potato harvests to sell in the mountains (in the city of La Oroya).  She is also thinking of opening a store in the city of Tarma so that she can sell clothes from a stable location.

loans.use: to buy sacks of recently harvested potatoes and to open a clothes store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for making 'chicha de jora' and corn flour

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica tiene 21 años de edad,  vive con su hija en un caserío llamado Pasabar los Mayanga, donde no cuentan con servicios básicos.  Está ubicado en el distrito de Olmos a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  

Yessica se dedica a comercializar todo tipo de ropa en general. Ella ofrece su producto a sus familiares y a las personas de su comunidad, en algunas oportunidades también vende en los caseríos aledaños. 
Esta actividad es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su hogar y se vale de ella para solventar sus gastos diarios.

Yessica desea adquirir mas mercadería de temporada para ampliar  su negocio pues durante estos meses la demanda de prendas de vestir aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Yessica es una joven bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, las personas que le conocen admiran sus ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
texts.en:
Yessica is 21 years old and lives with her daughter in a small village called Pasabar los Mayanga.  She does not have basic services.  Her home is located in Olmos district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Yessica sells all kinds of clothes.  She offers her products for sale to her family members and people in her community.  On some occasions, she also sells in neighboring villages.

This business is very helpful as far as her household finances are concerned and covers her daily expenses.

Yessica would like to acquire more seasonal merchandise to expand her business over these coming months when demand for clothes increases.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 700 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

Yessica is a hard-working and driven young woman.  People who know her admire her desire to get ahead and make progress.

loans.use: to acquire seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Alindor

texts.es:
Alindor es un hombre soltero de 56 años de edad, vive en casa de unos familiares, la cual  es propia y cuenta con todos los servicio ( agua, luz y desagüe) en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortíz, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican al comercio y la mayoría son conductores de transporte público.

Alindor  maneja su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas), esta actividad lo realiza en el mismo distrito donde vive, especialmente en la zona del mercado que es donde hay mayor demanda de clientela y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar todas sus necesidades.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 500 nuevos soles y su destino será darle mantenimiento a su mototaxi, para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes que dejará mejores ingresos, para mejorar  la calidad de vida de él y seguir ayudando a los familiares con los que vive. Alindor es un hombre muy  conocido  por ser trabajador, responsable que a punta de esfuerzo y empeño a sabido salir adelante.
texts.en:
Alindor is a single, 56 year old man. He lives in house owned by relatives that has all utilities (running water, electricity and sewer) in the district of  José Leonardo Ortíz that belongs to the province of Chiclayo. The inhabitants of this district work as merchants and many are public transportation drivers.  

Alindor drives his motorcycle taxi (a mode of transportation that is used for short distance travel, with a 3 passenger maximum). He does this activity in the district where he lives, especially in the market area where there is a higher demand. With the income he makes, he is able to pay for all of his needs.

The loan he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for is for 500 nuevos soles, and it will be used to do maintenance on his motorcyle taxi in order to offer his customers a better service. This will improve his quality of life and enable him to keep helping the relatives he lives with. Alindor is man who is known to be a hard worker and responsible n his efforts. He knows how to get ahead.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Jairo José

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, capital de Nicaragua, el señor Jairo labora en un centro de trabajo siendo muy responsable en sus labores y siempre cumplido en todas sus tareas. Es soltero y se ha apoyado de créditos (4 créditos) que han sido invertidos para el sustento de su hogar. 

El crédito que está solicitando actualmente lo utilizará en la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, perlines y pago de mano de obra para reparar el techo de su vivienda que ha estado en malas condiciones y le es necesario realizar dicho trabajo porque ya inicia el invierno y debe estar preparado en su vivienda para así no tener ningún problema.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, capital of Nicaragua, Jairo works in a labor center and is very responsible at his job and always completes his tasks. He is single and has been supported by 4 loans that he has invested to maintain his home.

The loan that he is asking for currently will be used to buy construction materials such as zinc, beams, and to pay for labor to repair his home's roof, which has been in poor condition. It is necessary to start this work since winter has just begun and he is stabilizing his home to avoid problems.

loans.use: To buy contruction materials.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
José de oficio operador de bombeo en una empresa privada, con veinte años laborando para el bienestar de su familia, sus dos hijas están estudiando y su esposa labora como ejecutiva de ventas. Para poder cubrir los gastos.
Su casa la ido mejorando poco a poco, porque tienen que cubrir los gastos, y ha sido poco el ahorro, es por eso toma la iniciativa de optar al financiamiento para poder estar en mejores condiciones de vivienda.
Este su segundo ciclo, el cual hará división de cuarto y lo ampliara, ya que es pequeño, comprando bloques, cemento, arena y hierro. Lo que vendrá a dar más espacio y comodidad a sus hijos. Con el crédito anterior logro cambiar todo el techo, lo que es de gran avance mediante este medio.
texts.en:
José works as a pump operator for a private firm.  He’s been working for twenty years for his family’s wellbeing.  His two daughters are studying and his wife works as a sales executive to cover expenses.

He has been improving his house little by little because he has to cover expenses and he’s had little savings.  Because of this he took the initiative to opt for financing so that his dwelling can be in better condition.

This is his second cycle.  He will divide and enlarge a room since it’s small buying concrete blocks, cement, sand and iron rods.  This will create more space and comfort for his children.  He used the previous loan to replace the entire roof which was a huge step forward through this means.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Enma Estela

texts.es:
La Señora Enma es socia del banco comunal Poloma vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus bellos paisajes y naturaleza, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura. Mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Enma tiene 46 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos que tienen 26, 21 y 15 años de edad, su primera hija es discapacitada y pasa en casa, su segunda hija trabaja y le ayuda  economícamente y su último hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
La Señora. Enma se dedica a la agricultura, siembra en sus terrenos verduras y su producto lo vende en un mercado de la cuidad. También se dedica a la cría de pollos.

En el banco comunal esta un año y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y semillas para sus tierras.

Su meta es arreglar la casa en la que habitan.
texts.en:
Mrs. Enma is a member of the communal bank "Poloma" and lives in a town with the same name in the "Valle" parish.  This parish is known for its beautiful scenery and nature.  Its local people are active in commerce, livestock raising and farming.  They maintain their culture and traditions.

Doña Enma, age 46, is a single mother of three children, ages 26, 21 and 15.  Her eldest daughter is handicapped and stays at home, her second daughter works and helps out with household expenses, and the youngest son is in school.  She does not have her own home so they live in her mother's house and shares expenses.

Mrs. Enma is a farmer and grows vegetables which she sells at the city market.  She also raises chickens.

Her goal is to fix up the house they live in.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing drinks, to buy boxes of cigarettes, and to cover personal expenses

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.es:
Reineiro tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su familia en casa propia. Su casa está ubicada en el distrito de José  Leonardo Ortiz a unos minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Reineiro se dedica a se dedica a realizar el oficio de pintor de muebles y metales, ésta es la actividad principal a la que se dedica, pero  también  ofrece servicios de  transporte público en un taxi, el cual es de su  propiedad.

Reineiro esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar herramientas para su trabajo de pintado ya que necesita de herramientas más sofisticadas para realizar  su trabajo de una manera más eficiente.

Reineiro es una persona que cuenta muy buenas referencias, de ser responsable y puntual, las personas que lo conocen, le tienen mucho estima pues conocido en su localidad como una persona trabajadora.
texts.en:
Reineiro is 34 years old, single, and he lives with his family in their own house. Their house is located in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, a few minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Reineiro's business is to paint furniture and metals. This is his primary business activity but he also provides public transportation services with a taxi car which he owns.

Reineiro requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase tools for his painting business. These tools are more sophisticated and they would help him work in a more efficient way.

Reineiro is a person who enjoys very good references for being responsible and punctual. Those that know him hold him in high esteem and he is known in his neighborhood as a hardworking person.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his painting business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 57 años, enviudó hace 20 años, a pesar de los constantes problemas económicos, cuidó con mucho esmero de sus 7 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos y su pequeño nieto, en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Vista Hermosa. Recuerda con mucho cariño a su esposo, quien después de su muerte la dejó amparada. Cobrando una pensión mensual de S/. 300 nuevos soles, gracias al trabajo arduo que realizó su esposo en una hacienda. Gracias al apoyo conjunto y la buena coordinación de su familia y conocidos, logró obtener una casa en la ciudad de Chanchamayo, y otra en la ciudad de Tarma, donde ahora se dedica a alquilar las habitaciones, por lo que solo vive de las rentas que le proporciona dicho alquiler. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es “la tranquilidad”, ya que no realiza trabajos físicos, que por la edad que tiene no puede realizarlos. Es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera obtener buenos resultados, pues le agrada la dedicación de su entidad por el bienestar de los demás. Hace poco la casa de Julia sufrió un derrumbe en la parte frontal; producto de la humedad, por ello con el crédito, invertirá en la construcción de una pared más segura.
texts.en:
Julia, age 57, became a widow 20 years ago.  Despite constant economic problems, she was able to take good care of her seven children.  She lives with two of them and her small grandson in her own house in the rural area of Vista Hermosa.  She remembers her husband with affection.  Following his death she was taken care of with a monthly pension of 300 PEN thanks to the hard work he carried out on the farm.  Because they worked hard together and in good coordination with family and acquaintances, she was able to buy a house in the city of Chanchamayo and another in the city of Tarma, where she rents out rooms.  Her income is what she receives from the rental business.

What she likes best about her work is the "tranquility" because she doesn't have to do physical labor, which she couldn't do because of her age.  This is her first loan through MFP and she hopes to obtain good results.  She likes the institution's dedication toward quality of life for others.  Not too long ago the front of Julia's house fell down as a result of humidity.  She plans to use the loan to build a safer wall.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair the front wall of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Melania Group

texts.es:
El grupo Melania lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras  quien tiene 9 ciclos trabajando con Adim y han tenido dos préstamos con Kiva. Ellas han participado en las capacitaciones de Adim las cuales les ayuda a salir adelante según comentaron.

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Flor de María de 48 años se dedica a la venta de helados, hielo y con el crédito pasado inicio un pequeño vivero artesanal este es pequeño terreno plano en el que esta sembrando plantas ya sean ornamentales o arboles en el cual invertirá el crédito para abono, bolsas...etc. Masaya es conciederada la ciudad de las flores ya que muchos de sus habitantes se dedican a la produccion de plantas.

Las otras integrantes son Virgenza del Carmen  de 26 años quien se dedica al comercio de productos Zermat y Modesta de 41 años se dedica a la venta de leche, cuajada, queso en su casa y el mercado de Masaya desde hace 18 años además vende productos Avon.
texts.en:
The Melania group is comprised of three women entrepreneurs who have been involved with ADIM for 9 terms.  They have received two loans from Kiva and participated in ADIM training which has helped them get ahead, according to their statements.

The coordinator of the group is Mrs. Flor de María, age 48, who sells ice cream and ice.  However, she used the last loan to set up a small greenhouse where she can grow plants, including ornamental plants and trees. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and bags. Masaya, where the client lives, is an area with a high concentration of flowers and many people work with plants.

The other members of the group are Virgenze del Carmen, age 26, who sells Zermat products, and Modesta, age 41, who sells milk, curd, and cheese from her house and in the Masaya market.  She also has been selling Avon products for 18 years.

loans.use: to purchase items for her greenhouse, such as fertilizer and bags.

loans.name: Rosa Lelia

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre D. familia D. 42 años D. edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, el cual cuenta con servicio D. agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito D. TambogranD. a unos 40 minutos del departamento D. Piura.  Este distrito es una zona agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Rosa se dedica a la crianza, engorD. y comercialización D. animales (chanchos y ovejas), desD. hace varios años, su corral lo tiene en la parte D. posterior D. su casa. A sus animales los alimenta con comida  balanceada y una vez que llegan a su desarrollo óptimo los venD. en el mercado D. su distrito  y a otros comerciantes que no son D. la zona.

A solicitado un crédito Rosa a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles para comprar  alimentos balanceados para criarlos, engordarlos y luego venderlos con la finalidad D. tener mejores ingresos para poder pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.  Rosa es una persona muy conocida en su comunidad por sus ansias D. superación y elquerer brindarles mejores oportunidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is the mother of a family, 42 years old, and she lives in a house of her own together with her husband and children. It is equipped with water and electricity and it is located in the district of TambogranD., about 40 minutes from the department of Piura. This district is known for its agriculture, farming, and artisans.

Rosa has been raising livestock to fatten and to resell (pigs and sheep) for many years. Her corral is located in the rear section of her property. She feeds balanced feed to her animals and when they have reached an optimum level of development she sells them at the market in her district and to other merchants from outsiD. the region. 

Rosa requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed to raise, fatten, and resell her livestock. Her goal is to have a better income, to be able to repay the loan granted to her and to improve her family's quality of life. Rosa is a very well known person in her community, for her goals for improvement and for wanting to proviD. her children with better opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Jhoanna Tatiana

texts.es:
La Señorita. Jhoanna es socia del banco comunal Poloma vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus bellos paisajes y naturaleza, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.  Mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señorita Jhoanna es soltera, tiene de 20 años de edad, vive con su mamá a quien le ayuda economicamente. Tienen casa propia.

Nuestra socia labora en una fábrica de ropa deportiva  hace 4 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comuna y lo va a invertir para el arreglo de su vivienda.
 
Su meta es tener un negocio propio o un taller de costura.
texts.en:
Miss Johanna is a member of the "Poloma" communal bank and lives in the Poloma community in the "Valle" parish.  This parish is known for its beautiful scenery and nature.  The local people are involved in commerce, livestock raising and farming.  They maintain their culture and traditions.

Miss Johanna is single, age 20, and lives with her mother, who she helps financially, in their own house.

She has been employed for four years in a sporting clothes factory, where she works from Monday through Friday, from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  This is her first loan through the communal bank.  She plans to use it to renovate her home.

Her goal is to one day have her own business and sewing shop.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas D. Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento D. Puno, tiene 45 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 9 hijos, 6 D. ellos son  independientes.
La señora se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganados vacunos, ovinos y porcinos, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace un  ciclo.  Su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.  También cuenta que se dedica a la chacra como papa y quinua.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará ovejas y chanchos. En el negocio le ayuda su esposo y sus hijos.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y crecer como empresaria.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the “Hermanas D. Choquetanca II” communal bank, which is located in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 45 years old. She is married and has 9 children, 6 of whom are financially independent. 

Bertha buys and sells cattle, sheep, and pigs. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one loan cycle. Her first loan was for PEN 500.00, which she invested in her business. She also tells us that she grows potatoes and quinoa.

She will use this new loan for PEN 1,000.00 to buy sheep and pigs. Her husband and children help her with her business. Her dream is to improve the business and to grow as a businessperson.

What she likes about the communal bank is the good terms of the loan.

loans.use: to buy sheep and pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials and to cover personal expenses

loans.name: Nallivis

texts.es:
Nallivis de 36 años vive en el barrio San Luis de la ciudad de Barranquilla, desde allí comercializa con víveres, pues son productos de primera necesidad que rotan rápidamente, compran las familias para su diario vivir y le dejan a ella su propio ingreso. Su idea de negocio ocurrió cuando se vino de su natal municipio “Carmen de Bolívar” y sus familiares empezaron a enviarle productos propios de esta región, como aguacates, plátanos, carnes, lácteos con tal de apoyarle la generación de sus propios ingresos.  
Nallivis sueña con tener una tienda bien surtida,  para vender muchos más productos y adicionarle a su oferta papelería y variedades en general; así mismo sueña con adquirir una vivienda propia y esta es su gran motivación,  mientras continua en su negocio y genera una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 15% y rota sus inventarios cada 8 días.
El credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará carnes, verduras, tubérculos, abarrotes de contado para ganarse los descuentos y trasladarle buenos precios a sus clientes, con tal de conservarlos ante la competencia del mercado que es su gran desafió.
texts.en:
Nallivis, 36, lives in the city of Barranquilla’s San Luis neighborhood.  She sells foodstuffs there which are basic need items that have rapid turnaround that families buy daily producing income for her.  The idea for the business arose when she came from her native town, Carmen de Bolívar, and her relatives started sending her products typical of that region like avocadoes, bananas, meats and dairy products to help her generate income of her own.

Nallivis dreams with having a well-stocked store to sell many more products and to add stationery and general novelties to her stock.  She also dreams with acquiring a house of her own and this is her great motivator while she continues with her business generating a profit margin of 15% and rotating inventory every 8 days.

The Kiva loan is the first loan she’s had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to pay cash for meats, vegetables, tubers and groceries so that she can qualify for discounts and pass on the good prices to her customers in order to retain them in the face of market competition which is her great challenge.

loans.use: to pay cash for meat, vegetables, tubers and groceries.

loans.name: El Lirio Group

texts.es:
La señora María Irene  es casada con el señor Rodolfo, con quien procreo tres hijos quienes están a su responsabilidad y son: Carlos Alejandro de dieciseis años de edad en segundo semestre de preparatoria, José Ignacio de catorce años en tercero de secundaria y Víctor de Jesús de dos años  de edad.

    Ella solicito  el préstamo para invertir en la compra de alimentos de pollos de rancho para posteriormente vénderlo en la misma localidad, en esta actividad lleva  dos años y un mes y comenta que le va bien ya que con ellos está logrando tener ingresos en su hogar.

    Ella inicio con esta actividad ya que desea dar lo mejor a sus hijos y para ello tenía que tener una actividad que le diera ingresos, así su esposo y ella trabajan y pueden tener mejor calidad de vida.

     Su más grande deseo es que con el préstamo y su actividad pueda tener sus ahorros para trabajar y seguir apoyando a sus hijos a que estudien y con el tiempo tengan una profesión si ellos así lo desean.

    El grupo se integra de tres señoras y ellas son las dos más: la señora Miriam quien se dedica a la elaboración de panes y solicito el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes. La señora  María de Jesús quienes se dedican  a la compra  de alimentos para la crianza de marranos y posteriormente venderlo.
texts.en:
María Irene is married to Rodolfo, with whom she has three children that are under her care: Carlos Alejandro is 16 and in his second semester of high school, José Ignacio is 14 and in his third year of middle school, and Víctor de Jesús is 2 years old.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase chickens and chicken feed that she will later sell in the same town.  She has done this work for two years and a month, and she says it is going very well since she is earning an income from home.  She started this business because she wanted to give the best to her children, so she had to do work that would earn an income.  She and her husband work and they can have a better quality of life.

Her greatest wish is that with this loan and her business, she can have her savings to work and continue supporting her children so they can study and in time have a profession if that is what they want.

The group is made up of three women.  The other two are Miriam, who bakes bread and is asking for a loan to purchase ingredients, and María de Jesús, who will purchase animal feed to raise pigs and later sell them.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.es:
Reynalda  de 54 años de edad, es soltera, su casa es propia la cual cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortíz  que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Estas zonas se caracterizan por su alta actividad comercial, agricola y turística  que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Reynalda se dedica  a la venta de abarrotes (leche, azúcar, arroz, azúcar, huevos, frutas, verduras, etc.), en la cual sus  vecinos encuentran toda clase de productos comestibles, con su negocio que tiene trata en lo posible de tener  una mejor nivel de vida.
