Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa Reynalda trata de adquirir un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para abastecer su tienda de más productos y así pueda satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, y de paso incrementar  sus ingresos para cubrir su crédito y sacar adelante su negocio.

Reynalda es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer  responsable, trabajadora con el objetivo de tener mayores comodidades en su casa y que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Reynalda is 54 years old, single and she lives in a house of her own. It is equipped with basic services, water and electricity, and it is located in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, belonging to the province of Chiclayo. These regions are known for the commercial, agricultural, and tourism activities realized by the population.

Reynalda sells groceries (milk, sugar, rice, eggs, fruits, vegetables, etc.). Her neighbors come to find all kinds of food products. Through her business she tries her best to have a better quality of life.

At a visit to Edpyme Alternativa, Reynalda requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles to supply her store with more products to satisfied the needs of her clients. She will perceive a better income and it will help her to cover her loan and to move her business forward.

Reynalda is known by her neighbors for being a responsible and hardworking woman whose objective is to acquire greater comforts in her homes and to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her store.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La Sra Bertha de 37 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pimampiro, es casada y tiene un hijo que estudia en el colegio. Su nivel de educación es secundario.

Bertha y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de mora. La producción es entregada a una fábrica que se llama ‘Jugo Fácil’. Los recursos económicos generados a través de esta actividad agrícola, ha permitido educar a su hijo, hacer mejoras en su hogar y adquirir herramientas de trabajo. Ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para incrementar la producción de mora y en un futuro seguir apoyando a su hijo y darle una buena educación.
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha is 37 years old and lives in the city of Pimampiro.  She is married and has a son who is a high school student.  Bertha completed her secondary education.

She and her husband engage in agriculture, especially the cultivation of mulberries.  Their harvest is delivered to a factory called “Jugo Fácil” (Easy Juice).  The income generated through their farming activities has enabled them to provide an education for their son, make improvements to their home, and acquire equipment for their work.  

Bertha is now requesting a new loan so that she can increase her mulberry production.  In the future, she wants to continue supporting her son and provide him with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase supplies needed to increase mulberry production.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
Dorotea es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas D. Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento D. Puno, tiene 67 años D. edad, está casada y tiene siete hijos.  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Dorotea  es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorporó al  Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  ella requiere un préstamo  D. S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra D. seis unidades D. ovejas.  En el negocio trabaja junto con su esposo e hijos, también cuenta que trabaja en la chacra, actividad que realiza por distracción. 
Su sueño es tener más ganados y mejorar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Dorotea is a member of the Communal Bank “Hermanas D. Choquetanca II” which is in the District of Illave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 67 years old, married, and has seven children. Sra. Dorotea did not receive an education.

She is a new member who recently joined Manuela Ramos. Dorotea needs a loan of 1000 PEN to invest in the purchase of six heads of sheep. In her business, she works with her husband and children. She also works on a farm, an activity that provides her with a distraction.

Her dreams incluD. having more animals and improving her earnings. What she enjoys about her Communal Bank is the convenience of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase six heads of sheep.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad, vive en su casa con su 2 hijos, el cual cuenta con servicio de  luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Este distrito es una zona agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Leonor se dedica desde algún tiempo a la venta de comidas y bebidas, en un puesto que tiene en la plaza central de este distrito, la atención es de lunes a sábado, cuenta con su propia clientela y con los ingresos que adquiere puede solventar todas sus necesidades.

Al observar que su clientela aumenta a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para la preparación de sus distintas comidas y bebidas y utensilios para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, el aumento de sus ganancias permitira cubrir su préstamo y mejorar su niveldevida.  Leonor es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa,con la finalidad de que su negocio cada vez crezca más y sea el mejor de la zona en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Leonor is the mother of a family, 45 years old, and she lives at home with her two children. Their home is equipped only with electricity and it is located in the district of Tambogrande, at about 40 minutes of the department of Piura. This is an agricultural, farming, and artisan district.

For some time Leonor has been selling prepared foods and drinks from a stand she has in the central plaza of the district. She is open from Monday to Saturday and she has her own clientele. With the income she earns she is able to provide for all other needs.

When she saw an increase in clients she requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles to purchase ingredients to prepare the different foods and drinks, and to purchase utensils to provide her clients with a better level of service. The increase in her profits will help her repay her loan and to improve the quality of her life. Leonor is a very hardworking and earnest woman. Her goal for the near future is to make her business progressively increase until it is the best in the region.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and utensils with which to prepare her foods and drinks.

loans.name: Fadilia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fadilia lo conforman cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Masaya, ellas tienen siete ciclos de trabajar con Adim. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Ana Patricia quien hace 5 años inicio con 3,000 córdobas en mercadería de ropa actualmente ella invierte aproximadamente unos 7,000 córdobas ya que tiene mayor clientela.  
Ella tiene cinco hijos de las edades 18, 17, 15, 13 y 10 años los cuales estudian y su meta es aumentar su negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Cinthya  de 22 años desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, Yelva compra y vende leche y Kenia Isabel de 23 años comercializa ropa usada.
texts.en:
The Fadilia Group consists of four hardworking and enterprising women who are originally from Masaya.  They have worked with ADIM for seven loan cycles.  The group coordinator is Sra. Ana Patricia.  She started her business five years ago with an inventory of clothing worth 3000 cordobas.  Now she invests approximately 7000 cordobas and already has a large customer base.  

Ana Patricia has five children (ages 18, 17, 15, 13, and 10) who are in school.  Her goal is to increase her business.

The other members are as follows:
•	Cinthya, age 22, has been selling fruits and vegetables for six years.
•	Yelba buys and sells milk.
•	Kenia Isabel, age 23, sells used clothing.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra es madre de familia  de 29 años, con 2 hijos, tiene casa propia que no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande,  a 40 minutos  aproximadamente del departamento de Piura.  Este distrito tiene como actividad  principal la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Sandra se dedica a la crianza de ganado porcino y aves de corral  (gallinas, pavos y patos), su corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada.  Posteriormente vende sus animales una vez que hayan llegado a su desarrollo óptimo en los diferentes mercados de Tambogrande y Piura,  para poder incrementar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia.

El crédito que ha solicitado Sandra es de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa, el cual será destinado  para la compra de  alimentos balanceados e implemtar un corral para sus animales, con la finalidad de que sus aves vivan cómodas, engorden y pueda venderlo a buen precio para poder pagar su préstamo y al mismo tiempo esos ingresos le ayuden a que su familia tenga un mejor futuro.

Sandra es una mujer que siempre ante los retos que le ha puesto la vida, a sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida juntoa su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is the mother of a family, 29 years old, and she has a house of her own. It is not equipped with any basic services and it is located in the district of Tambogrande, at 40 minutes form the department of Piura. The principal business activities in the district are agriculture, farming, and crafts.

Sandra raises pigs and poultry (chicken, turkeys, and ducks). The corral where her livestock are kept is located in the external part of her property. She feeds them balanced feed. She sells her livestock once they have reached an optimum level in their development at the different markets in Tambogrande and Piura, to increase her income and to provide for her family.

The loan which Sandra requests is in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). It will be invested in the purchase of balanced feed and to set up a corral for her livestock. Her goal is to have her poultry live comfortably, to fatten them and to sell them at a good price to be able to repay her loan. At the same time this income will help her to give her family a better future.

Sandra is a woman who has always overcome the challenges she faced in life, to improve in life together with her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and to install a corral for her livestock.

loans.name: Georgea Group

texts.es:
El grupo Georgea lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras quienes tienen 14 ciclos de trabajar con Adim y han tenido tres préstamos con Kiva. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Miriam de 41 años desde joven inicio su taller de costura con unos ahorros y una máquina de coser. 

Miriam tiene tres hijos de 15, 17 y 19 años quienes estudian y su hija en sus tiempos libre le ayuda con el negocio. Ella con el crédito comprara telas.

Las otras integrantes son María de los Ángeles de 55 años tiene una pequeña venta de gaseosas, fresco y hielo…etc.y Paulo Antonio quien vende Sandillas.
texts.en:
The Georgea Group consists of three hardworking and enterprising individuals who have participated in 14 loan cycles with ADIM.  Three of those loans have been with Kiva.  The group coordinator is Sra. Miriam, age 41.  As a young woman, she started a dressmaking shop with some savings and a sewing machine.  

Miriam has three children (ages 15, 17, and 19) who are in school.  Her daughter helps with the business in her spare time.  Miriam will use her loan to buy fabrics.  

The other members are as follows:
•	María de los Ángeles is 55 years old and has a small vending post where she sells sodas, refreshments, ice, and other items.
•	Paulo Antonio sells watermelons.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 40 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus 05 hijos en casa propia, su vivienda esta ubicada en el Distrito D. TambogranD., cuenta con servicio D. luz eléctrica pero no con agua ni desagüe.

Su esposo se dedica a labores agrícolas percibiendo ingresos que aporta al sostenimiento del hogar y la  actividad que desarrolla Victoria es la crianza y venta D. ovinos, ella los cría en un corral ubicado en la parte posterior D. su domicilio. Una vez que los engorda los comercializa en el mercado local.  Esta actividad la realizan desD. hace más D. 3 años, en los que ha podido obtener clientela fija y experiencia en este negocio.

Victoria desea comprar alimento balanceado para que sus ovejas logren el peso ideal y también quiere hacer mejoras en corral D. estos. D. esta manera ampliara sus negocio incrementando el número D. animales que actualmente tiene y por enD. aumentar sus ventas, por eso esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1500 nuevos soles para que pueda alcanzar sus metas trazadas.
texts.en:
Victoria is 40 years old and she lives with her husband and their 5 children in a house of their own. Their house is located in the district of TambogranD. and it is equipped with electricity but not with running water or sewage services.

Her husband is an agriculturist and he earns and income to support the home. Victoria's business is to raise and sell sheep. She raises them in a corral located in the rear section of their property. Once they have grown she sells them in the local market. She has had this business for more than 3 years and in that time she has been able to obtain a fixed clientele and experience in the business.

Victoria wishes to purchase balanced feed so that her sheep will reach an ideal weight and also to make improvements to the corral. This way she will be able to expand her business by increasing the number of livestock from what she actually has and consequently increasing her sales. She requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) to reach her goals which are overdue.

loans.use: to purchase feed and to improve the corral where she keeps her sheep.

loans.name: El Espino Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Espino lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Nindiri ellas tienen 14 ciclos con Adim en los cuales se han perfilado como buenas clientas y han tenido tres prestamos con Kiva. Ellas han participado en las capacitaciones de Adim en las cuales según comentaron han aprendido mucho.

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Vilma de 54 años quien tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en la venta de comida frita en la cual invertirá el crédito con la compra de queso plátano, repollo, aceite… etc. Además los fines de semana realiza sopas especialmente las de gallina.

Ella tiene ocho hijos de los cuales el menor de 16 años es el único a su cargo quien en su tiempo libre junto a dos trabajadoras le ayuda en el negocio. Vilma desea invertir en un futuro en el destace de cerdo.

Las otras dos integrantes son Silvia María de 24 años quien en un inicio vendía Prendas (joyería) ahora tiene una tortillería ya que este negocio le es más rentable y Nidia compra y vende maíz desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The group “El Espino” (The Hawthorn) consists of three hardworking and enterprising women who are originally from Nindiri.  They have participated in 14 loan cycles with ADIM and have emerged as good clients.  Three of their loans were provided through Kiva.  They have also participated in training classes provided by ADIM and, according to them, have learned very much.  

The group coordinator is Sra. Vilma, age 54.  She manages a “fritanga”, a popular type of restaurant that sells fried foods.  Vilma will invest her loan in the purchase of cheese, plantains, cabbages, oil, and other products.  On the weekends she prepares soups, including those that contain chicken.  

Vilma has eight children.  Her youngest child is 16 years old and the only one who is still a dependent.  During his free time, he helps the other two employees in Vilma’s business.  In the future, Vilma wants to invest in butchered pigs.

The other two members are as follows:
•	Silvia María, age 24, started out selling jewelry, but now she has a very profitable business selling tortillas.
•	Nidia has been buying and selling corn for two years.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, plantains, cabbages, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas D. Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento D. Puno, tiene 57 años D. edad, está casada y tiene nueve hijos  independientes.  La señora pudo estudiar la primaria.
Se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganados vacunos ovinos, también se dedica a la chacra, cosecha papa, quinua, cebada.  Hace un ciclo que  trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Ahora solicitará  un nuevo préstamo por la suma D. S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará en la compra D. una vaquillita.  En el negocio trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es mejorar con el ganado y obtener mejores ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of the Communal Bank “Hermanas D. Choquetanca II” which is located in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 57 years old, married, and has nine children who are independent. Josefina has an elementary school education.

She buys and sells cattle and sheep. Josefina also has a farm where she grows potatoes, quinoa, and barley. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for one cycle. Her initial loan was in the amount of 500 PEN and she invested the money in her business. Now she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1000 PEN in order to buy a calf. She manages her business with her husband.

Her dreams incluD. improving her livestock and generating better earnings. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the convenience of the loan.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José tiene 56 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos que son independientes. Su casa está ubicada en una  localidad  grande y bonita, la cual esta ubicada en el distrito  de Chepén del departamento de La Libertad.

José se dedica a la venta de refrescos en un pequeño puesto ambulante ubicado en la ciudad de Chepén. Desde hace varios años José desde muy temprano se dedica a ofrecer refresco de cebada, soya, entre otros  sabores a todos los transeúntes de una de las principales calles de la ciudad, para este negocio José cuenta con una amplia experiencia y con clientela fidelizada a su  negocio.

José está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que él pueda comprar una refrigeradora la cual utilizará en su negocio ya que le servirá para almacenar hielo, uno de los insumos que el utiliza para su negocio, así como también para la conservación de sus bebidas , así estas  no se malograrán en épocas de verano.

José es una persona responsable, tranquila, y las personas que lo conocen lo consideran una persona trabajadora y honesta.
texts.en:
Jose is 56 years old and he has 3 children, all of whom are independent. His house is located in a large and beautiful community located in the district of Chepen in the department of La Libertad.

Jose sells fresh drinks from a cart in the city of Chepen. For many years and from the very early mornings he has been selling barley, soy, and other flavored drinks to the passers-by of a main street in the city. Jose has ample experience in the business and he has a loyal client base.

Jose requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase a freezer for his business. This will help him store ice, one of the products that he uses for his business. He will also be able to conserve his drinks, especially during the summer months.

Jose is a responsible and calm person. Those who know him consider him to be a hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to use for his business

loans.name: El Clavel Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Clavel lo conforman Johana del Socorro, Mercedes de Lourdes  y Maricela Auxiliadora  tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Nindiri. Este grupo tiene siete ciclos trabajando con Adim en los cuales han sido personas responsables y sus negocios han crecido.

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Johana de 24 años quien inicio 4 años vendiendo meneítos, gaseosa y fresco en la actualidad entrega almuerzos, los fines de semana instala su  fritanga donde  vende enchiladas.
Ella con el crédito con el crédito comprara arroz, frijoles, aceite, plátano…etc. con la meta de seguir mejorando su negocio.

La señora Mercedes de 38 años tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita y Maricela de 29 años desde hace tres años vende frescos, meitos y enchiladas.
texts.en:
The group “El Clavel” (The Carnation) consists of Johana del Socorro, Mercedes de Lourdes, and Maricela Auxiliadora. These three hardworking and enterprising women are originally from Nindiri. This group has worked with ADIM for seven loan cycles and they have demonstrated that they are responsible people. As a result, their businesses have grown.

The group coordinator is Sra. Johana. She is 24 years old and started a business four years ago selling snack foods, sodas, and refreshments. At the moment, she prepares lunches. On the weekends, she manages a “fritanga” (a restaurant that sells fried foods) where she serves enchiladas. She will use her loan to buy rice, beans, oil, plantains, and other products. Her goal is to continue improving her business.

Sra. Mercedes, age 38, also has a “fritanga” since fried foods are popular. Maricela, age 29, has been selling refreshments, snack foods, and enchiladas for three years.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, plantains, and other products.

loans.name: Yesenia Catalina

texts.es:
Yesenia, de 31 años de edad, nacida en la Ceiba comarca localizada en el departamento de León , es casada, madre de tres hijos , ella es comerciante se dedica a la crianza de cerdo , siembra de maíz. Inicio con esfuerzos propios, sembrando 2 manzanas de maíz ,2 manzanas de frijoles  y después fue comprando animales como cerdos y gallinas para criarlos cuando ella empezó en este negocio tenia 18 años de edad. Además cuando no están buenas las ventas, ella se dedica a limpiar y sembrar maní, Hortalizas, tomate, cebollas que son otros  ingresos  que ella tiene para mantener a su familia. 
Solicito el préstamo para comprar cerdos de  raza para desarrollo y crianza. Ella espera poder hacer crecer su crianza de animales, espera poder diversificar su negocio atraves de la siembra de granos básicos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Dentro de sus planes esta poder tener una granja de cerdos reproductores. Su próxima meta es construir  un galerón para sus animales.
texts.en:
Yesenia, age 31, was born in the region of La Ceiba which is located in the Department of León. She is married and the mother of three children. Yesenia is a merchant who raises pigs and grows corn. Through her own efforts, she started out planting corn on two plots of land and beans on another two plots of land. Afterwards, she bought animals such as pigs and chickens to raise. Yesenia started her business when she was 18 years old. Whenever her sales are not good, she provides cleaning services and grows peanuts, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions to earn additional income to support her family.

Yesenia is requesting a loan to buy breeding pigs to raise and develop. She hopes to expand her animal business as well as diversify her activities to include growing grains so that she can improve the quality of life for her family. Her plans include having a farm for breeding pigs, but her next goal is to build a barn for her animals.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Manuelita Lucia

texts.es:
Doña Manuelita, nació en el departamento de León, tiene 40 años  de edad, ella es comerciante se dedica a  vender comida, es casada, tiene dos hijos, ella solo estudio hasta tercer grado de primaria. Desde niña la toco que trabajar  muy duro pues sus padres y ella vivían en una situación de pobreza que incluso ir a la escuela y pagar sus estudios era un lujo que no se podía dar. Su primera experiencia de trabajo fue desde muy pequeña  cuando comenzó a vender agua helada en las calles, también vendía frutas, verduras. Así fue surgiendo en la vida con mucho sacrificio esfuerzo hasta lograr tener hoy en día su comideria  ella tiene este negocio en su casa cuenta con el apoyo de  su esposo, antes ella tenia un local en la terminal de buses donde ella vendía frutas.  
Ella solicito el préstamo para mejorar su local, quiere comprar materiales de construcción como zinc, madera e invertir en granos básicos. Con este inversión espera poder ampliar su negocio, atraer mas clientes, pues tiene como meta convertir su comideria en un restaurante.
texts.en:
Doña Manuelita, age 40, was born in the Department of León and works as a merchant who sells food. She is married and has two children. Manuelita only has a third grade education. As a young girl, she had to work very hard since she and her parents lived in poverty. Being able to go to school and paying for her studies was a luxury that her parents could not provide. Her first experience working was as a young girl selling ice water on the streets. She also sold fruits and vegetables. Since then, Manuelita proceeded through life with great sacrifice and effort. Today she operates an eatery out of her home with the help of her husband. Previously she had a shop at the bus terminal where she sold fruits.

Manuelita is requesting a loan in order to improve the location of her business. She wants to buy construction materials such as zinc and wood, as well as invest in basic grains. With this investment, she hopes to expand her business and attract more customers. Her goal is to convert her eatery into a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to expand her business location and to acquire basic grains.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es una madre D. familia D. 52 años D. edad, tiene casa propia donD. vive con su esposo e hijos, la cual cuenta con servicio D. luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito TambogranD. a unos40 minutos del departamento D. Piura.   Zona que desarrolla la actividad agrícola,  ganadera y artesana (alfarería y metalurgia).

Luz se dedica a la comercialización D. chicha D. jora (bebida realizada a base D. maíz molido que lo dejan fermentar y luego le colocan otros insumos y está lista para consumirla), D. harina D. maíz y cajas D. cervezas, la chicha D. jora lo prepara en su mismo domicilio, actividad que realiza desD. hace 5 años  y lo ofrece a sus clientes que la conocen, D. esta manera tiene ingresos  económicos para poder solventar los gastos familiares.

A solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla para comprar insumos para seguir elaborando la chicha D. jora, la harina D. maíz y cerveza que venD., los pedidos  que le hacen le permite tener mayores ganancias, ya que su clientela se ha incrementado considerablemente,  para poder pagar su crédito y D. paso mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.  Luz es unapersona dedicada a su trabajo y muy responsable a pesar D. la competencia desea que su negocio crezca, ya que su meta es que con los ingresos  que obtenga pueda  darles un mejor futuroa sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz is the mother of a family, 52 years old, and she has a house of her own where she lives with her husband and children. It is only equipped with electricity and it is locate din the district of TambogranD., at 40 minutes from the department of Piura. This region's primary activities are agriculture, farming and crafts (pottery and crafted metals).

Luz sells chicha D. jora (a drink maD. from a crushed corn base which is left to ferment and later other ingredients are added before it is ready to be consumed), corn flour, and boxes of beer. She prepares chicha D. jora in her own home. She has had her business for 5 years and she offers the product to her clients that know her. This is how she earns an income to proviD. for her family's expenses.

She requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles through Capital Semilla. She will purchase ingredients to keep making chicha D. jora, corn flour, and to resell beer. The orders that are placed help her to increase her profits, especially since her clients have increased considerably. It will help her repay her loan and to improve the quality of life for her family. Luz is a person who is dedicated to her work and she is very responsible. Despite the competition she wants to develop her business and her goal is to proviD. her children with a better future with the help of her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make chicha de jora and to purchase beer.

loans.name: Amalia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Amalia tiene 42 años D. edad, es casada y vive con sus hijos.  Su casa está ubicada en el distrito  D. Chepén del departamento D. La Libertad. La condición D. vida en su localidad es tranquila y muy armónica.

Amalia se dedica a la confección D. ropa  todo tipo D. prendas D. vestir, en su mismo domicilio donD.  a ubicado dos maquinas D. coser en la cuales ella trabaja diariamente. Adicionalmente ella se dedica a  elaborar collares aretes sortijas, pulseras, etc. Ambas actividades le ayuda para solventar sus gastos diarios.

Amalia esta solicitando un préstamo en Edpyme Alternativa D. 2500  nuevos soles para que ella pueda comprar  material para la confección D. sus prendas D. vestir y la elaboración D. sus productos.
Amalia es una persona muy optimista, que desea salir adelante y poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Amalia is 42 years old, married, and she lives with her children. Her house is located in the district of Chepen in the department of La Libertad. Life in her community is very tranquil and harmonious.

Amalia makes all types of articles of clothing in her own home. She has two sewing machines and she works with them every day. She also makes necklaces, earrings, rings, bracelets, etc. These activities help her to cover her daily expenses.

Amalia requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2500 nuevos soles to purchase materials to make her articles of clothing and her crafts.

Amalia is a very optimistic person who wants to move forward to be able to proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Exito Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Éxito lo conforman Aracely , Yolanda y Jeanette tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras las cuales tienen 20 ciclos de trabajar con Adim y dos préstamos con Kiva. Ellas han participados de las capacitaciones de Adim donde lo que más les impacto según comentaron es la Historia de doña Martha (clienta de Adim) que trata sobre el autoestima y como organizar su dinero.

 La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Aracely de 42 años quien junto a su esposo tienen un taller de calzado tradicional especializado en sandalias. Este trabajo se realiza y vende a diario en el mercado de Masaya. Ella invertirá el crédito en materia prima como pega, cuerina, brasil, hilo, suelas… etc.

La señora Yolanda de 60 años vende tiste, pinolillo, tamales etc. negocio que inicio con las ganancias que tenia de lavar y planchar y Jeanette de 37 años se dedica a la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
The group “Éxito” (Success) consists of Aracely, Yolanda, and Jeanette. These three hardworking and enterprising women have participated in 20 loan cycles with ADIM, two of which were funded through Kiva. They have also taken advantage of the training classes offered through ADIM. The members say the greatest impact of the training has been on Doña Martha (another client of ADIM), who learned how to deal with her self-esteem and organize her finances.

Sra. Aracely, age 42, is the group coordinator. She and her husband manage a traditional shoemaking shop that specializes in sandals. They perform their work and sell every day at the market in Masaya. Aracely will invest her loan in raw materials such as adhesives, synthetic leather, Brazilian leather, thread, soles, and other supplies.

Sra. Yolanda is 60 years old and sells traditional Nicaraguan beverages such as “tiste”, “pinolillo”, as well as tamales and other foods. She started her business with the money she earned washing and ironing clothes. Jeanette is 37 years old and a clothing merchant.

loans.use: to purchase adhesives, synthetic leather, natural leather, thread, soles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Luna is married and has three adult children. She has a business  selling seafood products, including fish like milk fish, sardines & mackerel. Luna has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2009, Luna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 10,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. 

This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. Luna is requesting 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish like sardines & mackerel. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI: 

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish like sardines & mackerel

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is from the village of Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 54 years old, married, and has eight adult children. To make a living, Nilda  raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling animal feed and farm-related products in the local community. Nilda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Nilda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilda is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be Nilda's first loan taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches   covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, cement, wood and sand

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda  is from the village of Alindahaw. She is 41 years old, married, and has two adult children. To make a living, Imelda owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2011, Imelda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ready-to-wear clothing for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Imelda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.es:
La Sra. Gulnara  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alisson II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 48 años  y tiene dos hijos mayores  de edad y cuentan con familia propia.

Inicia su negocio  con  la venta de frutas en su puesto del  mercado N° 02 de Tarapoto, pero al ser desalojada  del lugar,  decide  comprar un motocarro con un capital   de S/. 500.00 que  le sirvió de cuota inicial, vehículo que es utilizado para transporte de pasajeros dentro de la ciudad, por lo que está muy contenta ya que las ganancias le sirven para ir pagando poco a poco el precio del vehículo. 


Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00, financiará la compra de dos motocarros  mas que le servirá para mejorar sus ingresos  a través del alquiler diario de estos vehículos.
 
Gulnara, es una  mujer trabajadora, su sueño es tener algún día una tienda grande de abarrotes.   Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder mejorar sus ingresos  y mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia. .
texts.en:
Gulnara belongs to the “Alisson II” community bank in the district of Tarapoto, province  of San Martin, departament of San Martín. She is single and 48 years old. She has two grown children who have thier own families.  

She started her business selling fruit from her stal in the N° 02 market of Tarapoto. When she lost the stall, she decided to buy a motorcycle taxi with an investment of S/. 500.00, which served as a down payment. The vehicle is used to transport passengers in the city. She is very happy with this, sin ce the earnings are used to pay for the vehicle little by little.    

With the loan of S/. 3000.00, she will finance the purchase of two motorcycle taxis more that will help her improve her earnings by renting these vehicles out daily. 
 
Gulnara, is a hard working woman. Her dream is to one day have a grocery store. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her have opportunities to improve her income and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to finance the purchase of two motorcycle taxis to improve her income by renting these vehicles daily.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, soda, rice, oil, candies, etc.

loans.name: María Elsa

texts.es:
La señora María Elsa es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, es madre soltera y con un hijo. Se desempeña como enfermera en un puesto de salud de la localidad donde ha brindado sus servicios por más de cinco años para la mejor salud de los habitantes.

Cuenta con su propia vivienda la que pretende mejorar poco a poco para el bienestar de su hijo y por eso una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir materiales de construcción como ladrillos,  cemento, arena y zinc mejorar y ampliar una habitación, por tal razón decidió solicitar el crédito con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad.
texts.en:
María Elsa is from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón. She is a single mother of one child. She works as a nurse in a health center in the area. She has worked there for more than five years to improve the health of the residents. 

She has her own house which she intends to improve little by little for the wellbeing of her son. That is why one of the things she needs at this time is to acquire construction materials such as bricks, cement, sand and zinc sheeting to enlarge a room. That is why she decided to ask for her fourth loan from Ceprodel, with the purpose of filling her need.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and zinc sheeting.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is from the village of Tupsan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old and widowed with six adult children. To make a living, Rosa owns a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies like rice cakes, instant noodles, breads and snack foods. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like rice, flour & eggs. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw needed ingredients like rice, flour & eggs

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Nimfa owns a sari-sari (variety) store selling snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and canned goods. Nimfa has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nimfa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Nimfa is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like junk foods, canned goods & biscuits. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nimfa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like snack foods, canned goods & biscuits

loans.name: Caroline

Caroline is from St. Joseph Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Caroline owns a business making and selling meat delicacies like pork adobo and pinakbet -- a meat and vegetable stew. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Caroline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2010 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Caroline is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like meat, vegetables & spices. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Caroline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger — a Mongolian yurt — in Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband is a carpenter who manages a business making woodenproducts. Her older son, age 18, goes to a college while the younger one, age 8, is in secondary school. She sells vegetables at a rented stall at a local market. She started the business with working capital of 200,000 MNT in 1999. Since then her business has been quite successful, which allowed her to increase her working capital to 2,000,000 MNT. With her earnings she feeds her family and pays the education fees of her children. She is planning to buy a plot of land in order to build storage for preserving harvested vegetables. Bolormaa is a polite and well-known businesswoman in her town. She says, "I want my children to be educated and have better jobs in the future." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more potatoes and onions for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes and onions

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mrs. Sor is a 48-year-old married woman who plants different kinds of crops on her farmland to earn a profit. She is a villager who lives in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Her husband has skills for building houses. They have two childR. – one is a construction worker. Mrs. Sor has had great success growing rice crops, which is an annual process. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year. Rainy season is coming now, and Mrs. Sor would like to ask for a Kiva loan to rent a machine to plow her farmland and to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her crop to grow well.

loans.use: to rent a machine to plow her farmland and to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her crop to grow well.

loans.name: Annie Love

texts.en:
Annie Love is from the village of Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 29 years old, married, and has one child.  To make a living, Annie Love owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Annie Love has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a months.

In 2009, Annie Love joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annie Love has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and soft drinks. This loan will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches   covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is from the village of Letican, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old, married, and has five adult children. To make a living, Fely owns and operates a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals, such as chicken and pork adobo, afritada and bulalo, to customers in the local community. Fely has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Fely joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Fely is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients, food, and drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be Fely's sixth loan  from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, food, and drinks for her restaurant

Genara is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old, separated from her spouse, and has four adult children. To make a living, Genara owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap, and biscuits in the local community. Genara has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Genara joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genara is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods,snack foods, and beverages. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita  is from the village of Kauswagan, Aurora zamboanga del sur.  She is 55 years old.  Conchita is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Conchita owns and operates a business that raises crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting coconut for sale.  Conchita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Conchita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC.  This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seedlings and young crops to raise.  Conchita is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Conchita from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 61 years old and married.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marcela has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines.  Marcela requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

Marcela has been in this business for 36 years.  In the future, Marcela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en: Mrs. Soun, age 30, is a rice farmer who has been making a low income by planting rice crops on her own farmland for the past ten years. From her crop-growing business, she makes an average of $2.50 a day for daily expenses. In order to help support Mrs. Soun, her husband works in the construction field. To increase her daily revenue, Mrs. Soun has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy pig feed and a piglet. This loan will help her family situation to get better. Mrs. Soun has been married a few years but she doesn’t have a baby yet.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and a piglet.

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya is 49 years old and lives with her husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Govi-Altai Province in Mongolia. Her children are all grown and live separately.

Enhtuya manages a meat and dairy product trading business with the help of her husband, a business she started in 1990. At that time her working capital was 150,000 MNT, and she sold only meat. In 2003 she began selling dairy products to supplement her earnings. She managed to improve her business and bought one more stall to increase her sales channels. She travels to the countryside of Mongolia to purchase animals for her business.

A friendly woman who says, "I want to buy a house for my younger son," Enhtuya is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of meat for her business.

loans.use: to purchase an abundant amount of meat.

loans.name: Rechard

texts.en:
Rechard is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 38 years old. Rechard is married and has six school-aged children. Rechard has a motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle transport) services. Rechard has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Rechard joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. He has successfully repaid his last loan from HSPFI, which was for 7000 PHP and was used to purchase additional tools for the motorela & working capital. 

This loan will be his third from HSPFI. Rechard is requesting 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI: 

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 48, married, and has five children. 

She earns a living by raising livestock like cows, pigs, and water buffalo in the Philippines. Leonida is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise. 

Leonida has been raising livestock for five years and also earns additional income from a bakery. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 53 years old. 

Catalina has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Catalina requested an 18,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like linen, thread, etc. to sew. 

Catalina has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Catalina would like to save enough to buy farm land.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like linen and thread

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is now 50 years old and married with five adult children. His wife is a plain housekeeper. He has been raising pigs for sale and breeding for 15 years already. He generates at least PHP 25,000 for the three pigs sold in every quarter. 

Jesus is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase a sufficient supply of hog feed and to renovate the pig pens. He hopes to grow his business further to sustain his family's necessities, especially in providing education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and to renovate the pig pens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Grace

Grace is from the village of Tupsan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old. Grace is widowed and has three school-aged children. Grace has a motorcycle transport business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 11,000 PHP and was used to purchase tools needed to provide service. 

This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. Grace is requesting 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools & materials needed for the maintenance of the service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI: 

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
In the future, Antonieta dreams of becoming successful in her livestock business (raising pigs to breed and fatten for sale).

She is 54 years old and is married to a farmer. The couple is blessed with four children. She and her husband help each other in maintaining their agricultural business and tilling their farm. She has been raising pigs for two years now. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy hog feed and a variety of corn seeds and fertilizers for their agricultural business. In the business, Antoineta said that she is able to generate around PHP 25,000 almost every quarter.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, a variety of corn seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Batnasan

texts.en: Batnasan is 51 years old and lives with her three children in an apartment in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital. Her younger sons are students while her daughter helps with the family business, a store where the family has been selling construction materials since 2006. As a way of increasing sales, Batnasan is planning to open a second store at a new location. She is an honest women who is working hard to feed her family and emphasizes that, "with the loan I want to improve my business." She is seeking to borrow 1,500,000 MNT to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena lives in the village of Tupsan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 56 years old, widowed and has four grown children. For the last six years, she has made a living by running a food stall where she sells snacks, ice cream and other items. She earns about 5,000 PHP a month.  

In 2010, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from HSPFI and is applying for a new one, for 8,000 PHP, to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue improving her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is 60 years old, married and has one child. She works hard to help provide for her family by running a sari-sari (or variety) store, and is applying for a new loan, for PHP 12,000, to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has repaid three previous loans from NWTF and plans to use the money she makes from this one to continue expanding her business, which is now one year old.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ngeng

texts.en: Mr. Ngeng has been earning a profit from farming in Kompong Cham province. He is a widower and makes around US $2.50 each day to use for the family’s needs. He spends most of his life planting crops. He doesn't have a life partner as his wife passed away many years ago. Currently he lives with five children:  one is married and the other four are single. To fulfill the family’s needs – which often increase – one of his single kids is employed as a garment factory worker and has a fixed salary every month. She always contributes her monthly salary to Mr. Ngeng. This is a good time for planting rice crops (it is rainy season). Therefore, Mr. Ngeng is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is 53 years old, widowed and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari (or variety) store and has applied for a loan for PHP 20,000 from NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell to her customers. Her store has been in business for six years and she has repaid 16 previous loans from NWTF. She also runs several other businesses, including a restaurant, a lodging house and stands where she sells dried fish and water. Her main goal is to save money to invest in her businesses.

loans.use: To buy items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rodolita

texts.en:
Rodolita lives in the village of Balite, Bugo, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 25 years old, married and has three school-aged children. For the last three years, she has made a living by selling clothing and shoes and earns about 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Rodolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, to buy additional items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

location.town: Bugo, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is married with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dolores is 36 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Dolores has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Dolores requested a 25,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Dolores has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Dolores would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Emma has been in this business for 7 years now, and also earns additional income from coconut farming.

Emma requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables and fruits to sell.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Ronel is from the village of Macao, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 22 years old. Ronel is single. To make a living, Ronel owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling firewood, bananas and malangas in the local community. Ronel has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ronel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional firewood and green bananas. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ronel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and green bananas

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is from the village of Laturan, Libona, Bukidnon. She is 51 years old. Saturnina is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Saturnina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, soap and beverages in the local community. Saturnina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 14,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Saturnina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saturnina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Saturnina is requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and biscuits. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Saturnina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snack foods and biscuits

loans.name: Eam

texts.en:
Mrs. Eam is a 50-year-old woman.  She is married to Mr. Moeurn, age 54.  They both work in the farm fields as rice cultivators in Kompong Cham.  This old couple lives with six others and earns a living by planting various crops on their own farmland.  

Mrs. Eam is currently planting a potato crop, which she will harvest when they are mature. Recently, her crop is not growing well because it lacks fertilizer.  Because of this problem, Mrs. Eam has decided to seek a loan to buy fertilizer, which will make her crop grow well.  She will use the remainder of the funds to pay for plowing costs and purchase more seeds for future plantings.

loans.use: buy fertilizer & seeds and pay for plowing costs

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is from the village of Buguac, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 38 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling firewood and green bananas in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling pillow cases, blankets and bed sheet products in the local community. Josiphene has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josiphene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Bok

texts.en:
Mrs. Bok is a hard-working woman who has spent her life cultivating crops. She has a few ponds in which she grows lotus flowers. Three months after planting, she harvests them to sell. Her husband also helps her plant rice crops as well as grow lotus flowers.  They sell their lotus flowers to people who need them  for religious ceremonies. 

This couple has five children, three of whom are now married and have started their own homes. The remaining two are still single and one works in the garment industry as a sewing worker. 

Mrs. Bok will be using her loan to buy a new motorbike to bring her rice crops and lotus flowers to sell in the busy market.  Mrs. Bok says this loan can reduce her traveling expenses.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to transports crops to the market

loans.name: Sawe Mutiara Indah Group

texts.en: Ayu Ketut joined the 10 member group Sawe Mutiara Indah to get a loan and training on pig farming. Ayu Ketut got a loan of 1,500,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) which will be used to buy a superior species of pig. Pig meat of this type is better quality and has higher selling prices. Since the cost of maintenance of these pigs is almost equal to the cost of maintenance of the local species of pig, she hopes she will earn more. All profit will be saved for the future of her children. For everyday needs, she uses the garden and her husband's income. Every day, Ayu Ketut spends 10,000 IDR for food and 150,000 IDR per month to pay for electricity and water.

loans.use: to buy a superior species of pig.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is from the village of Macao, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 47 years old, married, and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Lilian owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling green bananas in the local community. Lilian has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lilian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilian is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stock of green bananas. This loan will be the first one taken out by Lilian from HSPFI. location.town: Bugo, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhum is a 70-year-old woman.  She is a local villager and lives in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. 

Mrs. Chhum is a widow and lives with her children -- four are married and living in their own houses and two are single and enrolled in a local school. Some of her children work with her on the farm. She also has a daughter who sells different kinds of items from her wooden kiosk in Phnom Penh City. Mrs. Chhum is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and bean seeds for planting, and to hire a plowing machine to plow her farmland.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, insecticides, bean seeds, and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is from the village of Macao, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years-old. Jenny is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Jenny owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling bananas, coconuts and fire wood in the local community. Jenny has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Jenny joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenny is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas and coconuts. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

To make a living, Jissie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Jissie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2011, Jissie joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jissie is requesting a first loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional junk food and canned goods.
