location.town: Guinitan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
The woman in the photograph is Mrs. Va, age 36.  She lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best area for farming.  Mrs. Va is a married woman who is devoted to her two young children, both of whom are in school and depend on her care. 

Mrs. Va owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows a various crops on it with help from her husband. She currently plants a peanut crop and estimates that she will harvest it within the next two months when the plants mature. She will use the income from selling her crop to better meet her family’s needs.  Mrs. Va has another farm that she owns, but she is not planting crops on it yet. She hopes to use her Kiva loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer and to pay for plowing costs.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for plowing

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en:
Alfonso is from the village of Hinigdaan, El Salvador, Misamis Oriental. He is 45 years-old. Alfonso is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Alfonso owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Alfonso has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Alfonso joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfonso is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and junk food for the store. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and junk food for the store.

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Mr.Uuganbayar is 31 years-old and lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife looks after the kids at the moment. They live in their family house in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar.

Uuganbayar has been working for a power grid servicing company as an electrician for six years. He is a hardworking and self motivated person. Recently, he has been appointed as a team leader and had a pay raise. 

Two years ago, Uuganbayar built a family house but some parts of the house have not been completed yet due to a lack of funds. Now he wants to complete the unfinished parts of the house by taking a loan. The pay raise has increased his repayment capability and gives him a chance to complete his mission. The loan will be used to buy the necessary building materials and to complete the building project which he started two years ago.

loans.use: to buy building materials necessary to complete the family house project which he started two years ago.

loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en: Bilqees is a housewife. She stays at home and carries out her household responsibilities. Her husband operates a Punjabi food selling business from his cart. Bilqees helps him by preparing a traditional Punjabi food called Nan Tiki (made with potatoes and served with bread) and Dahi Bhalay (a spicy dish made with yogurt and sauces). He puts the food on his cart and sells it by visiting different streets of the city. Bilqees has given birth to four sons. Only her eldest son was able to study till 5th and then started work to financially contribute to the family. Bilqees has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband who wants to improve his business further. With the loan, he will purchase required ingredients such as spices, potatoes, cooking oil, etc., to prepare a larger quantity of food to sell and increase his profits. Bilqees is hopeful that a loan investment will improve the financial condition of his business.

loans.use: to buy required ingredients for a Punjabi food selling business.

loans.name: Cheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheang, 37, has established a small family home located in Baray district where she lives with her family. She is blessed with four children, all are still single – two are employed and two are studing in the local school. 

To earn a living, Mrs. Cheang sells bean juice in and around her community by using a motorbike purchased from her previous loans.  She can make $5 in profit a day to provide for her family. She gets help from her husband in producing the bean juice.

Mrs. Cheang will be using this new loan which she is requesting to buy a used motorbike (Tuk Tuk) for her husband to run a motor taxi service. She believes her family can increase its daily income with this Kiva loan.

loans.use: buy a used motorbike to open a transport business

loans.name: Kry

texts.en: The woman shown in the picture is Mrs. Kry.  She is 41 years old and is a humble mother who has three children who attend school. Since 2000, she has been cultivating rice on the farmland that she inherited from her grandparents. Her husband also works with her on the farm.  In addition to the current farming work, Mrs. Kry’s husband also raises and sells animals.  He buys them from the villagers, fattens them for a while and then sells them for a profit. Because the animal  sales business is the most important source of income for her family, Mrs. Kry requested a loan for her husband to buy an extra cow to raise and sell.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a housewife. She spends most of her time staying at home and carrying out her household responsibilities. She has given birth to two sons. Both of them are rickshaw drivers. 

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her elder son. His rickshaw is out of order these days and needs immediate repair work; otherwise, its engine will be seized and he will lose a valuable asset. He uses his rickshaw to provide pick-up and drop-off services to different school children which earns him a good income every month. Razia is confident that after the repair work, her son will be able to run his business smoothly again and increase his profits. He has been operating his business for the past eight years and Razia is confident that a loan investment will help him improve his business condition. 

Razia is a new loan user and this is her first application to Asasah.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw.

loans.name: Phoem

texts.en: Mr. Phoem is a married man who lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. He is a father of three children, one is still of school-age while the other two are now married and have started to live in their own homes. Mr. Phoem is a construction worker who works in and around his community. Additionally, he and his wife also earn income from producing and selling Khmer noodles. Mr. Phoem is currently having problems with his house  – so many parts are broken and always need to be repaired.   Therefore, he would like to seek a Kiva loan to add to his savings to rebuild his house. He is very happy and thanks all lenders who make his loan possible.

loans.use: rebuild his house

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida is a very supportive lady. Along with her household work, she manages her business sewing clothes very well. She is very skillful in her work and receives a good number of orders every month. The income she earns helps her pay for the utility bills and the school fees of her children. She has given birth to four children: two of them are studying while the others stay at home. 

Abida's husband is a fruit vendor by profession. His shop is located in the market where he offers his clients fresh seasonal fruits at good prices. 

Abida has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her husband’s fruit selling business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits for selling in his shop. He has been operating his business for the past three years and Abida hopes that after the loan investment his business will grow further. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Abida.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits for a fruit selling business.

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya is a very supportive lady by nature. She is a housewife but she also helps her husband financially by sewing clothes for neighborhood clients. She is the mother of three children and all of them are getting their education by attending a local school. Her husband is a farmer. He works in the field and grows different seasonal crops. After cultivating the crops, he sells the harvest to customers at profit.

Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides to grow different seasonal crops and get maximum outputs from the field. He has been doing this business for the past 15 years and Surriya is hopeful that a loan investment will make her husband’s business more profitable and her family will be able to enjoy better financial benefits as a result. 

Surriya is a new loan applicant and this is her first application to Asasah. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Surriya.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for an agricultural business.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Руcтам житель Кумсангирского района. Ему 24 года. Он женат, имеет двоих детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается торговлей на рынке "Дусти". У него имеется торговая точка со складом, где он продает в оптом продукты питания. В этой области он уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения нового холодильника и для покупки муки, сахара, колбасы, сосисок.
texts.en: Rustam lives in the Qumsangir area. He is 24 years old, married, and has two children. His wife is a housewife. He works trading in the market “Dusti”.  He has a shop with a warehouse where he sells groceries wholesale.  He has been doing this for five years. He is taking out a loan to buy a new refrigerator along with flour, sugar, sausages, and hot dogs.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator along with flour, sugar, sausages, and hot dogs.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Salamatu .  She is unmarried and has no children.   She has four other dependents, some of them help her with her business and the others go to school.  In 2009, Salamatu established her local food restaurant business. She began her business because she dropped out of school and found business as a means of livelihood. Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Salamatu requires a loan in order to buy more food. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Salamatu plans to build a house.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more local foods for her business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is a 52-year-old married woman with three children. The oldest child is 30 years old while the youngest is only 10 and goes to school.

Eufemia is a farmer and tills her own land located in Banga, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for 15 years. Eufemia sells her harvest to rice traders. She usually earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month from doing this farming. Eufemia also put up a sari-sari (variety) store to help augment her income. Eufemia wishes for her family to be happy and healthy always.

Eufemia's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina is a very supportive lady. Along with her household responsibilities, she operates a small vegetable and fruit shop adjacent to her home to financially support her family. She sells different seasonal vegetables and fruits in her community and earns income for the family.

Amina has two sons. Her eldest son works in a factory, while her younger son works in the field and grows seasonal crops. Amina couldn’t provide them educational opportunities due to poor financial conditions. They had to finish their education early and start working. Now they are settled in their work and also contribute to the family financially from their earnings. 

Amina has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to improve her fruit and vegetable selling business. With the loan, she will buy fresh, quality fruits and vegetables to sell. This will help her sell more and earn a better income. She has been operating this business for the past five years and is very confident that an investment will be productive for her business and make it more profitable. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Amina.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Deen

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Deen. He is married and has three children, aged 14, 5, and 2 years. He has one additional dependent in his younger brother, who helps him in the business. 

In 1996, Deen established his pharmaceutical drugs, toiletries and cosmetics business. He began his business because he was unable to continue school; he started up a small-scale business that he has developed over this period. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 1,100,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000.000. Deen requires a loan in order to buy pharmaceutical drugs, toiletries and cosmetics for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Deen plans to restructure his drug store to standard levels and to educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and toiletries for his business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Aminata, who is married to a businessman and has two children aged 13 and 11 years. She has one additional dependent, her husband’s niece, living with them so she can attend a good school. In 2006, Aminata established her provisions, drinks and toiletries business as a means of earning enough income to help her husband provide for their family. Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,700,000 every month from this business.

Aminata is requesting a loan of Le 4,000,000 to buy more foodstuffs and drinks for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, she plans to send her children to the University of Sierra Leone. Aminata thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more toiletries, provisions and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Janilyn

texts.en:
Janilyn is 52 years old and married with 2 children.

Janilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari  (variety) store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries. 

Janilyn has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 18 years and also earns an income from coconut farming and raising cattle.

Janilyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married with 4 children; 2 attend school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Maria is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Maria buys and sells fruit and vegetables to make a living. Maria has requested a PHP 26,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Maria has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business so that she can buy trucks to deliver her products.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Selma

texts.en:
Selma is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetable selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase fruit and vegetables to sell.

Selma has been in this business for 8 years. Selma earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut and farming rice.

Selma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business and send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Cerelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Cerelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dealing in collectible items. Cerelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Cerelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her home.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marieven

texts.en:

Marieven has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the sari sari (variety) store for 5 years and also earns income from vegetable vending.

Marieven aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva is 31 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Melva is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Melva has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from the village of Lusot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Aida is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $70 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional noodles, sugar and canned goods for resale. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional noodles, sugar and canned goods for resale.

Socorro is 64 years old and married with nine children. She earns a living by selling flowers in the Philippines. She has been selling flowers for fifteen years and also earns additional income from rug making and a sari-sari store.

Socorro is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy plastic bags for her flowers. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags for her flowers.

loans.name: Salima's Group

texts.en:
Salima is 48 years old and married with five children: three daughters and two sons. Her eldest daughter does sewing while her second daughter is a school teacher. Her remaining children are getting their education from a local school. 

Salima is a very supportive lady by nature. She assists her husband financially by sewing clothes for neighborhood clients. She does this work at home and receives regular orders from neighbor ladies, fulfilling them on time to earn an income. Her husband operates a grocery store in the market. He offers his clients different daily use items like cooking oils, biscuits, spices, sugar, etc. He is well known in his area for his good customer dealings and quality items. 

Salima has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband's business. With this loan, he will buy groceries to sell in his store to increase his sales and income. He has been operating this business for the past seven years and Salima is very hopeful that an investment will bring better profits to her husband and improve the condition of his business. Salima is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Salima.

loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Kroch

texts.en:
Mrs. Kroch has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and usually generates an income of $2.50 per day. Her husband works with her in the farm field, in addition to his job as a construction worker.  Mrs. Kroch also raises piglets behind her house to earn extra income. 

Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Mrs. Kroch and her family, she has requested a loan in order to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale.  Mrs. Kroch has two children, one is single and the other one is married.

loans.use: buy piglets and pig feed

This will be her 5th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.name: Kishwar's Group

texts.en:
Kishwar is a hardworking lady. She owns and operates a dairy business from home. She has some cows which she milks. She shares the financial burden with her husband. She is also a very good housewife and manages her household responsibilities very well. Her husband is a farmer. He owns a piece of land where he grows different seasonal crops and earns income for the family. 

Kishwar has given birth to three children. Only her eldest son has started attending school. He is 7 years old and studies in class one. 
Kishwar has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband who will use the money to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to grow crops and get maximum output. He has been operating his business for the past 15 years and Kishwar is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to him. 

Kishwar is a new loan user and this is her first application to Asasah. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Kishwar.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for an agricultural business.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is from the village of Balite, Bugo, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 30 years old. Cheryl is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling electronic loads from several networks like GLOBE, SMART and SUN in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Cheryl joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional electronic loads. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

location.town: Balite, Bugo, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en: Hezron, a 41-year-old, sells maize to earn a living for his family. He has been in the business for ten years. He hopes to buy a lorry for transporting maize to the marketplace because of the expense of hiring a vehicle.  Hezron has become more confident in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya, because he knows that he can access business loans easily.  He has requested 35,000 KES to buy maize.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en:
Gerard is 33 years old and is a married man. He has a 5-year-old child.

Gerard is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. He tills his own land. Gerard has been growing rice and corn for fifteen years. He earns about $150 per month from doing this farming. He has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Gerard hopes to build a better and bigger house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Huruma Group

texts.en:
Johari, who is in her mid-thirties, is married with three children who are still at school.  She has been selling second hand clothes from door to door for five years now. She works from 10:00am to 6:00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Johari's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the clothes stock and has paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy a bale of second hand clothes, so that she will have a good stock of clothes.  Her dream is to one day open a big store where she can sell her clothes.

Johari will share this loan with her loan group "Huruma", which has a total of fifteen members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Johari is standing and holding a baby.

loans.use: to buy a bale of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en: Dorice is 38 years old and married with four children.  She runs both a cosmetic shop and a general store.  She has been running the business for eight months.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has gained business ideas.  This has helped her to sustain her business.  She hopes to have a wholesale business in the future.  She has requested 20,000 KES to buy sugar, bread and soaps.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bread and soaps.

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Mrs. Kem is a rice farmer from the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province.  She  has been working in the agriculture sector since 1999. She has been a widow for many years after her husband died of senility. Presently, she lives with her two married children. One of her children raises ducks and pigs and sells them at the market every three or four months. Unfortunately, the ducks are not growing big enough due to lack of food. To help solve this problem, Mrs. Kem has requested a loan that she will use to buy duck feed to fatten her daughter's ducks.  Mrs. Kem, her granddaughter and her grandson are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: buy duck feed.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is from the village of Guinitan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 35 years old. Cristina is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop, selling rice per kilogram, sardines, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Cristina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase an additional sack of rice, junk foods and canned goods. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

location.town: Guinitan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Hanifaan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan is 36 years old and married with six children: four sons and two daughters. She couldn’t provide them with an education due to financial constraints. Her husband works in a government organization. His income is not enough to meet the financial expenses of the family. That’s why Hanifaan supports him by doing work in people's houses. She is a very hard working lady and performs her routine tasks very well along with her job. 
Her eldest son has a furniture showroom. He is expert in making wooden chairs. Her second son also helps him in his business. Her remaining children stay at home and don’t do anything. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who wants to expand his furniture making business. With the loan, he will buy wood, nails, furniture polish, etc. to prepare more furniture and earn a better income. Hanifaan is hopeful that by investing the loan into her son’s business, he will expand his business and increase his profits. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loans, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Hanifaan.

loans.use: To buy wood, nails and furniture polish

loans.name: Desdemona

texts.en:
Desdemona is from the village of Tablon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 55 years old. Desdemona is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of manufacturing and selling candles to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $350 a month for these activities.

In 1995, Desdemona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

She is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials like kerosene and wax. This will be her 14th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun is a 54-year-old farmer who lives in Prey Chor district. She is married to Mr. Bou, age 61. This couple works together in the crop-planting business.  They have been blessed with eight children: three of them are married and five are still single. Three of their children are employed in various occupations to make money. This family is be able to generate an income of approximately $3 a day. 

In a short time ,of their children will marry, but they do not have enough money to hold the ceremony. So Mrs. Yun would like to request a loan from Kiva in order to hold the wedding ceremony for her child.

loans.use: hold a wedding for her child

loans.name: Nestor

He is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be his 4th loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
